name: Hostel Iguana Azul
description:
Nice, small, quiet hostel a few blocks from the centro in Copan. Clean bathrooms, hot showers, free wifi, parking on the street in front of the hostel or a few motorcycles could be fit into a courtyard behind the locked gate. 
400 lempiras for a private room with shared bathroom for two per night.
Nice owner from the US.

name: D&D Brewery
description:
Cool brewery with beautiful gardens. Quite affordable but you have to use the bare parking lot for car camping. No shade and lots of mosquitoes (in the rainy season). Garden for tent camping.
Camping: 4 US$ pp.
Wifi in restaurant. ddbrewery.com

name: Luna Jaguar Hot Springs
description: A beautiful hot springs 20k down a dirt road from Copan Ruinas.  Series of 10-15 pools scattered throughout the jungle.  Although we didn't camp here, we asked the attendant and he said it is fine to camp in the parking lot for 100L/vehicle ($5).  Price: 100L/vehicle ($5).

name: Campamento - Trujillo
description: Camping at a hotel on the beach a few miles past Trujillo.  The hotel was unoccupied and they let us park the trucks between the hotel and the beach.  On-site restaurant, bar and beautiful pool. Clean bathrooms, outdoor 'rinse' off shower, free, fairly fast wifi  Price: $12/night.(oct 2023 - 700lempiras / ~29$)

name: Omega Tours
description:
Camped in the parking lot of the lodge and tour company.  Camping was free with purchase of rafting trip, well worth it!  Clean bathrooms, cold showers, free but slow wifi.  

Update 2023: not pet-friendly

name: Margarita Beach Hotel
description: Decent, clean hotel set across the road from the beach.  Very buggy, right next to a marsh.  Room with 2 double beds, ensuite (smelly) bathroom with hot water showers and 4 people was $25/night.  Price: $25/night

name: Bayview Hotel
description: Small hotel right on the ocean.  Tiny, cramped bathrooms with hot water showers and fridge in rooms.  Supposed wifi that worked 1/8 of the time.  No kitchen, but the owner let us use her grill.    Price: $29/night.

name: La Tigra National Park Visitor Center San Juancito
description: A good alternative to staying in Tegucigalpa, although the entrance road to the visitors center was very steep and narrow.  Also some hairpin curves with unforgiving ditches. At the El Rosario visitor center they let us camp for free with access to the centers bathroom and showers, although we didn't try the showers.  Very small spaces, nothing much bigger then our rig could fit.  Free!  Price: Free

name: Hotel Gualiqueme
description: Hot ! Parking in hotel carpark. Shade is available. Swimming pool and bar/restaurant. WIFI from parking lot. US20 per night. 24hr security and just off PanAm. Water spigots in car park – no power. About halfway across Honduras if rushing across.

name: Sol De Copan
description: Delicious beer and food. We had the Salchicha (homemade sausages) and escalope (schnitzel), 130L and 180L respectively. Beer is home brewed, when we visited there was a hefeweizen and a dark lager, 75L for a half liter. Wine, white and red, is also available.

name: Mauricio's House
description: A small camping area at the end of a football pitch. This is right across from Copan. There are a couple guest houses nearby with showers that we were able to use, and bathrooms as well. Price was 150L.

name: Finca Paradise - Bioesfera
description:
A finca near D&D brewery with a lot more room for camping. 9 dollar per person per night. Pool, showers, a beautiful garden and more. Places for tent campers on the grass. Big rigs might fit in here but it would be a tight squeeze. Wifi available. Electricity outlets available at the base of the light poles. Bring an extension cord. 



UPDATE JULY 2018: now called Bio Paradise - signs lead you all the way.  Don’t look for a finca sign.

name: Pulhapanzak Waterfalls
description: Amazing waterfall and pools. Great way to cool off on a hot day. Camping is allowed in the parking for truck campers but if you have a tent there is a special area with views of the falls!  Price was 280 per night for 2 people, which included entrance to the park. Highly recommend the hike behind the waterfall. It is amazeballs!

name: Paradise Found
description: A hotel on the beach about 15k east of la ceiba. Spent a night here and then caught a ferry to Utila the next morning. Good food but rooms were filthy and run down. May be able to camp here; not much room for big rigs though. We could not fit through gates.

name: La Ceiba Ferry Terminal
description: Caught the ferry here to Utila. They go to Roatan as well. Price for a one-way ticket to Utila was $28 USD. You can probably camp in the parking lot here if you are desperate. Parking was $115L per day and is now 259l per day (motorhome) or 184/day (normal van/car).

name: The Lighthouse
description: An anazing hotel over the water in the bay. Super clean rooms and great wifi. Amazing spot to relax after diving. We loved it here!

name: Utila Dive Center
description:
Great dive shop in utila. 
http://www.utiladivecenter.com/en/

name: Finca Las Glorias
description: Lakefront hotel / restaurant with secure parking for our truck camper.  Dogs allowed.  Swimming pool, wifi, electricity, showers, 200 lempiras per night.

name: Aguas Termales
description: Camping area is basically a parking/rest area near some pools. You can walk to hot springs. Family who runs the place is extremely friendly. 100L per person per night.

name: Balneario San Francisco
description: A swimming pool, play ground, football pitch, camping area and more. Nice place to break up the drive from the coast or the lake to the Nicaragua border. Paid 150L per person which included entrance to the swimming pools.

name: Finca Bavaria
description: Finca Bavaria is located in the city center, and let you camp on their property. A friendly old man was taking care of the place when we were there, and they have a restaurant. We went into town for dinner, and it was a really nice little town. Feelt safe, and there were plenty of restaurants and some grocery stores.   Price: 200 Lempiras

name: Hotel La Esperanza
description: We were looking for a place to camp, and we'd heard that people had been allowed to camp in this hotel's fenced parking lot. Not so this time. We asked several of the hotels in town, but the only place that would let us camp was the local Texaco gas station in the city center. Too noicy and too crowded for us in our roof top tent, so we decided to check in to a room.   Price: 280 Lempiras

name: Balneario Valle Escondido
description: Small Meadow Court, no infrastructure, a lot of dogs barking at night and some traffic.     Lempia 150.00 / night without bathrooms  Directly on the road CA 14

name: Thermas Balneario del Rio
description:
Wohlfühlplatz on meadow, showers and toilets. 5 hot thermal baths of 32-40 degrees. very quiet.     Lempia 240.00 / night incl baths     (avoid weekends and holidays!)  Km 7 Carretera a Santa Rosa, before Gracias Lempira

a perfect place for some days longer to stay. you can rent a cabana etc., or we stayed here in our own motorhome 300p/n, power extra. The pools are clean and have div. warm temperatures. :-)). erverything is very well maintained. the staff is very nice and some speak english. you will enjoy the place.
May 2019: Price is 240L per person

name: Restaurant Sabor Latino
description: Good overnight place on meadow, beach, sea clean and good for swimming, pretty quiet.     free, but it is expected that you consume something in the restaurant.  On the Caribbean, near Puerto Cortes

name: Botanical Garden "Lacentilla"
description: Good to stay overnight in the great botanical garden. Otherwise no toilet available infrastructure. Quiet. 300.00 Lempira / Admission and night  South of Tela

name: Park Touristico
description: Beautiful picnic area in the pine forest with covered picnic and barbecue areas. Quiet. Pool available, but only open on Sundays. Lempira 60L pp / night.  Valle de Angeles, about 30 km from Tegucigalpa

name: Casa Alemania
description: Good place to lawn, right on the beach, toilets and showers, water, wifi. Good food, Gunther and Paula cook many delicious European food on request. Swimming pool and washing machines, quiet.     Lempira 200.00 / night, from the 7th Night, it still costs Lempira 100.00 / night.  On the Caribbean side, Trujillo

name: Football Danli
description: Good to go to camp overnight next day across the border to Nicaragua. No infrastructure. Pretty quiet at night.  After supermarket "El Colonial" ca.1.5 miles, right side

name: El Rincon del Toro
description:
- camping behind a restaurant
- not a bad place, but nothing to write home about
- free
- bathrooms (water did not work)
- the place was partially lit 
- gate was somehow closed (fastened with a piece of rope)
- there was no fence, so anybody could walk in there
- pizza was ok, the whole place looked nice, but the service was quite bad
- generally an emergency place to stay if you are headed to Las Manos border and it is getting late

name: Taller Ochoa
description: Legit for a little shop in Pena Blanca. We had some minor work done here. There are several auto parts stores in town, too.

name: El Pital
description: $10 for empty lot on top of the mountain, beautiful views, and very quiet. 4wd required and 1+hr off the highway. Just follow the signs for el pital until you're on top of the mountain.

name: Don Miguel Hotel and Restaurant
description: They let us park and camp in their gated lot as long as we bought dinner. Super nice owner speaks perfect English and was very welcoming. Dinner was good too! Toilets available while restaurant was open.

name: Helen's Hotel And Restaurante
description:
Big shady lot with gate that's closed at night. Beach access from hotel. Free, but we purchased a meal. Really great place to stay before heading to islands.

Edit: Now charges 200L per car...

name: Galaxy Wave Ferry
description: Travelled here from La Ceiba, left our car in the secure lot, and stayed at a house through Roatans Backpacker hostel. Our dog rode in crate and cost $350L each way, he was able to ride with us to Utila and only cost $100L each way.

name: Grissy`s Hotel and Hostel
description:
Hotel, Hostel and RV-Camping up to 25 foot, we stayed at the lawn close to the pool,The owner and staff is very friendly, most of them speak english language, the Restaurant offers good food for all prices,  free Internet was very fast and a good thing ... they have a coin operated  washingmachine. A Taxitransport in town was less than 2 $,
Walking to the beach was only 50 meters,

name: Casona del Valle
description:
Beautiful restaurant with ideal location at km 28 of hwy 6 between Tegucigalpa and Danli. Mario and Graciela, the owners, welcomed us warmly and let us park on a level concrete pad in the secured/guarded parking lot behind the restaurant with all night access to the bathrooms.

We spoiled ourselves with a pizza de la casa (their speciality). Definitively the best pizza in Honduras!

The place is as awesome as any resort you can find...Anywhere! Highly recommended!

Only downside was no showers

name: Bueno Veterinario
description: Animal hospital, where we picked up heartworm medicine for our dog.

name: dentist
description: Claudia Zelaya, dentist. Decent dental work for a fraction of the North American prices. This is a good place to catch up with neglected dental work.

name: Cerro Azul-Meambar NP (Pancam lodge)
description: Truly stunning and quiet National Park. Ok, will admit we never camped here but only because we didn't know you could before we went. Wen't for a great walk up into the cloud Forrest. On the way out I asked about camping and they have a camping area there. They quoted me 100lps per person per night in a tent and it seems to have great views over the valley. They have dorm rooms (250lps). They don't have cooking facilities but no idea if they would let you use your own. Bobby who own D&D Brewery (where we found out about it) thinks it's the best NP in Honduras. The drive up is reasonably tough....  We have an SUV which doesn't have 4x4 and it was ok but steep in places - that said it didn't rain but being cloud Forrest apparently it does rain a bit. Lots of loose gravel, steep in places and needs a little bit of clearance. Doubt big rigs could do it but never drove one!

name: Mechanic Freddy Umberto Bonilla Gomez
description: While driving this remote road (very bad condition) we had a problem with the van. Luckily we found local mechanic in Lauterique village. He worked with us till late at night and then in the morning, and helped us to get back on the road. Very friendly and welcoming family, we spent a night in front of their house. Mechanic has experience with land rover, BMW, Nissan, Chrysler; speaks few words of English. He asked for 50 USD at the end.

name: Camping By The River
description: Free. Leveled open ground by the small river. There is a clear road after the bridge to the right (traveling North) off the main highway. The unpaved road goes for about 500 -1000 m until it comes to this open space. When we came locals were fishing and hanging out, they told us it's safe to stay here for a night plus brought us firewood to help us make our grill for the evening.  Not the prettiest spot, but we enjoyed it more than a service station, plus there's jungle around and green mountains in the backdrop.  Quiet night, in the morning heavy machinery appeared to do some excavation work.

name: Real Vista Hermosa
description: Paid L1300 for a double room, plus L200 for the dog. Closest hotel to the Border right on the highway. Classy place with pool, restaurant etc. and a bathroom about 10 times the size of our camper. Very clean. TV and AC. There is locked parking lot at the back, security out front. We had to whine to get the dog in our room.

name: Hotel Quinta Alejandra
description: overlander friendly, pool , showers, electric 110v. secure large villa, pet friendly. 200 limperas per nite all inc phone #9830-0721 or 3228-8123

name: Aqua Park Hacienda El Jaral
description: very pleasant spot for the first day in Honduras. Large grassy field in front of the Balneario. The camping fee of $ 7 / person includes the admission fee for the Balneario. Clean toilets, cold outdoor showers. It's about five minutes by car to the ruins of Copan.  Alternative campsite:  Right next to the parking lot of the archeological site you can camp behind the Texaco gas station for 50 Lempira / day.  ($ 7 / person)

name: Balneario Aguas Termales (Hot Springs)Presidente
description: Night in the parking lot above the Balnearios (free). To use the Balnearios a 30 or 50 Lempira / person admission fee must be paid. The Balneario is made very appealing, has great hot pools and toilets. The parking for the car was not ideal, because  we had the feeling that half the population of the village was walking by at night.  Good base to visit the pottery village of La Campa (about an hour drive).

name: Roli's Place
description: Beautiful backpacker hostel with huge garden area. Located in the center and only 80 m to the Caribbean sea. Bathroom with cold shower and toilet. Free WIFI. Free rental of bicycles and canoes. Free potable water. Beautiful and very well kept garden to hang out with open kitchen, covered dining area, hammocks, table tennis.  To the fort of San Fernando it's just a 5 minutes walk ($ 4.50 / person), one hour to the waterfall El Chorro.

name: Hotel La Hacienda
description: Not a classic campsite, but a good example of how to find a safe place to stay for the night. We asked at the front desk of a large hotel with secure parking lot if we could stay there. The answer at the front desk was "No". We then insisted a little pushy that we came "all the way from Germany" to here. Thereafter the boss was called who had no problem to let us camp overnight for free. Clean toilets, free WIFI.

name: Freizeitpark El Florida
description: Great campspot in a small pine forest in the equestrian and recreation park. Small zoo with sheep, deer, tapir, parrots and macaws right next to the site. Clean toilets and cold showers. Small pool. Very good restaurant with Honduran specialties. Mila, the Czech owner (?) let us camp for free but thought a tip of 100 Lempira for the night guardian was as appropriate.  Good base to visit the La Tigra National Park and the old mining town of Santa Lucia.

name: Villa Alejandra
description: Camping next to the pool behind a small hotel just before Danli. Located on the hillside and far from the noisy main road. Clean bathroom with cold shower. Extremely friendly, elderly owner: Mario Alfredo. Unfortunately the pool was painted so we could not use it. Covered poolside seating.

name: Hotel Palacio Real
description: $300 L for 2 people, 1 dog per night.   Looks shabby from the street but the rooms are big and clean, no a/c, no wifi.   The reception seems to close early, around dusk, maybe 6ish.   The parking area is gated.

name: Cabanas Los Pinos Mountain Resort
description: Beautifully landscaped resort. We asked to eat in the restaurant and park in the bottom lot. They were very friendly and said no problem. We were here in the low season so they may get too full in high season to allow for camping in the lot.

name: Aqua Splash
description: They allowed us to camp here for one night. Free. On parking lot. The Aqua park costs 170 lempiras per person. We did not use it. Safe. Guarded and locked gates at night.

name: Car Parts For VW La Meta
description: We found plenty of parts for our vw bus that couldn't find in Guatemala. You can also ask for mechanics here

name: hotel cadatur
description: Enclosed parking for bikes or car or small van. Maybe clearance issue on gate for bigger vehicles. Friendly owner half German half Honduran speaks Inglis

name: El Amatillo, El Salvador to El Amatillo, Honduras
description:
Normal crossing procedures but can be slow. Very friendly and professional officials

Make sure you have originals and copies of all your documents.

Complete online pre-check, up to 3 days before crossing. 35usd for vehicle. 3usd for passport. ask for receipts (boleto)

In addition, just for dogs... make sure you declare your dogs here at the SEPA and get the paperwork with the stamp. when we came through and got our tip they did a quick visual inspection and saw we had dogs but didn't seem interested in charging us to enter. but you will absolutely need this paper at the border to leave Honduras. they wanted us to drive all of the way back to the border station we crossed at to get it. but with some pleading they allowed us to fill out the proper papers and get them stamped without the long drive back. we were told we needed that exit paper for the dogs from Honduras to get the paperwork done at the IPSA, but Nicaragua didn't ask to see the old papers.

name: El Poy, El Salvador to Antigua Octopeque, Honduras
description:
El Salvador into Honduras.  

Exit El Salvador: - First Aduana, . No costs. Just hand over the Temporary Import permit and they'll cancel it. - Then Immigration. Again, they just check you out of the system. No stamps in passport, only at airports and seaports (CA4).  

Into Honduras: - First Immigration: 3$ pp entry tax, receipt is handed over. - Then Aduana for the vehicles. Slow process. Get the paperwork done, then  pay the fees at the bank (L712 per motorcycle = 35$) and then back to Aduana. Needs 2 copies of everything.

Pets/dogs: Go to SEPA next to migration, they do a thorough health check, bring a recent health certificate and proof of vaccinations. Pay the fee which is the equivalent of $20 in lempiras, you can pay by card here. Takes about 20-30 minutes.

Update 2022: We could pay directly at the office in cash (Lempiras only, equivalent of $35 which is L784 at the moment, no change) and didn't need any copies of anything). Got stamps in both passports and an extra stamp for the vehicle.

name: El Florido, Chiquimula - Guatemala to Copan Ruinas, Honduras
description:
Guatemala to Honduras in El Florido - read James’s description on 13/05/23 - it is clearer and more up to date than what is written here at the top.

Guatemala customs across from the parking lot and up a little hill. Show your import paper and they will ask for you to get 2 copies of the import paper (they made the copies after cancelling the permit for free), plus your passport and license. 
If you plan on returning to Guatemala, don't cancel your  TIP,  just make it a temporary exit.   

VIN will be checked and you will get two copies, one for the Guatemalan guard that is behind you.  Immigration next door.  
Drive  100 feet into Honduras. Park on the right, in front of the office. 
Immigration and get your passport stamped. A sign on the wall said the fee was $3 USD, but the official asks for 25 Guatemalan Quetzales.    
Next door  to customs. Need copies of  passport, license and registration. 
Fill out  paperwork and theneto the bank next door. 880 Honduran Lempiras for the import permit. About $34 USD.   Back to the customs office with your receipt and get your papers. 
No insurance is necessary nor available. 
Fumigation may be required.
Guard will check papers as you exit.  

Its possible to temporary stop your import papers to Guatemala and go and visit Copan Ruins.

name: Balneario L.M. Hot Spring/Cabanas
description: Looks like a run down place but people are very friendly. A Cabana with WC for 300 Lempiras per night for one person, 350 for two. Cabana immediately on the hotspring (incl. in price) so you don't need a shower. Springwater is 30 degrees Celcius. Simple restaurant services. No wifi, signal 10 meters higher on the road. Bring a mosquito net. Access is very steep but concrete/rocks.

name: Mados Hotel Guanacaste, Choluteca
description: Decent hotel if you want to break up the drive through Honduras... On a Friday night he quoted us 750L with a receipt or 600L without... In dollars he wanted to charge us $30 without receipt (20L/$1) but we got him down to $25 for the night mentioning we were just passing through to Nicaragua and wouldn't be using the pool. Good WiFi connection, security and parking in the patio, includes A/C and TV.

name: Hotel Granja Delia
description: Good hotel while pricy it has buffet breakfast, huge room a/c, warm good showers, handy supermarket next doors. We had a rough journey as got lost so it was a great stop to recharge. Parking for big RV cost $929L two people

name: Steakhouse de Montaña
description: We asked if we could park in the parking lot behind gate for the night and have dinner at the restaurant. Restaurant happened to be closed that day but it was no problem to stay the night. No charge! We could use the very nicely decorated bathroom, very clean too. There was a guard dog at the gate during the night. Very quiet night. English is spoken. The restaurant is at the entrance of the little town Santa Lucia on the right side of the road.

name: Puerto Cortes
description:
In the parking lot of the Playa Puplica facing the Hotel Villa del Sol, facing the sea, quiet at night. 
.....
Sur le parking de la playa puplica face à l'hotel Villa del Sol, face à la mer, tranquille la nuit.

name: La Tela
description:
On the free wifi free beach of the municipality, WC and shower, clean beach 

Sur la plage gratuit tranquille wifi de la municipalité, WC et douche payante, plage propre

name: Santa Rita
description:
In the street next to the central park and next to the town hall super quiet wifi city tap water on the square 

Dans la rue à côté du parque central et à côté de la mairie super tranquille wifi de la ville robinet d'eau sur la place

name: La Esperanza
description:
In Calle 8 next to the hotel posada, right next to the central park and the national police 

Dans la calle 8 à côté de l'hôtel posada (code wifi posada20) juste à côté du parque central et de la police nationale

name: Puma Gas Station
description: We needed to stop between Guatemala and Nicaragua andwe were too cheap to pay for a hotel. This gas station did the trick. The attendants were nice as was the shotgun-carrying guard who works all night. There are bathrooms and a mini-mart. No charge to stay.

name: Centro Campestre El Potrillo
description: Driving from Choluteca to El Espino (border between HN and NI), just before the town of San Marcos de Colón on the left side lies El Potrillo.  It is a horse riding facility with cabins, pool and a restaurant.  We had to stay there due to issues with my vehicle papers, which we sorted out with a lawyer in San Marcos de Colón.

name: Parque Nacional Montaña de Celaque
description: Parking next to visitor center. Beautiful park with hiking trails. All facilities brand new. Road steep but mostly paved. Very quiet. Picknick area and new restrooms. Entrance 120 lemp. per person plus 100 l . for camping.  No wifi, no Claro signal.

name: canopy extremo
description: canopy extremo, 6 lines, looks fantastic! had been there at semana santa and because we had been the only tourists besides approx. 30 hondurians they tried to charge us 700 lempiras instead of 500. so because of that and the very long waiting time we deceided to leave but it looks like huge fun. last km is very steep, have fun.

name: Colonial city center
description:
Beautiful square. 

Nice placa with church
You can go up the oldest clock tower from america and have a nice view. 30 pP.

name: Campamento Palabra de Vida
description:
From user - "The owner Romeo welcomed us with pleasure. We were able to use the toilets, the hot showers and a little wifi. Very calm, no tobacco or alcohol inside. "

huge fenced property in the mountains with guesthouses, soccerfields, basketball, pool, minigolf and even paintball (!?), not really a campsite - actually this is a holiday-camp for young christians, highseason in january, when we were here, there was only a small groop of US-American volunteers
we asked the (english-speaking) staff to stay for one night on this beautiful property, after a short while they said yes, but excused that there's nothing to offer us - no problem, we have everything in our van!
parked next to one of the guesthouses, then the super friendly and welcoming staff came again and showed us a clean bathroom with cold shower and even a small room with double bed to use, invited us for coffee and breakfast next morning
wonderful people, cool and calm night, one of our best stays in Honduras! Price: for free :)

name: Caseta de peaje / toll gate
description:
Clean toilet and clean shower. 
Police 24 hours. 
We stop here 5 p.m. only to sleep.
There is a big pavimented plan area to park our car.

name: El Bosque Hotel
description: We could camp on the large hotel property wherever we wanted to put our camper, which was nice to get a bit away from the highway. we could use the office toilet (closed after 10pm), after 10pm you can probably use the ones in the restaurant, ask the night guard. showers on request. water faucets around. slow but OK WiFi.

name: Uno petrol station
description: They allowed us to sleep there. quite gas station with lots of space. They close at 10 pm but there is a security guard all night. there is a restaurant with wifi. very kind all the staff. and free! they are going to open shop, bar and toilets soon.

name: Pupuseria Mary
description: great restaurant!!! from 15 to 25 each papusa. great meal!!! good wifi!! Don't miss it, typical food!!!-

name: triunfo de la cruz
description:
Excellent place to camp is free right on the seafront ask for Mrs. Petrona is located in the Garifuna community very good people and the food very delicious 

excelente lugar para campar es gratis justo a la orilla del mar preguntar por  señora Petrona esta situado en la comunidad garifuna muy buenas personas y la comida muy riquísima

name: Valle De Angeles
description: Large flat dirt parking lot in town. It's 20 lempira to park for the day or 40 to park for the day and night. It is guarded all night and is very quiet at night, even on a Friday night.

name: Hospedaje El Mirador
description: Great place and alternative place to stay. They have a room that is $100L for the night with no bathroom but your car or motorcycle is safe behind a huge gate they close around 10pm.  Room is nice and basic has everything you need like a bed to sleep in and peace of mind your vehicle is safe. Police and military patrol the area day and night so it's super safe :)

name: Tropigas
description: The only place I could find in Tegucigalpa that could refill my US propane tank. It was also the quickest refill I've had out of 5 in Central America. In and out in less than 10 minutes. Coat for a 20lb tank was 170 lempiras.

name: Alineamiento M y G
description: Excellent mechanic. I was told they were the best and cheapest in town and I believe it. Problem is they don't carry many parts. But they were VERY helpful tracking down the bearings I needed for a 97 Dodge Ram. The owner even drove me around to pick the parts up. Highly recommended.

name: Texaco. Possible to overnight
description: Texaco gas station with foodmart. Foodmart is closed at 21:00. Possible to stay at guarded (all night) parking.

name: Camping at the Beach - Free
description: We asked the restaurant if it's ok to stay overnight right next to it at the beach. They said it's ok and were a bit surprised we are sleeping inside a van and also gave them a small tip. The restaurant had good fish! Pretty hot if there is no breeze. There is also a restroom and outside showers by the restaurant, I think it's ok to use them and it's open all night.

name: Captain Morgan
description: Laid back hostel with friendly staff. Good and quick responses via email. Dorm room 10US (if you dive it's 7US that day), only with fan, free wifi. If you want AC it's an additional 15 US per day/divided by people in room that want it. There are also private rooms available. If you do a dive course (we did open water) for 288 US you get 4 nights for free. Dogs are welcome, but not allowed in the rooms. Our pup was hanging out anywhere else and liked the place. When we were diving we left him at the hostel outside. Street dogs come and go, but are friendly. Especially if you travel with a dog it's a great place to go.

name: pico bonito
description:
You can camp to the river Oria ask for Don Oudulio Calix or Chepe Nuñez a very good people the payment per person is 35 lempiras very good place you can make campfire and cook in it a good experience sleep with the sound of the river .. I recommend 100% 

se puede acampar a la Oria del rio preguntar por Don Oudulio Calix  o Chepe Nuñez unas muy buenas personas  el pago por persona es de 35 lempiras  muy buen lugar se puede hacer fogata y cocinar en ella una buena experiencia dormir con el sonido del rio .. lo recomiendo 100%

name: Mango Inn
description: Tuesday pizza night - buy any pizza and get the second for free. Really good wood fire pizza! Margarita 220lp plus 30 per extra topping.

name: Hotel Posada Del Valle
description: Ok place to stay. We weren't allowed to camp in the parking lot so we had to take a room as it was very late already. Cheapest Room with ac 416lp, with fan 297. Dogs are allowed if they don't bark the reception lady said.

name: Centro Turistico Guayapito
description: Very nice place, large even parking lot where you can stay for free. Pools 100 L per person, and we had a nice dinner in the restaurant. Gates close at 8 pm and open at 7 am, no guard, but the owner lives here, so it is safe, and relatively quiet - not much traffic during the night. Toilets open all night. No WiFi.

name: Soccer Field
description: Camped next to the soccer field. There are some trees for shade and you are kinda hidden from the road. The next day the police showed up. They were very friendly and wanted to see the import permit and car registration. They were talking with us (the little bit of spanish we spoke) and were curious about the set up in our van. After a while they left us alone to finish making coffee and packing up to head for the border

name: Posada Del Mar
description:
ADMIN NOTE: Opening this place again - see check-in from the June 9th, 2018. "It's directly next to the Hotel y Cabanas Playa Caribe..."

Beautiful property with nice clean pool. Lounge area, cabins to rent. Electricity if you have a long enough extension. Outside showers. Clean restrooms. 50 meters from the beach. View of the beach from the pool. BBQ place. Security at night. The owner François is really welcoming. Call Abel Saavedra at +50496589808 so he can help you get boat tours to Punta Sal (Janette Kawas) National Park. We loved this place. 300 L per vehicle to camp. $15 USD best deal for what you get in town.

name: Miami - Coastal Village
description: Beach front camping by the home of Alejandro Alas. 100L per night. Basic facilities. You can get the most affordable boat tours to Laguna de Los Micos and the beautiful Punta Sal (Jannette Kawas) National Park from especially if you get a bigger group. For boat tours ask for or call German Aguero at +50496072311 or Abel Saavedra in Tela +50487689410. 4x4 Recommended.

name: Familia Velazquez (Avelio/Bertilia)
description: Wow, not enough incredible things to say about this place and these people. The adventure starts the moment you hit the dirt road in San Geronimo and drive 20kms through the mountains of Parque Nacional Montaña de Comayagua to reach the community of Rio Negro (4x4 and high clearance highly recommended). The Velazquez Family owns an organic coffee farm (the brother of Avelio sells it in Minnesota!) and have opened up their beautiful land to folks to camp on. 75L per car per night. No bathrooms for campers (yet!) but they can open up one of their cabanas for you to use, if needed. No wifi but they do have electricity (not at sites). As of now, there are two areas to camp - near the river or at "the vista," which is flat and has an incredible view of the valley. Bertilia, the wife of Avelio, is also a great cook (vegetarian chorizo!) and offers breakfast, lunch, and dinner for an extra cost. And when you're wanting something active, you can take a hike through dense forest up to two waterfalls: Los Ensueños (50 min) and La Gavilán (1.5 hours and ~70m tall!!). No need for a guide - the trail is well-marked. We spent here 4 wonderful nights here and when we weren't outside enjoying the forest we were drinking coffee w our new friends in their kitchen :)

name: Parking lot by Pollolandia
description: Parking by Pollolandia next to Gas station. Safe. Free.

name: Jungle River Lodge
description: Great place by the Cangrejal River. Only one leveled spot for a mid size rig if you're camping. $12 USD per vehicle per night. Cabins, rooms and a home available for rent. Great views, superb rafting, nice zip-line. Close access to hikes in Pico Bonito National Park. Very nice hang out / bar restaurant area with view of the river. Nice and refreshing river pools. Oscar, the owner, is very friendly and accommodating. We recommend rafting and canyoning with Juan Carlos. You can do canyoning only when water levels are down. We had an amazing time!!! Don't let the simple looks of this place be deceiving. It is a little gem and very affordable. Fast internet, nice showers and restrooms. Staff is also super nice. To check for availability email Oscar at jungleriverlodge@gmail.com

name: Cesar Mariscos Hotel & Restaurante
description: The heat wore us out pretty fast so we decided it was finally a good opportunity for some legit "hotel time." They have two hotels: this one (~$70/night with breakfast) and the "annex" which is 3 blocks away and a little cheaper (~$50/night no breakfast but all the same facilities as here). Secure and guarded parking lot for our car around was the corner. Tela is a bit grungy but we were super happy with this place - clean, cozy (w really comfy beds!), friendly, and has a pool!

name: Alton's Dive Center & Hostel
description: Great dive shop away from the hustle and bustle. Super friendly staff and definitely one of the quietest hostels on the island (they stop serving alcohol at 7pm). We did our advanced cert here because we couldn't pass on the $275 special they were having. "Fun" dives are also very cheap ($35/tank). The accommodations aren't the nicest but it wasn't much of a problem because we were outside or diving most of the time anyway. Has a kitchen (with big fridge) for guests to use, wifi, etc. Lots of sand flies on the island - bring baby oil!!

name: TranquilSeas Eco Lodge & Dive Center
description: This beautiful and sustainsble eco lodge has killer views and the owner, Chris is a fellow overlanding enthusiast. If you are looking to treat yourself in paradise you should check out their website to book a cabana at tranquilseas.com. If you are planning an extended stay on the island, ferrying your vehicle over may make sense. There are a lot of places to explore on the island, so a vehicle is necessary. If you ferry over with your vehicle, Chris may acommodate you to park on his property. Email him directly at tranquilseashotel@gmail.com. They also rent paddle boards, kayaks and have a lovely patio restaurant/bar and pool. A great place to stay or stop by in Roatan!

name: La Villa de Soledad B&B
description: A really lovely spot right across the road from (or ON) the Rio Cangrejal. We weren't super excited about the options in this area (because most of the places barely have space for a car) so we decided to inquire here and are so glad we did! They're technically a B&B but, depending on how busy they are, the owner, John, will allow you to camp on his beautiful, flat, and spacious property. (Or if it's time to splurge and relax in a hotel, this is the place to do it!) But if you decide to camp, you have two options: Up the driveway (4x4 required!) near the main building which has electricity, bathrooms, wifi, and running water ($6 per person per night). OR he also owns the grassy patch of land at the bottom of the driveway that does *not* require 4x4 and is essentially on the river but there is no bathroom, electricity, etc. (Not sure how much he would charge for this)

name: Hotel Casa Real
description:
Very quiet place with big bedrooms large parking lot.
Very nice pool. 
They don't allow to sleep in your RV.

name: Parque Nacional La Muralla
description: Camped on our vehicle right next to the visitor center. 25 Lempira per person for park entrance fee. Free camping. Cabins / dorms available for 300 for two people. Restrooms and electricity in the visitor center cabin which is closed at night. There's a park guard who also guides hikes at 6-7 in the morning. There are 4 hike of different lengths to choose from. From the little town of La Union drive up the road to the park 14 km. The road is gravel but in ok condition. 4x4 may be needed during the rainy season.

name: Aldea El Guayabo
description:
This is a small village deep in the woods. Very warm people that like to talk and to know new people. I stay in the soccer field that belong to the community.
Very steep hills and 4x4 is needed.

name: Picnic spot on a creek
description: Nice spot to have lunch and a swim. The locals love it on wknds. Nigth very quiet.

name: Laguna San Julian, Mujeres Emprendedoras
description: 20 kilometers away from Danli, a very nice, quiet and safe place, large área that you can choose where to camp at the shore of the lagoon. If nobody is in the office you can continue 1 mile and ask for "Yanixa de el grupo de mujeres emprendedoras" in the nearest houses or call to +504-9909-9753 or +504-9676-0925. To enter you need to pay 1 dollar/person and to camp are 10 dollars/car but you can pay less if you talk with them.

name: Pico Bonito
description:
Very nice place, boss Richard is English and likes to talk a lot with travelers. Swimming pool overflowing overlooking the river with a waterfall at the bottom. During the night possibility to park inside (big rig max 24 ft). Hot and clean showers. Good Wifi. Excellent food (the best camarones you've ever eaten!) All the same $ 15 per course. Parking, showers, swimming pool free by eating. There are three dogs on site but the pet owner acctroisles. Drinking water available.


Très bel endroit, le patron Richard est Anglais et aime beaucoup parler avec les voyageurs. Piscine a débordement donnant sur le rio avec au fond une cascade. Durant la nuit possibilité de se garer a linterieur (big rig max 24 ft). Douches chaudes et propres. Bon Wifi. Nourriture excellente(les meilleurs camarones qu on ait jamais mangé! ) comptez tout de meme 15$ par plat. Parking,douches, piscine gratuits en prenant le repas . Il y a trois chiens sur place mais le propriétaire acctroisles animaux. Eau potable disponible.

name: La Tigra National Park, centro visitantes Jutiapa
description: Very well maintained area with big parking lot. Also have special areas to set tents. The park is very big and have like 6 to 8 different trails very well marked that you could do by foot by yourselve. We made the Esperanza and Cascada trails  (both like 10 kilometers in 3.5 hours). The road is very well maintained (we do it in a compact front wheel drive car) a few step hills. We paid 250 lempiras (like $11) for the entrance and for camping one night for two people. It's a beautiful park if you enjoy the nature.

name: Parking lot between petrol station and restaurant
description: Parking lot a little off the highway, between Puma service station and restaurant, across the street from police station. Very quiet from 20-6h, might be noisier on weekend nights. Sun and shade, level, rubbish, felt very safe. Free.

name: Parking lot next to restaurant
description:
Level gravel lot a little off (and invisible from) the highway. At night they close the entrance (with a simple fence,  no high-security measures). Sun only, no shade. The lot does not belong to the (pretty fancy) restaurant but rather to the family living in the barn-like shed right by the entrance. I left them 20 L. Had a very quiet night, felt safe.
Coming from Tegucigalpa and heading for Valle de Angeles, turn left about 500m after the Santa Lucia turnoff.
Room enough for an aircraft carrier or two.

name: Centro de Servicio
description: Garage has multiple lifts.  Mechanics seem to know what they're doing.  I had wheel bearings replaced in a Ford F250.  Took them a day to get the parts from San Pedro Sula. They couldn't get grease caps so they made them. Price was a fraction of what the job would cost in the US. No English is spoken.

name: Centro Turistico Sambo Creek
description:
Small concrete level parking lot right by the beach. Next door is Centro Turistico Sambo Creek, run by TouristOptions agency in La Ceiba.
This is where boats leave for trips to Cayos Cochinos. Call ahead to TouristOptions to find out about sailings/schedules, minimum five people. Paid about 950 for a half day snorkeling trip which was great. Left the van here during the day and slept here two nights in the van. Busy with (friendly, respectful) locals, especially around 7 in the morning and after sunset, but absolutely quiet at night.
I was reassured (and, at some point convinced) that the car was safe here, and that nothing had ever happened to any car here before.
Local watchman kept an eye on the car, asked for a little tip, so he got 80 for two days and nights.
Parking is free, probably even when not booking a trip to the keys. Neighbours offered to use their water tap and toilet hut. And then you still got the Centro Turistico bathrooms which the watchman will open for you on demand.
Beach is nothing special. Saltwater spray to the car is not too bad.
One big rig should fit, but locals will be curious. Access road thru town is bumpy.

name: Island Shipping
description: Shipping agency to ship your car or truck to Roatan. Four sailings a week. vehicle only, no passengers. Should you insist to drive your vehicle onboard, you have to be at the dock around 4 am for loading. Arrival at Roatan same day around noon. Cost for a VW bus: 8100L return.

name: Nice lot between houses
description: This is a nice, pretty flat lot next to a comedor, surrounded by trees and (then) a few houses. You won't have the place to yourself but it's reasonably quiet during the day, dead quiet after 20h. At night a few trucks might join you, so you're better off in the slightly higher lot. Good overnight stop. Facilities probably during opening hours at restaurant but didn't check. Free.

name: Wide open field infront of orphanage
description: Large grass/dirt field about the size of a football field (and right next to one). Pretty level, no shade. The christian-gringo-run orphanage centre is not operating, so no kids. Parked right next to the entrance/guard hut. Friendly guys, let me use bathroom. Area is not fenced-in, no security guard at night (sleeps in a house about 200m away. Very quiet. 13'C at night. Restaurant next door. Free.

name: Ferreteria parking lot
description: Level concrete parking lot of Ferreteria Santa Fe and Fremoni's Café (coffee, breakfast, sweets, wifi). Right by the highway, can't miss it. Out of town (San Jeronimo), so it's quiet (apart from a little passing traffic). Watchman on duty at night, felt very safe. Toilet and shower available. Free.

name: Hotel Antigua Comayagua
description: Large secure parking lot that could accommodate truck camper when needed a few nights not boondocking. Moderate price includes breakfast. Two blocks from historic central plaza.

name: Hotel y Restaurante Mario Chavez
description: Stayed here for one night (850HNL) in a nice, clean room with A/C. Nice  family owned place. Good restaurant. Safe parking. Stayed with a Toyota Landcruiser of 2,20m height.

name: Petrol Station
description: We filled our Propan gas tank. They use it for the cars.  Cheapest Propan of all our travel in South America for 14 month.  Very friendly staff.

name: Macaw Rescue Center
description: Highly recommend to visit. They take care of injured macaws and try to set them free again. We had a very interesting tour with guide who was included in the price of 10 US$ (July 2018: no guide, but plenty of signs in English so you can learn lots of interesting stuff about the birds. Price still $10)

name: Tropical Inn
description: 600L/$30 per room per night. 55km away from the border with El Salvador. Large secure parking, shops and restaurants walking distance away. Large rooms with en suite bathrooms (cold water, obviously). AC, TV and clean.

name: Texas Guesthouse
description: nice and comfortable place. we payed 800 Lempiras for 2 Person. The owner helps a lot with tips and stuff you need. A little breakfast is also included. Internet is a little tricky. Water is really warm and the rooms have enough space and Power supplies.

name: PUMA gaz station
description: Perfect place to overnight, 25 minutes before el salvador border. Big flat secured area with table, tree for shadow, WC, kind of shower, small shop. As usual, quite noisy. Price free.

name: Puma Gas Station
description: Gas Station. Security at night. Toilets close at 23 h with the shop. Be prepared for the loud music from the restaurant. Price: free

name: Texaco Gas Station Camping
description: texaco gas station with food a few km from las manos with large grass/directamente area behind. bathrooms & cold shower all clean. outside tap for water, all free but Purchase something in return

name: Palmira Hostel
description: Great hostel with amazing staff. 220L per person in the dorm and 5$ the hammock. 200L pp just to park and access (April 2022). Large, clean facility with strong wifi. Very minimal parking, our truck/camper was on the street with 2 cameras watching over it.

name: Estacion de servicio
description:
You can fill pots and tank here. Very fast We pay for a 25lbs bottle 180lamp


Se puede llenar boteillas y tank aqui. Muy rapid
Pagamos por una boteilla de 25lbs 180lempira

name: Casa Encantada
description: Not a backpackers or campsite but a very nice and new upscale  hotel for L1150 (hearty breakfast included) in Danli. Not much choice in town. They have a large secure parking and a gorgeous patio. Good internet...perfect to relax before or after the border crossing.

name: Hotel Doamar
description: Nice Hotel for L500 for a double room . Good internet, large gated parking. Noisy road but a good stop after the long gravel road from Olanchito to Danli

name: Roatan Backpackers Hostal
description: Very nice hostal run by the friendliest person (Mel). She is very welcoming and will give you tips about the island. Nice atmosphere and place

name: Shark Dive
description: Amazing shark-feeding scuba dive near Coxen Hole. Operation is dodgy though and price is high at 100USD for the crappy boat which took 40mins to start the engine for our return. Having said that, the actual shark experience is very thrilling! I guess the boat trip is more dangerous than the sharks...

name: Police check point
description: standard police checkpoint. nice people. very professional.

name: Casa Blanca
description: Best Deal on Utila 20$ for a Double room with private bathroom, the owner is very Nice and helped us in any Kind of problem.

name: San Rafael Cafe
description: Restaurant with espresso bar, grow their own coffee, produce local cheeses including Gouda and manchego and many more. Breakfast ranges from 120-180L including coffee. Many fancy grilled cheese sandwiches, cheese/meat trays, bruschetta, and wine. Pretty garden setting. Also sell bagged coffee (whole bean and ground), bottled beer, and packages of their cheese.

name: Aside El Naranjo arqueological site
description: Parked just outside the parking lot of El Naranjo arqueological site. Felt safe; very quiet.

name: Comayagua San Francisco Park
description: We stayed here two nights. Very lovely colonial town. Free parking aside the park, just in front of school. Safe!

name: Danli Central Park
description: Nice little town with very friendly locals. We stayed here two nights after entering from Nicaragua. Loved this place! Free parking and free public wifi from the plaza.

name: Fresh Bakery & Cafe
description: Serve breakfast and lunch Mon-Sat. Bake everything on site and it's all good. Egg breakfast for 110-140, bagels start at 60, lunch 120-150 (sandwiches and salads). Espresso bar, fresh juices and teas, smoothies.

name: Balneario Los Lobos
description: Beautiful balneario right on the river. This part of Rio Cangrejal is perfect for swimming. The grounds and facilities are well-kept. Clean but simple flush toilets and cold showers. There are picnic palapas with bbq pits. Lots of space under the trees for campers or smaller RV’s. It’s about a mile before the Pico Bonito visitor center and river lodges, so it’s close to hiking and rafting. There were only a few people there on the weekend and none during the week. The entrance gate is on the right with a small sign that says Balneario Los Lobos, if it’s locked and no one is around, inquire at the house directly across the road. Enrique, the caretaker, lives there and will open it up for you. Enrique and the owner, David, are lovely people and checked on us regularly to see if we needed anything. There are electric outlets at the palapas, but we didn’t use them, so not sure if they would want extra money or not. There is also a water spigot at each palapa. No wifi or tigo available. 100 lempira per person/per night. We checked out all the other camping options in the area, and for us this was definitely the best!!

name: Gran Hotel Yadaly
description: we camped in their parqueo next to the swimming pool.  we got them down to 350L for the night, including use of the pool and facilities. Fairly good WiFi near the building and nice friendly people. they let us hook up our electric at the bar. the showers are open showers next to the pool.

name: Hotel Isis
description: Small hotel just a short drive from the border with Nicaragua. L300 for a single room with no AC. Rooms with AC and larger beds available. Wifi cuts in and out but when it works it's a decent speed. During my stay there were power surges which ruined most of the lights in the rooms, also some TVs, smelled of electrical fire. Secure parking just around the corner for vehicles.

name: Propane
description: Filled our 20 gallon removable propane tank. Charged 225 lempira

name: Carnitas nia Lola
description: Really groovy cool bar with good food a huge personality. Must visit!

name: Agua Purificadora La Gotita
description: Agua purificada. 24L (1USD) to fill our 20 litres container.

name: Crossing El Salvador - Honduras border close to Perquin
description: We drove all the way to this crossing point thinking of reaching La Esperanza, in Honduras, just to find out that these border officers couldn't  deal with our foreign car's paperwork (the exit stamp). We had to drive back and head to El Amantillo.

name: Bomberos Nacaome
description: Perfect for cycle tourers. Lots of space to pitch tents. Quiet. No kitchen facilities but toilet and shower. Very friendly firefighters. No wifi but electricity sockets.

name: Paradise Divers
description:
diving school
free accomodation with course or 2tank dive
very basic simple room with shared bathroom and small outdoorkitchen
all equipment and gear are a bit worn down
the prices 58us$ for 2 tank dive
35us$ for nightdive
258us$ for a openwater course

name: Casa Tina
description:
I asked around when I arrived late in this area. People recommended me Argentina's (that is her name) house. If you want to feel like living the real Honduras you will be at the right place. Accommodation is simple but has everything you need. Shower, sink and wide bed. From the window you can look down the nearby river. Little town in 5min walking distance. I had my motorbike parked close to the house but space is very limited. Cars can maybe park outside. Just ask around... The lady is really nice and she was taking good care of me. We didn't really speak about a price. I gave her 500 Lempiras which included the room and food for the time I stayed. She seemed to be quite happy with that. Note: This is a family stay and to much of negotiating can be considered rude. Just enjoy being part of the family for a while...
Tel: 97939190

name: Angeli Gardens with JUNGLA Brewery
description:
Amazing craft beer/food. Cool place to spend a day.  The only place in San Pedro Sula for RVs.
Restaurant , Craft Brewery, hiking trails and Ziplines on site. Enjoy the manicured gardens and very safe and friendly enviroment.
Welcome!

name: Multiplaza Mall
description: Spent one night on the parking lot if this upscale mall, with a Walmart/Paiz supermarket (the food court has some wifi). Asked first the security guy about staying overnight, and he agreed without hesitation. Felt very safe, security around all night. The parking lot is not big, and mostly covered, but there was one spot suitable for our 28' camper just on the left at the entrance.

name: La Colina Hotel
description: Simple but nice budget hotel with parking for cars and motorcycles. Had a lovely room in the second floor. The once downstairs looked a little bit run down. Paid 280 which seemed to be alright. The town is quiet and there is like 0 tourists here. So it makes you feel like being really in Honduras...

name: Ranchitos Manglares Restaurant Parking
description:
ADMIN NOTE: WARNING!!! Thefts and vandalism reported in this location. Please use caution. 

Update! Our truck was just broken into. They busted the passenger door lock and almost broke the driver door lock. Luckily nothing was stolen. Just a heads up. A nice place but keep your eye on your vehicle.

name: Gualaco-Instituto de conservación forestal
description:
Just a safe place to stay for the night. The caretaker let us in and allowed us to camp.
Very friendly but not yet accustomed to tourists. 
Shops and restaurants in town.
We gave 50lemp propina.

name: Sambo Creek Free Camp
description: Public gravel parking with no obligations to any restaurant, hotel or people to ask.  Free. No services, gate or rifle-man. Walking distance to some streetfood. More then enough space and easy access for all rigs. Quiet and peaceful.

name: Hotel La Caxa Real in Gracias
description: Very nice, clean hotel with fast WiFi and warm showers. Price is in the medium to lower range with great value. Private parking off the street. Walkable to town center but tuk tuk is only 10L. Gracias is on the smaller scale in terms of city size. I spent only 1 night here.

name: Caserio Valuz Country Inn
description: Very cosy place, there are rooms and dorms and Jorge will probably let you camp if you ask. Rooms are pricy but you should ask for a discount. The dorms are priced ok.

name: Hotel La Guadalupe
description: Clean, quiet location with off street, gated parking. 750L for one night for one adult. This includes a room with air conditioning, TV and WiFi. WiFi speeds are average but reception is poor in the rooms. I would say this is a mid to upper quality hotel for a good price.

name: Balneario Los Cipreces
description:
Nice and quiet overnight place on the grassy shady parkinglot. As we stayed here midweeks, they cleaned the pools and the restaurant was closed. So it was extremely quiet ;). Seems to be busy on weekends.
We agreed to pay 200L/night/2 people.

name: Hotel Guanacos
description: Great hotel run by a Dutch owner, double room with bathroom $35 USD, comfortable beds, clean and nice rooms, hot showers, fast wifi, beautiful gardens, good restaurant and great views over the town, secure parking, highly recommended. Worth the money. May be possible to stay in your vehicle in parking lot with access to toilet facilities, we didn't ask, as we needed a break from camping. Big rigs may have trouble turning into parking lot.

name: El Restaurante de Julio
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Was originally reported at 14.15322, -87.04798, but another entry suggested correct location is at 14.15684, -87.04534 which this was updated to. Please confirm this is correct.

A good restaurant on the main road into Valle de Angeles: coming from Santa Lucia, on the left hand side, right before crossing the bridge that leads you into town. Julio has an amazing garden area where tents and RVs can fit. Bathrooms available, no shower but a big cold water container available if you want to take a shower with buckets. Julio is super friendly and he'll tell you everything about the little nice town. No night life here. There's a guard that stays starting from 8pm when the restaurant closes.

name: Fruit Check NORTHBOUND
description: Coming from south there's a checkpoint, fruits and tomatos are forbidden, all other vegetables are fine.

name: Mado's Hotel
description: 20 dolars for twin room. Very clean with safe parking. The cheapest we found in the city. Rooms are spacy, with air conditioner. Parking soace is big enough for any size but there maybe a height restriction in the entrance. We parked our bikes even under a shelter. Wifi is average but working for most needs. There is potable water in the garden. Very close to wendy's to eat great burgers :) absolutely loved this place.

name: Hotel Mejia Batres
description:
250L for 2 people 1 night. safe parking behind gate. 
ok wifi but only near reception.
not super clean but ok for a night.

name: Tipicos Papusas Juanita
description: Great little restaurant, very friendly family establishment. L20 papusas and bebidas. Other food offered as well. On right hand side when heading uphill put of the city.  Mirador a la cuidad tambien.

name: Cuevas de Taulabé
description:
Really cool cave. The first 300 meters has illumination and a foot path. After that, you need a guide. But you can climb around a little yourself.
The entrance is 30 lempira adulto y 10 nino.
Ppen from 8 to 4 every day.

name: Cascada el Ensueños
description:
70 meter high waterfall. 1-1,5 hour hike through dense jungle. We were there all alone. The trail is in bad condition and there has been many landslides. to get on to the trail  you have to climb up the side of the road about 10 meter away from the original trailhead.
there is another waterfall even further up the trail but we were hot and hungry to turned back at the first.
it's an adventure.

name: Hotel Victoria
description:
Cheap hotel with a grumpy old man in the reception. The rooms were clean. No wifi. we payed 300L for 2 persons 1 night.
no private parking but we could park 2 bikes in the reception.

name: Parking of canopy extreme, La Campa
description:
Unlevel (you probably need levelers) simple but big  parking outside of the canopy. Steep rough track to reach it. We arrived a saturday in June, no one around. I quess there are only people around the canopy if some one is doing a canopy ride. No office or other facilities. Asked police in La Campa. Consider overnight stay safe. You are high above La Campa and there is view towards the mountains and canyon.
Very quiet. Free.

name: Public Balnearia in Rio Lindo
description: A public river access site in the town of Rio Lindo. As all public sites in Central America some litter. Depending on where you park and the size of vehicle you are not or a little visible from the road. A country road, though, and very quiet during night. No facilities but close to small shops and eating places in town. We asked both locals and the nearby police if the place is safe for overnight. They all considered it safe. During a weekday it was very quiet, I guess weekends can be different. Free.

name: Guanacasco Restaurante Tipicos
description: good tip thanks. great food, friendly guy. we stopped for lunch on our way to Gracias. Had we been later in the day we would have asked to park-up for the night. big flat grassy area suitable for all size vehicles and tents. There are clean toilets outside the main restaurant (didn't see shower) I can't imagine the nice guy would refuse a night stop.

name: A cote du park municipal
description:
Quiet and pleasant place to cross the border. Place of the village, next to the church, the neighbors are friendly.

Endroit calme et agreable avant de passer la frontiere . Place du village , a cote de l eglise , les voisins sont bienveillants.

name: Posada Sandra
description:
22 dollars a night, two people in a big room with ac, wifi, water, private bath and secure parking. Clean.

Downstairs is a great and cheap restaurant. Good coffee, great steak, amazing chocolate cake.

Friendly owner and room for lots of bikes, cars and big rigs.

name: Chez Milady
description:
Nice bungalow style apartments 10 minutes out of town, in the forest, owned by an eccentric Honduran artist who decorated all apartments with her nice paintings There are a variety of rooms, from standard double hotel rooms to small and large apartments with kitchens and living room areas. All rooms have a deck with chairs and hammocks, as well as private baths. Some have AC which is $5 USD extra per night. 

We stayed at a small apartment with a kitchenette including a stove, oven, sink and fridge, plus all cooking utensils and a dining table. We paid 40 USD per night, an awesome deal. Cooking at a real kitchen was a nice change of pace from our camping setup. Everything is well designed, clean and very nice. Some apartments can accommodate up to 6. Book online at booking.com. Or call and make a reservation directly and the owner Milady will discount your price by 15%, same as the commission to booking.com.  

Since it's a little out of town, its best to rent a bicycle or motor scooter for transport. It's also pretty easy to hitch  rides on motorcycles or quad bikes.

name: Pico Bonito Centro de Visitantes
description: Entrance fee for the 3-hours-hiking to the beautiful waterfall El Bejuco is 8usd or 180hnl pPers. Parking overnight is safe, quiet and free.

name: Tela gas
description: Tela gas Fills propane cars here and has tanks. They have one truck "Eco gaz" that can refill canisters. It's not always here.  We chased the truck down and caught him just down the street as he was driving away.  Refilled on side of road for us. Phone number is 2440-5061/2440-5565/ 3178-5072.

name: Caserio Valuz
description:
Zambrano, where I live, is around 1 hour North West of Tegucigalpa, in the countryside. It is half way between Tegucigalpa, the capital and Comayagua, the ex-capital of Honduras, more or less in the center of the country, half way from the Bay Islands, Copan and Nicaragua. Directions: 1,5 kms Camino a La Catarata Escondida. Zambrano, Francisco Morazan. 
Buses from the North to Tegucigalpa, on the main highway, get off by the 1st pedestrian´s bridge or from Tegucigalpa to the North, by the 3rd pedestrian´s bridge, in the town of Zambrano at km 33, at the "Camino a la Catarata Escondida" (way to the hidden waterfall), named as well "Carretera al batallon" (road to the battalion), or calle empedrada (cobbled street), then 16 minutes walking or 5 minutes by a small moto taxi for 15.00 Lempiras to Caserio Valuz, my home. If you call me when just getting here, I would pick you up as well, cellular phone 99964294. The country code for Honduras is 504.

name: Lagolandia
description:
Update: no access with car anymore, only by foot. Staying the night at the parking lot is allowed. It’s 1 minute walk to the lake. 

In Lagolandia there are 2 restaurants and between them there is a dirt road (no 4x4 needed, ground is solid), you drive by them and to the right and get right at the lake, amazing view and swimming spot, we arrived early in the morning and asked the ladies if we could pass, the lady said we could if we bought something, 2 coffees later and we were in paradise, we later spoke to the place admin who allowed to stay for the night, there is also a guard at night, safe and private land

name: Sian Kaan
description: Beautiful secure grounds offers ample space and amenities. includes outdoor kitchen, pool (not working currently), sauna (not working currently), and cabanas. Close to the ruins. Walk to Centro 10 min.

name: Puma gas station
description: We asked the guard to overnight. Cost 5usd but we needed to leave before 6 am. Not the most beautiful spot but we wanted a safe place. There were some trucks spending the night as well and the armed guard stays all night.

name: Wild camping Grotto parking
description: Grassy spot next to the grotta (chapel carved in mountain). Nice view over town. However, we advise not to sleep here, but go to the central plaza (church), in front of the police station instead. We slept at the Gruta  but at night some young guys came, started fighting with each other and throwing stones, until people who live there must have called the police. We were never bothered, but it could have been different. Driving of was tricky as it was a one way street and we would have to pass the troublemakers.

name: Zeta Gas
description: On the right side of the road, large trucks ok. They have the adaptor to fit American style propane tanks to refill.

name: Centro Turistico Diana's Sport
description: Best stop by far in the area (as there's not really much else around currently). We walked up and asked if we could park and sleep in our vehicle, they said of course. It's almost like a mini RV park anyway, there's a restaurant (really good food) and bar, pool with slides (almost like a water park), a zip line, kids mini train, swings, gazebos to eat or relax at. We parked on the grass lawn at the back, which was nice and quiet. They didn't charge us for camping, but we ate and drank at the resturaunt and used the pool which is 100 lp /adult or 60 lp/kid. The owner and workers were extremely friendly and happy to help and thought more overlanders would be great. It's a unique dream for the area the owner has and is continuing work on. Give them some business and continue this spot for overlanders. Should be easy to spot it has red,yellow, green gate and huge yellow tire advertising for the canopy.

name: Bahia
description: We just asked if we could park overnight and the manager said yes it was fine, it's a resturaunt that closes at 10p but they had a security guard all night. They just asked for 50lp so we gave them that and a tip and bought food and drinks, which were both really good. It is a nice beachfront resturaunt and the staff we're all really nice... hopefully they would do a similar thing for others again.

name: Copan Ruins
description:
Here are the ruins. Parking is free. Entrance is 345 Lempiras per person (foreign tourist) for just the ruins. 

Tunnels and museum are extra. Rumor is that the tunnels are not worth the extra money. You will find guides here as well. 

We have read that they are a good idea, but they are a little too expensive for us today.

name: Taller De Radiadores Salgado
description:
About 5 radiator repair and make shops in a row.

Took my motorcycle radiator here which needed to be cut up to fix a leak and cleaned out of the pepper I used to plug the leak.

Took a couple of hours costs was 350L

name: Campamento Armadillo
description: We passed this place, which is slightly further down the road than this spot (200m closer to Las Naranjas). Didn't stop in but has flat area for camping and a pool. Alternative if Finca Paradise is full.  Looked nice but no idea of other details

name: Sagastume -tyres and express mechanic
description: Stopped in here concerned about our suspension. They were very professional, courteous and helpful and friendly.

name: banco atlantico
description: a bank with an atm--has a parking lot and security guard. the atm door for the atm is separate from bank door. use your atm card to get in. no transaction fees.

name: Parqueo
description: Parking in Central Comayagua, just down from the Central Park. Secure overnight 10 Lempiras per hour.

name: El Estoraque
description: Amazing food. I read about this place in one of my travel guide books and thought we should try it since our hotel restaurant food is not to brag about. We ordered one meat and one seafood parilladas and both are amazing. Please try this place, super clean and she's a wonderful cook. Mom's home cooking is what you taste here. The pickled veg is out of this world ( complimentary ).

name: Riverside Parking
description: Large rocky platform next to the riverside with a 4WD path going down (presumed boat launch for rafting company). Don't recommend during the rainy season. Can't hardly see the campsite from the road, but would still recommend setting up camp after dark. Police station just down the way-seems relatively safe, and free!

name: Taller Los Hermanos
description: Super friendly workers. The place is run by Bryan and his father, a Honduran family. They are very helpful and determined to solve your issues. We spent three hours at their workshop due to many small issues and they only asked for 500L for a great job. Place might look a little shabby but it is safe.

name: Guide for Montana Santa Barbara
description:
Even though the access to Montana Santa Barbara is free, it is highly recommended to take a guide (the paths are not signalized).
The spot indicated is Leonel Chavez's house, the only guide on this side of the mountain, and who is really good.
With him you can arrange tours for going to the top of the mountain, birdwatching, etc.
His coordinates are :
(504) 3206 7319
panamosab@hotmail.com

If you're staying at Cortijo del Lago, his son works there and can help you arranging the meeting.
We did a birdwatching tour, and we managed to see quetzals (the price was 250L per person).

To go there, you can either climb with your car (4x4 recommended, we didn't manage to climb all the way in rainy season with our 2WD Chevy van), or park in the adjacent city of Las Vegas at the main park, and from there take a collectivo up to El Cedral, asking for Leonel (he's well-known). Price is 20L per person per way

name: Padilla R. Agente Aduanera
description:
Padillar’s offices are at Bo. Copen 9- 10 Calle, 1 Avenida

The Seaboard Honduras details (for the shipping container if Padillar need you to organise this - we did container first, then Customs agent) are San Pedro Sula +504 2553 2044. Ask for Ingrid Regalado or Zuly Pérez.  We dealt with Keylin Orellana and Jenny Martínez. 

Once you are close to the date of shipping you may be better basing yourself in Puerto Cortes as it is a good hour (55km) from San Pedro Sula. 
.....
cuadra y media antes del centro penal. Puerto Cortes. 

Teléfono 2665-3152/5658

Servicioalcliente@agenciapadillar.com

name: Near Tegucigalpa
description: A good place to spend a night near Policía Nacional de Honduras and peaje. Bogota parking. Noisy but secure. Toilets and shower

name: Ivo’s coffee
description: The owner is super friendly and her English is really good. Our dog was more than welcome (she even took a picture to show to potential clients that they are pet friendly). The coffees and shakes are amazing!

name: Tela
description: This is Enrique's home in Tela. He is such a lovely guy who also has his home on airb&b. You can park outside his home for a small fee and use his bathroom and kitchen. He also has a room you can rent. He speaks perfect English and his home is an a quiet and safe part of town. We stayed for 2 nights (in his spare room we found through airb&b) to visit the gardens. His email is bonillaj383@gmail.com or his number is 32 341385 if you want to call him. He is incredibly friendly and helpful!

name: Laundry-  La Casa de Todo
description: A drop off laundry service. There's also laundry service at Iguana Azul, but both of them have the same rate: 20 lempira for one pound, (44 lempira/kg).

name: Hotel Plaza Real
description: Hotel Parking lot within wifi range. Safe and comfortable for our 24' sprinter. They imitially did not want to allow us to park overnight, but then accepted for a 200 lempiras payment for my 2 adults & 3 kids family.

name: Lorendiana Envasados y Dulces
description: A beautiful collection of home canned fruits and vegetables and chutneys and compotes and chili’s and.......  Meet the woman and she will explain the products (in Spanish)

name: Hospital Evangélico (with overnight parking area)
description: Medical services full range. Grassy lower parking area, okay to stay overnight. Received exam, X-ray, blood work, prescriptions and excellent care all for $127 USD. Do not hesitate to stop here if you need anything. No appointment needed. Full care from routine exams to emergency. Even dental and vision on site. Nurses speak Spanish. Doctors speak English. Just tell the guard that you are for a “consulta”. Show id and drive up the hill. Note- google will take you on dirt road to old entrance. Use logic, stay on paved to new entrance gate.

name: Casa Vieja
description: 24$ USD per night 2 people in a good sized, clean room. Did not ask about sleeping in the lot. Large parking lot could fit big rigs and is locked all day and night. Hot water and AC included. Cheap restaurant attached. Didn't try it but there were plenty of locals there and it looked good. Very good wifi. Nice staff even did our laundry for free. Free filtered water for refilling your bottles (not your tanks). Recommended.

name: El Cuco - cerca de la policia
description: At the entrance to El Cuco, next to the police. With good shade. Very quiet and with friendly people.

name: dippsa petrol station
description: we stayed here for a night. the petrol station closes at 9pm but the there is security guard overnight.. safe place and it's free.we gave 50 limpiras to the guard as tip but he never ask for.

name: hotel aventurero
description: parking lot of the hotel. we felt safe. toilets and outside watertap. paid 50 per car. easy going town, all people very friendly.

name: Hotel Casa Blanca
description:
Nice well-kept hotel. We asked and they let us sleep in our camper in the parking lot. The entrance gate has a bar, but we had no problems entering with our 3,6m high camper. The parking lot is not big, but there is enough space for up to medium size rigs.

Apparently we were the first with this unusual requests. They started with 400 Lempiras but quickly agreed with 200. We were not using their bathroom, not sure if they would agree. The WiFi is good, even inside the Camper. 
The hotel seems to be a bit pricey and was busy with guests.

For us this was a perfect halfway Stop from El Poy (border with El Salvador) to La Ceiba. If you start early at the border, you can make it to here in one day...

name: ATM / Not for german DKB
description:
In utila there are currently two ATMs. This one belongs to the bank Atlantida.
The other one is down the Mainroad to the east (appr. 50m).

Attention: For German Travellers with a DKB Credit Card: This ATM did not work with both our  cards. Comdirect ist working, but a daily maximum limit of 4000 Lempiras.

The ATM down the road east is not working with any of our cards. 

Our diveshop charged 8% Credit Card fee! So you might want to bring cash with you...

name: Utila Medical Center
description:
This is a private doctor/Hospital on Utila with rooms to sleep in case you need to be watched.

The standards are good for Honduras and the Staff knowledgable and friendly. We asked around in town, and everybody recommended them.
Apparently they also do dive examinations in case you need it.
They are open from 8am to 6pm but have a 24/7 emergency contact.

name: Camping at Hotel
description:
You can camp in front of a hotel, a few feet from the water. There's a shower and a toilet. Everything is very basic. 100 per night, per vehicle.
The owners can arrange a boat ride to Palacio or wherever you want to go. We paid 500 for a 1-2 hour ride.
This small town is one of the parts of Honduras where only few tourists go.
The road to Batalla is dirt/mud and sand. You should have a 4wd high clearance to get here. Please ask the locals in Bonito Oriental if it's safe at the moment before you go. We drove it in 2 days, about 9h in total but it depends on the road conditions. At the moment the upper road at the beach is closed and you need to drive inland. There are a few junctions on the way. If you like to have the gpx-track please send us an email through Facebook.

name: L.A. Utila Apartment
description:
Great place to stay. Very friendly owners, nice and clean apartments, great WiFi, nice pool, very hot showers, short walk into town, very quiet.

You can book with Airbnb or booking.com. They will pick you up at the ferry if you let them know when you arrive. We enjoyed a great week here. Much better and cheaper than the diveschool accomodation for a private room. We payed 24Usd/night for a big apartment with  fridge+Microwave and complimentary drinking water. They offer rooms with AC too...
Great WiFi!!!

name: Hotel y Hostal El Almendro
description:
Good place to rest after a long trip. 

The price for a dorm costs 4 to 6 dollars and private room costs 15 dollars (with shared bathroom probably a bit less).

The hotel is 4 streets close to the central park (in a small hill).

The staff are friendly and the place is charming, you can cook there if you wish or eat in their restaurant (depends on what the price could be cheaper or not XD) 

The rooms are clean and they have hot water (not like to cook a chicken), they provide towels and other amenities.

name: Hotel
description:
This is a hotel on the Cay Islands. Perfect to relax after a few days on Utila. Rooms are quiet nice and a double room with private bathroom and hot shower is 30 USD per night.
