If you want to have A/C it's a bit more. Free Coffee and water. Lunch meal is 7 USD. There's a kitchen where you can cook your own meal. The boat ride from Utila (beside the ferry dock) is 50 lpm per person. You can rent snorkel gear or get a boat ride arranged to the smaller islands nearby. There are restaurants (even a cheaper fast food) and small shops on the Island.
The hotel has a really nice reef in front where you can snorkel.

name: Agua Purificado
description: Place that has Ice and purificated water. They can fill your bottles. 22 per Garaffon.

name: Hotel Guacamayos Backpackers
description:
The hotel offers private rooms with private bathroom for 20 usd and share bathroom for 15 usd, dorms costs 10 usd per person.

The rooms are normally clean but also it seems to be that they don't care to much about maintenance.

The staff were normal but they couldn't provide information about the city.

name: rio santiago
description:
You can literately dine with the hummingbirds! There are loads flying around your head. 
we had lunch here, but you can also stay overnight (don't know about the price). Alex is a friendly guy and showed us the owls that live near the restaurant. There is also a kind of an ozelot cat there which we saw. short trail to a waterfall.

name: Comayagua - san francisco plaza
description: Parking on the place san francisco. Possible plug electricity on the light of the place.

name: Las cuevas de Talgua
description: Visit the cave of Talgua. 500m inside the mountain, beautiful stalagmit and big cathedral at the end. 1h inside. Price: 6 USD for adults, 100 lemp for children and 100 lemp the guide for a group of less than 10 people.

name: Main plaza
description: Central plaza close to the church. Flat place. Busy at the end of the day but quiet at night. Safe.

name: Beack Sambo creek
description:
Pass in front of the differents hotels and park in front of the sea on a grass land. Windy and only the moise of the waves. Free and quiet. The beach is not beautiful. We stay only for the night.

Passez devant les hôtels et se garer sur le  terrain enherbé face à la mer. Brise légère agréable pour la nuit et bruit des vagues. Gratuit et calme. La plage n'a aucun intérêt.  Une nuit suffit.

name: Cucuyagua
description:
On a little cute square with a lot of trees and shadow. Calm, secure and free. 

Sur une agréable petite place verdoyante. Ombre le matin. Calme, secure et gratuit.

name: Rio Mejocote
description:
Wildcamp near the rio. We used it on a dry season. Easy to cross the river with our 2wd. Some garbages as usual. Away from the road, calm. No problem with the security.

Bivouac au bord du rio. Accessible à la saison sèche,  saison humide?? Accès facile, traversée des rio sans prob même avec 2wd. Reculé de la route, calme. pas de prob de sécurité.

name: Minu Super Dinora
description: Well-stocked shop with meat, specialty milks, dairy, alcohol and other essentials.

name: Comayagua Golf Club
description:
Nice staff allowed us to park overnight in the lot after playing on the golf course. We parked near the pool area, where the bathrooms and showers are. It's somewhat level.  The showers are cold-ish but pretty clean. Interesting alternative to parking in city. 

The course is not well groomed, to say it politely (horses sometimes do the grooming in the middle of the fairway), but we looked at it as a challenge. It was affordable fun, and the mountain scenery is gorgeous. We actually played on two weekdays during Semana Santa and only saw one other group playing. So if you're a beginner, you can take your time, mess around, and not have the pressure of other players behind you. 


We entered with our 12' tall camper van. You may hear the peacocks at night.

Pool pass: 100L/person
Golf: 200L/person
Complete set of clubs including push trolley: 200L (they allowed two of us to share a set)
Golf cart (optional): 400L
Bag of ten balls: 50L

name: Guasale
description: Description of crossing from Nicaragua to Honduras.  There will of course be a truck lineup for about 5kms but eventually make your way forward and stop at white building.  Show all vehicle documents and passports.  They will give you Aduana form.  Continue through chaos and find the immigration building aptly labelled "Banco Lafise"?  Man with blue shirt will check aduana form and your vehicle (not much interest in finding anything).  Go into immigration to officer on far side of square.  Show passports and pay 45cordobas each to exit.  Continue down passage to aduana- hand over all vehicle docs and TIP - which they keep.  Drive towards Honduras- stop to give officer stamped aduana form and show receipt for exit tax.  In Honduras stop at migracion (actually has a sign on the building!).  Pay usd3 or 70limpura each. Find aduana - they will direct you to an office at the back where the SUPER unfriendly clerk will shuffle paperwork for the vehicle and take EXACTLY us$35 (for transit) as "she has no change" .  You go over the road through a maze of trucks to find nice gentleman to make copies, go back to clerk who issues TIP.  No insurance required for Honduras.  On drive out show officer TIP and you are free to go.  Just a caution:  the road into Honduras here is really bad - not recommended for night driving.  We were stopped once on this road the next day.  They searched the vehicle but did not ask for the fire extinguisher and reflective things (suspect this fad has faded).

name: Acor Forever
description: We lost our AC in Belize. found this place. no problems with business but had two very nice locals helping us. did not get the owners name. he was very helpful with us trying figure out the issue. it is a very hot country, ac is needed while driving.

name: Berakah BnB
description: Private room with 2 beds for 20$ per night. Private parking available 2 blocks away in the Berakah Hostal. You can use the facilities of the hostal even if you stay in the BnB (kitchen, pool table, parking). I asked for my cat and they said it was ok in a private room but not in the dorm.

name: Jardin Cafe Restaurant & Hostel
description: Beautiful clean hostel. 10$ for 1 bed in a dorm. Beautiful garden. Restaurant on site. They let you use the kitchen of the restaurant if there are not too many clients in the hostel. Private parking. Ok to let your pet in. Highly recommand this beautiful place. The town is very charming too

name: Taller Sosa Kaibiles
description:
We have been having mega problems with our coolant system for months.
Asked on Pan American for recommendations in Tecugicalpa and one guy came back with this place.
Mario travelled across town to look at our truck. Gave him a summary of our problems and arranged to deliver the truck to him.
Seems our water pump on our 1992 Mercedes had given up. Mario sourced a replacement.
Will give an update on whether it worked.
Just felt like mentioning this guy. He is part of an off road club and services 4x4's

name: Balneario Valle Bonito
description: Nice private clean place right at the beach with tables. Looks like a place for picknick. We have been alone, but you can imagine that at weekends it can be crowded ... The only problem is that the place is close to the road. During night it is ok, but traffic starts at 5.00.. For all kind of rigs, there is a cable at the entrance, but we got in without problems (3.65m), pushing it up a little bit. There are outside showers if you take a swim in the very warm caribe Sea! Nice folks! 300.-- Per car per night.

name: Estacionamiento supermercado Tania
description:
Lugar super seguro y tranquilo. Estuvimos 4 noches. Estas a 300 metros del parque principal. La gente muy amable. Quedas alejado de la ruta por lo que es mas seguro. 
Super safe and quiet place. We stayed 4 nights. You are 300 meters from the main park. The people very kind. You stay away from the route so it is safer.

name: Hotel Something ;-)
description: After a long driving day just before dark we arrived at this place. It's a sort of hotel and we asked if we could stay the night in our Camper. We asked if we could use the toilet and showers that was fine but we needed to pay the price for a room, 15 dollar. This room is realy not worth it, shower was not working and in the shower where standing this big cans of rain water where you can fill the toilet reservoir with ;-) The place though feels safe and although it's besides the panamericana at night it was realy quiet and nice cold. I think if you asked only to use theyr parking place for an overnight only without the toilet, it should be fine for 5 dollar.

name: Grissy‘s Hotel
description:
Camping at the hotel, 300L per camper, pool access is 40L extra pp. 
Close to the beach, about 100m. 
A bit expensive for what you get but ok for a night.

name: Hotel Green SL
description:
We checked 4 different hotels in town while scouting a route for a commercial cycling tour and luckily spotted this brand new gem when about to leave town. It is only two months old, very nice, staff is very friendly and very important for us, the manager, the chef, security guard are cyclists ;) 
At about USD70 for a room it isn’t the cheapest but it is what the town was lacking. Parking is small but there is no height limit, it would definitely fit a big rig (very likely not for camping) but It would take a big part of their parking space.

name: Laundry
description: A lavanderia that washes your cloths for half the prices of d&d brewery (5kg = 100L).

name: Hotel Elvir
description:
Great hotel right in the center of Santa Rosa, and super quiet at any time. There is a big and secure parking lot from where you can access to the room.  
Room are big and very clean. We stay 2 night and we loved it. There is a inside yard surronded by plant just perfect to have breakfast or enjoy a book. 
Staff  very friendly and helpful.
There is also a small pool on the roof with nice view of the city.
Also from the Hotel there are a couple of nice walk to do up to a view pontit and another one that goes  along a river. Very nice Hotel

name: Hotel Casa Vieja
description:
Camping at the parking lot of the Hotel Casa Vieja. 
200L for a night with access to a room with hot shower and toilet. 
There is a water dispenser and coffee in the lobby. 
Wifi very fast and reaches the parking lot. 
Run by a very nice family.

name: Marios Place
description: Sort of an unsuspecting resturant on a dock over the water. Doesnt look like much, but its fairly cheap(180L for fish plate and many less expensive items) and the food is fantastic. They serve up what they catch and have an extensive menu beyond that.  Fish soup is a hangover favorite. Homemade hotsauce is amazing as well.

name: Hotel La Muralla
description: A great stop half-way between Tegucigalpa and La Ceiba. Nice guy. We slept in our truck in the large, secure car park and he gave us a room key to use the shower. The room was clean and nicely fitted with TV and fans (no a/c required up here as it's a cool climate). Modern bathroom and the shower was the best we've had in a long time - very powerful and hot. Taking a room would have been L370, we paid L300, but we could probably have negotiated harder to get a better price. Plenty of room for big-rigs inside, cable across the gate around 3.5m high.

name: Lin Fan Comida China
description: Chinese food in Honduras? Crazy enough, there is and this scratches the itch. Fried rice with French fries and an entree was $150L. The rice was tasty and while we’ve had better Chinese food, it was a welcome change from tortillas and pollo.

name: roncador gas station
description: Garded gas station right on the highway. We slept there 1 night it was alright

name: La Flor de Copan Cigar Factory
description:
A really interesting guided tour. Not advertised, just knock on the pedestrian gate & the guards let you in. 10:00hrs and 14:00 hrs weekdays. Must wear closed-toe shoes and long trousers. Very professional and health/safety conscious inside. See the whole process from picked leaves, sorting, fermentation, drying, rolling, packing.  
Update 2023: 5$pp. 
US$3 pp (min 3 people - if there are only 2 of you, you have to pay for 3). Guide speaks English. They give out a couple of free cigars each at the end too. Really enjoyed it.

name: Hotel Sunset
description: Hotel on the Pan America highway about 30km after the border crossing from El Salvador. Clean and simple rooms with a/c, TV, Wifi and private bathroom. Off road parking through a gate. No height restrictions but it's not super wide. $22 a night. Restaurants and gas stations near by.

name: Trudy Hostel and Dive Centre
description:
Great hostel and dive center! To begin with logistics: the place is well located by the sea and has a small private beach with volleyball court and sunbeds and it is easy to drop into the sea to cool off and swim. There are plenty of hammocks and the bar has a pool table. Prices are really cheap: 330$ for the PADi and you get free accommodation for 4 nights as well as 2 fun dives if you take a class, otherwise the price for accomodation is 8$ for a shared dorm. There are several private dorms that accommodate 2 people so if you get lucky only, you can have one of these rooms for the same price (and the room has its own bathroom). You can also easily upgrade to a more expensive private room with AC for 40$.

With regards to the diving course; I was really impressed by so much professionalism. In a word, safety was always present and learning diving became a great experience I won't forget. Lots of people do their divemaster training here, so always plenty of experienced divers and instructors around.

With regards to the hostel, it is truly a younger population here (mainly from England ?) But everybody was friendly and the music was not overwhelming at all.  Found buddies all over the place. Recommend +++

name: Military checkpoint
description: A really friendly military guy asked for our papers (both our passports and our vehicle permit), asked where we came from and where we were going right now. After asking us if we smoke weed (because we are from Amsterdam) and checking the dates on our documents, he wished us a pleasant time in Honduras.

name: termas ribot
description: is a small termal Park. Very good for night.

name: amerigaz LPG in the back of comedor marita
description: They sell propane 50L for 1 gallon and they can fill american tank

name: Armed Robbery on Beach walk
description: Armed robbery on Beach walk between West End and West Bay. Guys hide on the bushes and come down when people walk by some rocks in the water, rob you and then go back up into the forest.

name: Banco de Occidente
description:
Banco de Occidente is the only bank to use for paying the TIP on the Honduras side now. They only accept Lempira for the $35 tip fee. Hours for accepting TIP payments are 9am-12pm and 1pm-3pm only. 

Exchange dollars to Lempira on the ES side of the border, even if you're just passing through to Nica the same day. 

(we were able to pay the fee at the main immigration building - cash only)

name: La Casa Pizza and Cafe
description: Big grassy parking lot, which belongs to a garage and the pizza place. Gets a bit muddy after rainfall. The owner was very nice and allowed us to spend the night on her premises free of charge. We had some delicious pizza and a silent night. Only a short walk to town. Guarded during the night. Perfect for visiting the ruins.

name: Carolane's Spot
description:
At the end of the road on the corner there is 1 place for a big rig. Pretty quiet with a stunning view on the mountain.

Felt safe

Note: overgrown and garbage

name: Patty's restaurant
description: Great place to eat beside the plaza. Good prices, fast internet, lovely owners/workers. The bathroom is clean and there's a shower in it, but I never asked to use it. The owner, Patty, told us to knock on their door if we had any issues after hours since they live right next door. Nice homey feel.  Safe to park/camp at night in the plaza too.

name: KFC parking lot
description: So we wanted to spent the night in Choluteca before crossing into Nicaragua. We went to eat at Pizza Hut and we asked the security guard if we could sleep there. He said there was no problem. Not the nicest spot but free, safe & WiFi from KFC & Pizza Hut for free

name: mini super la familia
description: Medium sized grocery store with most things you need or want with a good sized car park beside it

name: Lucerna ocotepeque
description: Flat tire check for 50 lempiras. Super nice people and efficient repair.

name: Auto llantas
description:
Tires shop with professional service. They have a wide range of products to choose from and they mount, balance and align the tires. Lucky or not, but my 4x 215/85R16 Sumitomo tires (4x4 heavy duty) turned to be surprisingly cheap... 13'000 lempiras so 542USD. For the four of them and the service. 
 I haven't missed anything, looks like a deal to me.

name: Parque Aurora
description:
Absolutely perfect place to spend a night or two. Reminded us of camping back in Canada. 

Massive, gated turisto parque. Includes a very clean pool, clean cold showers and flush toilets, boat rentals for the small artificial lake, horse riding, and ALL the camping areas! Many dispersed picnic areas with benches and fire pits.

Closes at 4pm weekdays, (or 5 can't quite remember. Think it was 5.) Gates lock and a security guard with a pair of dobermans wanders around. 

As of february 2024,  it‘s $100l per person per night for camping plus $ 50l for the pool.

We were the only people around at night (Wednesday) A dozen police swimming in the morning, team building?

If you keep left of the pool and go past the concrete pitch before crossing the river on your right you get to the GPS spot which is round the back of the lake on the water, a 3-minute walk across a footbridge to toilets and showers.

name: Aromas de Guisayote
description: Big parking lot at the highest point of the road. Some comedores nearby, where the truck drivers stop. quiet at night. low temperatures at night

name: Mitos Hostal
description:
Family owned hostel, bed and breakfast style, with swimming pool and large grass lot for camping. 

Private rooms with private bathrooms and showers. Rate is 500 lempiras per person including breakfast. 

Camping rate is 150 lempiras per person including breakfast. It is 100 lempiras per person without breakfast. There is access to clean men’s and women’s bathrooms. 

There is a gated entrance without height restriction to access the grass lot to park and camp. The gate is only 8 ft (2.7 M) wide. 

Place is relaxed, has a good vibe and staffed with very friendly family members. English speaking as well. 

Temperatures are perfect. Cool nights , sunny days. And no bugs.

name: Anibal Casa River Camp
description:
You can camp on Anibals property next to the river (beautiful spot) just ask at his house which is south of the bridge if you can stay and he will let you set up wherever you want. He speaks perfect english and is really nice and welcoming! 
Anibals number: +504 8765-1912

name: Playa Los Rios
description: Nice Beach with Restaurant and Bar only on the weekend in Nov. 2018. Chilled music,  Good food , friendly staff. Big trees, lots of shady places. Only few insects. Very quiet during the night. Paid 200 Lempiras per night.

name: Museo del Aire Honduras
description: Air museum. 50L adults, 30L kids under 7y. Small and interesting air museum, only in Spanish, history of commercial and military flying in Honduras, outdoor exhibit too. Monday closed. Tue-Fri 8:00-12:00, Sat-Sun 10:00-17:00 Apparently the largest museum of it's kind in Central America.

name: Balneario las Orquídeas
description:
Beautiful place in the forest with a wonderful camping área.
The place is run by a really friendly guy called Jorge. They started a campfire just for us. Really secure. Some steep hills and a little ground clearance needed. They charged us 80 lempiras/$4 for two people. 
Also have a cascade inside the property

name: Rainbow Village
description: Excellent hotel in La Ceiba which we needed after taking the afternoon ferry from Roatan. Secure parking. Big rigs might not but our van fit the 8 foot height in the gate. Two bedroom suite, wifi , pool, and lovely host with German Shepard. $55US. Restaurant on site

name: Hospital Veterinaria de Sur
description: Nice clinic with profesional a super friendly stuff. Helped us after we found a perrita hit by a car on the street. They kept her for the recovery and will find her a new home after :)

name: auto servicios evolution
description:
great garage even now english.
(+504)99171878 Osman

name: Villa de ADA
description:
It is a smal Hotel with a huge Parking on Gras for Campers... there is abut 4 pools, even with slides.... just a few people, showers and Toilet all there. Smal restaurant...
Big rigs no problem... up to 3.8 mtrs on the short entrance from the city side... there Is a second entrance from the other side with no height restriction.
They asked for 200. Agreed on 150 Lim. We spend 4 days here ... needed to solve a health problem...

update 10 2021 : n'acceptent pas de camper uniquement camping en tente

name: El Pescadar Restaurant
description: An open air restaurant at the end of a dirt road, directly on the Pacific shore, with volcanos in the distance. We found this place empty, a sort of rustic looking place and sat at a table in the sand, under a tin roof held up by thin logs. A lady came out and asked if we wanted food. She was very friendly. We ordered fish and shrimp. It was very good served with plantains, and very inexpensive. The owner arrived and spoke English.  Also very friendly. She said we could put our tent up right under her shelters and offered us hammocks to sleep in. The strong breeze kept us cool and kept any bugs that might have been there away. She said the place was safe, with only a handful of locals in the area, but the van was not parked far from where we set up. It was raw natural beauty.  There were local dogs around so I’m sure pets would have been welcome even though we aren’t traveling with any. Our kids played with the local kids there.  They didn’t charge us to camp there, to use their toilet, (which you had to carry a bucket of water to flush), or to use their hammocks.  I wouldn’t recommend big rigs as the road is rough and the sand soft. We were in a 15 passenger van with no problem.

name: Tranquility Bay
description: Laura and Larry, super friendly Canadian couple have luxury seafront cabanas, clean white sand beach, big garden with relaxing areas. They let us camp in the spacious and shady parking lot and use their facilities. Toilets are very clean, outside cold shower. Restaurant on site that seems delicious but we were cooking by ourselves. They have 2 tuckans, 2 monkies and 2 friendly dogs. Laura and Larry has many amazing stories to share with travellers and they welcome overlanders. Fast wifi. We paid 10$ per night per car. The property is on the right side of Campimiento where they asked 400 lemps per night.

name: tropigas
description: filled our American  tank in 10 minutes 220 lemps for 20 lbs tank

name: Restaurant Ecologico El Ocotal
description: This is an unexpected surprise! A restaurant in the front and a full blown zoo in the back. The restaurant has delicious Honduran food, at very reasonable prices. The zoo admission is free. It is family owned and operated. Inherited from the grandmother who first established it. And the family is very friendly, gracious, and helpful. We loved the zoo, especially the monkeys. It is well shaded by its own jungle. Definitely a must stop if you are in the area.

name: Bomberos (fire department)
description:
I came to ask if I could spend the night and after a minute, I was given a yes.  They took down my passport details and then put me in a large dorm style room and gave me a bed with a fan.  Had access to a bathroom and shower.

Was also given use of the kitchen and tv area.  Also had plenty of safe drinking water to refill my water bottles.  Plus, they even offered me the WiFi password.

Might not work so well for anyone traveling with a rig but they are super friendly to people traveling without a vehicle and eager to chat.

name: Border crossing
description: We came from Guatemala and crossed to Honduras - easy and fast process - some young officer speaks english pretty well - fast process after 7pm - asked if we can spend the night at the Honduras side with the trucks in the parking lot - and the officer said its all ok - safe place and there is a washroom to use

name: Street Parking
description:
Dormimos aquí una noche. Calle muy tranquila a una cuadra de la plaza central, todo el pueblo parece muy seguro!

We slept here one night, quite street. Walking one street you are in the main place. The town seems very safe.

name: Lavanderia La Esperanza
description: Laundry in La Esperanza!  There is a little gate, and you can just knock if it isn't open.  It was about $170L/load to wash and dry.  Very nice sisters who own the business.

name: Los Taquitos
description: Fabulous taco restaurant in La Esperanza.  It's also home of the California Hotdog, which is delicious!  Food is affordable, service is great, and cleanliness is taken very seriously.  Javier, the owner, came up with the idea for the hotdog while living in Los Angeles- it's an uncommon find for these parts!

name: Hotel Celaque
description: The only option in the village, but it is quite nice. Secure parking, hot water, and a few comedor nearby. Initial price was very hight, but just raising an eyebrow and asking for a lower price, I got a room for 200 lemp.

name: parking in front of the park and the beach
description: it's a totally beautiful place to enjoy your time a rarely visited beach but so beautiful in our opinion even better than tela and Utila and cheaper. the parking is in front of the restaurants area and the park police pass by very often and if you go eat from the restaurants in front you even can get water wifi bathrooms and showers. meals are since 100L

name: Puma
description: We asked the guards if we were able to stay the night in our van at this petrol station. They were hesitant but agreed once we showed them that we sleep in the van. Toilets are decently clean and they had intermittent wifi. Did not see anywhere to connect to electricity. Fine and safe for a night, not too noisy but we left around 6am.

name: Don Taco
description: Inexpensive restaurant run by a friendly family who serve tasty Mexican food in good portions. I highly recommend the Chilaquiles Tinga for 75L (vegetarians can ask for it would meat). The two sons speak some English if they are there when you visit. Open for lunch and dinner (I think every day). The food was the best and cheapest we had in Honduras, let alone Comayagua, so yes we would say it was exceptionally good value.

name: Hotel Alameda Colonial
description:
Good mid range hotel with secure gated parking and close to old city centre. Clean room with air conditioning was 700L.

Nothing particularly special good or bad.

name: Hotel La Fuente
description:
We passed Tegucigalpa direct because we felt insecure.
Our way to Copán has this city called La Paz-La Paz. The hole country has politic problems and so we found this hotel and after talking with Carmen Sierra (Rose) she was very gentle and let us use the big parking lot to place our car with rooftent.
Rose permited we use a bathroom and showers. Has electricity and water. You can also make a barbecue.
Good and safe place. We recomend for all Overlanders on way to Copan.

name: Parque Aquatico El Yate
description:
It is a public aquatic park. We arrived on a Monday, a day when it's closed. But the gate was open and so we talked to Tania the manager.
She allowed us to park our SUV (with rooftent) and use all facilities.
First price was 400 Lempiras but we paid 170 Lempiras for 2 persons.
Three pools, showers, bathrooms, gazebos with tables and banks. Shade, has monkeys, racoons, araras, and other animals encaged to watch.
Safe and gates closed at night.

name: panamericano comedor
description: We were crossing Honduras in one day and were looked for some restaurant. found this comedor with friendly staff and good food. 4 meals cost 360 Lempira. two of us vegetarian, just ask about it.

name: Oxidiana ancient mines
description: there are lots of deep hole, man made, wich believed to be oxidiana mines to make arrow tips for ancient people. There is no oficial info about. just ask the locals near. very interesting place

name: hilados los encinos
description: local comunity project to make original colorfull cloths you will see in la esperanza plaza. worth a visit if you. would like to support locals. 4w in rainy. but 2w high cleareance good enough.

name: taller automotriz dennis
description: we were recommended to this mechanic by Sayed from our hotel casa vieja who said he used this mechanic for his own car repairs. we were having problems with our brakes. Dennis was friendly and helpful and prompt, and although he didn't speak English, one of his apprentices spoke English reasonably well and helped us. they were able to fix our brakes and air filter at a reasonable price, the main cost was for parts we needed which they showed us receipts for. the labour cost was miniscule.

name: CA5 TOLL ROAD Available
description: Gps are not showing this toll road available. It's a 2 lines both ways from San Pedro Sula to Tegucigalpa.

name: Texaco
description: The best of this fuel station is the big playground and options to eat: subway, pizza...

name: Guatemala - Honduras border
description:
We crossed here from Guatemala into Honduras.

On the way to the border no helpers approached us, perfect. Getting to the first check point I stopped and one guy approached us but never saw him again as I told him I didn’t need help.

I went to the guys in the little booth and asked them if they could cancel my TIP. They thoroughly checked if I really wanted to cancel or if I wanted to return, seemed like they really cared. Some of this was with Google Translate since my Spanish is minimalistic and their English non-existent, again they put effort in helping. We needed two copies, which we could make across the street for 1QT per side (two pages double sides = 4QT).

Checked VIN, stamped, had a nice chat (hence; I practised my Spanish) and we drove on.

About 2km down the road there’s a bigger building, Guatemala and Honduras are together in one office here, worked out well.

But as we got closer there was a gate, two guys in what seemed a uniform and many around them (including the ones operating the gate) without. I didn’t trust them as they asked for papers and they didn’t open the gate, I reversed.

The one guy who asked me for papers followed me and I “explained” that I just wanted to pass through and wanted to do the paperwork inside. Now out of a sudden the gate could be opened (operated by non-officials going off their uniform).

We were asked by a “helper” (who spoke decent English) if we really didn’t want help and we kindly declined his offer. At least he was straight forward and pushy.

Park behind the gate, went inside, got stamped out of Guatemala and stamped into Honduras at the cost of $3 paid in American cash. (Local currency would also have been possible.)

Next the TIP, which was done by the guy who I didn’t trust outside and I apologised for my behaviour and explained the situation was confusing.

He collected copies, and started filling out paperwork. Somewhere along the line he mentioned we had to pay $35 per bank, but the bank was closed (since it was night time) and I needed to transfer online. I said no problem since I have internet (Google Fi) and asked where I should send the money to. He said it can only be done with a local bank and he wasn’t  able to accept cash.

There was a guy who he introduced (local) and he could transfer the money for me and I pay him in USD cash. I accepted without asking his commission. All the paperwork done, stamped and signed, I asked his commission.

With the help of Google Translate he said $50, I refused. Then he said $15, I refused again. He tried to explain it was his “work” and I told him it wasn’t an acceptable percentage.

With the paperwork done, now out of a sudden it was possible to pay the guy in cash, who we paid $35 and all was done.

So be careful, they tried to rip us off working together, luckily didn’t work.

The Guatemala officer checked VIN, collected the sticker from the windscreen, stamped two copies and off we went.

name: Unimall Choluteca
description: Parking lot at Unimall Plaza, Choluteca. Ask in administration before, friendly people. We stayed one night, very quiet. Free. Good Wifi. Safe. Water.

name: Playa Bonita
description:
Good and quiet spot in front of the beach. We stay 4 days and feel safe. People around super friendly and helpful: Mauricio, Roberto and Rey are good people. Security guard at nights. 
In the past another overlanders stayed here too. 
There water, cold shower, bathrooms, palapas and palm trees on the beach. 
Don’t forget to try Las Baleadas, the typical food.

name: Coral bay
description: Good spot for snorkeling!! A lot of corals, fish and turtle (we didn’t see).

name: three j,,'s
description: thermal pools, lake, restaurant super quiet. Stayed with F-350 truck camper, 100 lempiras

name: Restaurante Tipico with WiFi
description: Delicious typical food and friendly staff. Great parking available too and our sprinter fit through the entrance gate. Altogether $13 before heading to the next border (or if you’re coming north) great stop very happy :)

name: Uno Gas Station
description: Good place to stay. Luis the owner is very friendly, Aldo Osmar the guard with shotgun who stay all night long. no public WiFi but they let me connect to their private net, works inside car, away from store

name: Los telares
description: Hand woven cloth, made on wooden looms. This is a beautiful area, cool, producing vegetables & still very traditional. The church in the foto Is in a nearby village Valle de azacualpa,  & is a community project being built by 30 local villages & it's huge, will seat 2500! We stayed in la Esperanza but I think you would be able to stay anywhere up here, all the people are super friendly.

name: Finca El Compadre
description: Simple restaurant with chicken & fish plates for a reasonable price. Cost was 260 lemps for 2 chicken dishes with fresh salads and rice and 2 drinks. Quick and kind service, clean bathrooms & right next door to a gas station! What more could you ask for? Wifi you say? They've got it and it was average -- good speed.

name: El Quetzal
description: Small hotel in the midst of finalizing opening owned by extremely kind hostess Raquel. A double room with 1 double bed and 1 twin with A/C & fan and TV cost 660 Lemps. Very clean. We were welcomed with a jar of filtered water in our room. Wifi is due to be installed this week but was not available during our stay. Secure parking for 1 car or multiple motorcycles.

name: Restaurante Mis perlas
description:
Parking under palm trees, next to the restaurant. We only pay one drink in the restaurant. There are bath and showers available. The people is so kind. Very quiet and safe place. We are alone on the beach!



Estacionamiento debajo de las palmeras, al costado del Restaurante. Solo pagamos una consumición en el restaurante. Hay baño y duchas disponibles.
La gente es muy amable. Lugar muy tranquilo y seguro. Estamos solos en la playa!

name: Restaurante leo’s
description:
It is a Reataurante at the edge of the road. Very good and cheap food. We stopped here to ask if we could spend the night and they said yes right away. We courtesy dined here.


Es un Reataurante a la orilla del camino. Muy buena comida y barata. 
Paramos aquí para preguntar si podíamos pasar la noche y nos dijeron que si enseguida. Nosotros de cortesía cenamos aquí.

name: Police check point
description: They didn’t stop us, but there was a cop on each side of the road and cones in the middle. They waved us through

name: Military inspection point
description: Waved us through at 8:45 am. Two guards with rifles.

name: Final Border Checkpoint
description: This is the last place where the officials check your TIP. If you have a pet they will check the paperwork here, but didn’t take a copy.

name: Hotel Iberia
description:
Budget Hotel with excellent staff and lock up secure parking. They have cameras keeping and eye on things and the staff are always there so its very safe. A large gated parking lot but probably not suited for R.Vs as its a Hotel.
$590lp for a large room with a/c and internet, they even let me park my moto there for 6 days while I was away on Utila. 25lp for cold beer and they have other cold drinks too. Not the flashest hotel but a good place to spend the night safely.

name: Small river stop
description: Only 1 way down to a few open grassy spaces next to a small river. There is a cascade nearby. Hidden from road. Climate is cooler in the mountains. If not staying the night great place for a lunch or let the dog(s) out to stretch and drink. Spoke with a local at the spot who said his father owns the area and will hopefully one day start a small camping and restaurant in the location. For now its free.

name: Cuerpo de Bomberos
description:
Very nice place, very nice staffs. 
we just ask for stay and they agreed and were very helpful, said us that could use water and bathroom,
one kilometer from old town City center. Use the back gate. Free.

name: Free street parking
description:
Free parking at a very wide, calm and secure street, near the city center (15min walking), near the bus stop to Valle de Angeles (Hospital San Felipe) and to Picacho and La Tigra (Hotel Granada III). Near the agricultural market. 
There are 6 houses and a restaurant with private security 24hs. Tegucigalpa is a dangerous city, but we felt safe to leave the car during day and go out. At night very calm also.
We spent 4 nights here.

Parqueo gratuito en una calle muy amplia, tranquila y segura, cerca del centro de la ciudad (15 minutos a pie), cerca de la parada del rapidito hacia Valle de Ángeles (Hospital San Felipe) y Picacho y La Tigra (Hotel Granada III). Cerca también del imperdible mercado del agricultor.
Cuenta con 6 casas y un restaurante con seguridad privada las 24hs. Tegucigalpa es una ciudad peligrosa, pero nosotros nos sentimos seguros aqui para dejar el auto durante el día y salir a pasear. Por la noche muy tranquilo también.
Pasamos 4 noches.

name: Free WiFi Puma Gas Station
description: Kush gas station ok coffee ac and free WiFi

name: Mirador del Ocotillo
description:
Public view point with some horses  hanging out. Between high pine trees and plenty of flat space for vans.
Were told that area is safe so this spot should be too.

Ojojona is a small colonial town and  the climate is marvelous like May in central Europe. T-Shirt and short during the day, Sweater and long pants after sunset.

Half of the area with decent amount of garbage coming from picnic and lunches locals had here.

Benches and firepit and good LTE celular coverage.

Did not camp here but because of  zero of ioverlander spots in Ojojona area i added this spot.

We did go further up and camped on a private property with lovely owners who come for the weekends from the capital.

name: Pabellon Artesanal
description:
During the day a handicraft market with teeny restaurants and at night the parking lot surounded by the U-shaped building with shelter served us as campspot in our van.

The owner of the restaurant with the menu written with beans which is open until 19:30 opened us the key to the bathroom until they closed for the day.

She let us stay the night and told the watchman about us.

Tap with big sink filled with water in the back right corner. No water comming out of the tap during our stay.

Felt safe and enjoyed the shelter and benches on the very rainy evenning and night.

Free.

name: Hotel Villas del Valle
description:
Hot shower!! The real kind with heater and not the electric suicide kind.

There are some ranchitos with bbq and parked next to one to extend our van's front porch with the awning to the ranchito.

Rather flat and easy to level your car with stones or bricks. Next to a road which quiets down at around 20:00.

We got access to the bathroom and shower of the room they call suite while the bad of this room was in maintenance.

Pool!

Camped here 2 people for 15usd pn incl. breakfast and bool.Parked next to a rancho with our awning extending into the rancho.

People are very attentive and we did 2 big loads of laundry.
1 for 200lps with dryer
1 for 100lps w/o dryer

Rooms start at 46usd pn. Check picture for price list and contact details.

name: German Calderón in Angeli Gardens
description:
When staying at Angeli Gardens the owner had a car mecánic stop by to fix his ATV. We took advantage of his visit and had him look at our car and gave us a very honest recomendation to fix our issues once we arrive to Mexico were spare parts can be found for our VW.

The owner of Angeli Gardens recomends him as good mecanic and i have the impression that this is true.

Call or WhatsApp him on +50433843311 

If you need somebody who specialices un VW he can refer you to a colleague.

name: Military Checkpoint
description:
If you are stopped they will likely inspect your car (hacer un registro). Not sure if they are allowed to do that without probable cause. Make sure you watch over the inspectors shoulder so that nothing goes missing or he plants something.

2 years ago the police forces had a major ckean up and many police men especially the ones not doing theie jo s accordingly were kicked out. You will notice that by the young age of today's police force in Honsuras. Since then the police corruption situation has improved.

30 days in Honduras we encountered only one situation which was either are fake police, a very inexperienced police or a bribe situation. So no 10-15 corrupt police stops anymore as wikioverland states that travellers had when traveling through Honduras.  All our other 3 stops were professional, friendly and helpful.

name: Hotel Los Arcos
description:
Hotel just after the border with El Salvador 🇸🇻 
Rooms with fan or A/C
Grocery and lots of shops in the street
Basic room
We paid 600 lempiras for a room with 2 beds and A/C
OK for one night

name: Hôtel Via Melida
description:
New hotel in town . Huge room with 2 beds, A/C , fridge, shower, wifi.
Everything is new and clean .
We paid 1400 lempiras for 2 persons with breakfast.
A great place to stay in Choluteca

name: Police checkpoint
description:
Very nice policemen. 
Checked our passports, drivers licences and TIP.
Ask where we were coming from and where we were going.

name: San Antonio del Norte
description: A nice, big and flat area near San Antonio del Norte. It seems very quiet and safe. Nice panorama and beautiful village. Locals very friendly.

name: Beach camp
description: We crossed the border late, were looking for a rest and entered this village. at the end you'll find a promenade at the sea, where it is possible to park. was quiet all night (saturday) and we even got invited to park our van inside of a private compound. a few restaurants, but we didn't eat there.

name: River Bank free
description:
next to the river is a bank of rocks where we stayed one night with our vw combi 78. the last part to get on the bank is a little adventerous and maybe not all vehicles can do it. 
talked to people if its safe, said it is
felt safe and the watet is fresh and clear and no noise in the night. 
beautiful camp, even had a little campfire

name: Cantarranas
description: Such a beautiful place. Very small town just before to get to Los Angeles National Park. You can sleep in the center of town close to the main square and police station. Very quite and peaceful place. A lot of shops around.

name: Pier to Lago - free
description: At the end of the road comes a fisherport you can drive all way to the water and stand there for the night. A local showed us this place, because it shall be safe, quiet and right next to the lake with a mountain view. In the night a guard is around, with whom we had a little talk.

name: Texaco
description:
Clean nice gas station, friendly people working here 
Store, cafe, WiFi, bathrooms and plenty of parking 
We stopped to sleep for the night it’s 24 hours with security 
Oh and it’s free to stay the night

UP date 2021- very rude staff and manager. No recomended

name: Copan
description: Parking lot close to village and ruinas. not much else than toilets. they close the gate during night. 100 lempiras/night/car. staying at bosque, but invited us to stay here too

name: Copan
description:
they sell agua occidente here. 20 lempiras/garafon.
open all days 7am-5pm. sometimes on sundays too.

name: Rumba Beach bar y restaurant
description: RV friendly, pet friendly , rigth in front of the beach. Owner used to rv travel. Nice food

name: La Central
description:
Coffee from 25 Lempiras.
Notebook plugs.
Wifi (acceptable).
Air conditioner.
Music: low volume.
Quiet place to work.

Café desde 25 Lempiras.
Enchufes para la Notebook.
Wifi (aceptable).
Aire acondicionado.
Música: volumen bajo.
Lugar tranquilo para trabajar.

name: Hotel Athena
description:
Basic rooms but clean and nice. Air con (essential for us... we needed to escape the humidity and sand flies of a few nights camping at Punta Sal), private bathrooms, good wifi. Large parking lot across the street. 

600 lps for 2 people in a room that could sleep 7.

name: Bomberos - Fire Station
description:
Pequeño espacio para aparcar en frente de la escuela, queda al lado de la estación de bomberos. Lugar seguro pero algo ruidoso al estar al lado de la carretera. Muy amables nos ofrecieron sanitarios, ducha caliente y agua para llenar el tanque, gratis.

Small street parking site ik front of the school and next to the fire station. Very safe place but a little noisy because beeing next to the street. Very friendly guys offered us bathrooms, hot shower and water to refill tank, free.

name: Road side
description:
Couldn't find anywhere to sleep in town so came out here. Wide shoulder on a quiet road next to fields and a few houses. We didn't have any problems. Quiet until around 5 when the cockerel, dog and moto alarm starts ;-)  

There's a narrow squeeze on the road in, no problems in Ford van but a big rig might struggle.

name: Vista Al Rio
description:
Vary nice traditional foods overlooking the Puente Juanaca, were you can have great food and drinks or go swimming in the river to cool off, the owner is welcoming man with a big heart. also has a finch of coffee, he has family and also owned a lot of property just behind Three J's were you will see his house and farm on the right side right after Three J's to the right. if nobody is at home he will be at his restaurant,  just ask for Mr German he is the owner of Vista Al Rio just a little bit down the road. the area is vary safe and peaceful. 
,

name: Vista Al Rio
description: Camping next to Vista Al Rio Restaurant, Mr German speaks vary good English and Spanish, he has a grassy area behind the restaurant which he can setup water and power if needed, there are bathrooms at the restaurant you can use, at this time no showers but he hope's improve the site, he is also adding to his restaurant a new patio and inclosed space with A/C. just ask for Mr German at the restaurant or just down the street behind Three J's on the right side of the dirt road the white house.

name: Station Texaco
description: Big parking for trucks who is find behind the station texaco, the only who has well wanted we accept. The guards we you fact park just behind the building under lighting public and we have asked 30 lempiras. Night calm until morning or the trucks have started to start. For one night that is well.

name: Wild Trail - Waterfalls
description:
You can walk freely without paying. Natural trail to the forest and wild adventure with more than 3 waterfalls.

Trail is clean, not marked. Can't get lose but better be prepared. Just for walking, no car, no bycicle.

name: La Chorrera
description: Best camping spot ever, cascade and free camping place.

name: Espresso americano
description: Cafe with lots of coffee options and friendly staff. We got 2 large lattes and a few sweet things for US$5.50 (they take card!!). Also has good WiFi, a good coffee stop between borders.

name: turicentro el porvenir
description: Very friendly man who owns this restraunt on the beach. He lets you stay here for free and use his bathroom all night. There is a guard so it if very safe. He speaks English and has traveled to canada and the usa. it is a very beautiful spot. Beach is not the cleanest but water is nice. New update Mon and Tues are the days thenight club is closed. I guess Fridau and Sat they go until 6am. last only unti 10pm

name: splash inn and hostel
description: beautiful place in the west end. staff is really friendly. you can get a 2 bedrom suite for 99 US or a 4 beds hostile for 25US. free breakfast and a free snorkling trip with a villa. free breakfast with dorms. You can leave your car at the ferry in la ceiba in a guarded parking look for 7US dollars a night You also take the ferry to Utila from the wharf in la ceiba

name: Puma gas station with propane
description: Vehicle propane not cans.  Fast service for attached propane tanks.  No problem for American connections.  No vehicle size limits, was here with a 25' Class C.

name: Lux Restaurant
description: Really nice restaurant on the way to Tegucigalpa. Great clean bathrooms, cash only. Good views and the owner was super friendly and excited to have travelers

name: Las Hamacas/Parking for the Islands
description: Good option if you want to go to Roatan, Utila, etc. As long as you stay there for a night, you can leave your vehicle there while at the islands, and they actually offer a free shuttle to and from the ferry terminal.

name: Texaco el Mirador
description: Texaco Gas Station, they let us Camp here for free. Friendly staff, clean toilets available. There's a small Shop and a coffee, open until 10 pm. It's guarded 24 hours.

name: Football Pitch
description: A large, partly grassy area next to a football pitch. Some traffic noise but generally a quiet night. Friendly locals walk by with a smile. 15 minute walk into the town.

name: Palmira Hostel 2nd building
description: Annex building of Palmira Hostel, beautiful kitchen, laundry service for 5$, supermarkets on walking distance, in this building are only private rooms but are cheap. The building is on a very steep hill and the parking lot is limited, tall enough for a big rig but if you can’t find space there is a security guard during the night. It can be noisy during rush hours, you can pay 5$ and sleep in your rig and be able to use their kitchen, wifi and toilets

name: Pan y mas
description: Really good french bakery, they make delicious cakes and bread

name: Bazar Canton
description: Asian store, lots of asian products, good prices too

name: Clinica Veterinaria Soto
description: Veterinary clinic Matamoros stablished in 1958. Good service

name: Leña y Fuego
description: Best Pizza by the wood oven in town. I recommend it

name: La colonia Supermarket
description: Well stocked supermarket, it is inside a commercial center.

name: US Embassy
description: USA Embassy mission building and consulate

name: Green clean laundry
description: Laundry service and dry cleaners, a little bit expensive

name: Agua Caliente La Paz
description:
Family-run hot springs with camping options. There is trash around but it's  cheap and the hot springs themselves are decent and clean. Nothing spectacular but a good stopover place for us as we crossed the border from Nicaragua to Honduras that morning, heading to Largo Yojoa. Family is kind and it's definitely a local spot. Paid US$4 to camp and use the hot springs for two people. Not sure the rate for just the hot springs. Easy to find using Google maps, called Hot springs La Paz on Google. Camping was quiet during the week (outside of the always barking dogs in CA) and we had the Hot springs to ourselves. 

Update 2023: The road is hard to drive, 4wd would be better, but we did it with 2wd.

name: By the Church in Santa Lucia
description:
Parked for one night behind the church, after asking locals about where I could do so.
Nice small picturesque village.
The town is not for anything bigger than a van as streets are very tight.
No facilities.
People are following Covid sanitary measures better then any place I’ve been to. Everyone is using masks even to walk alone on the streets.
Very quiet village.

name: Roadside
description:
We found this beautiful place by accident, we were driving from Copan Ruinas to Reserva Natural Erapuca on a dirt road. Much of the road does not even show on the map, but the communities living here use it every day. 
We camped near a small river/fall with a great view to the mountains. 
Apart from a few cars or motos that pass by, it is quiet and remote. Also safe, all went well.

name: Baños El Quiscamote
description: Public showers stablished in 1902, the fresh water comes from the mountain and the municipality built the structure free for everyone. I would recommend daring to take a cold shower here and enjoy the view with a delicious natural juice or hot coco at the restaurant

name: Beach
description: Empty lot with some coconut trees and a sand dune next to the beach. Friendly local people and a restaurant 1 kms away.

name: Next to a lagoon
description: Before reaching Panacam there is a lagoon where you can do Kayak, there is a field where you can park and reach the water, there is a nice breeze and the views are breathtaking

name: El Picacho
description:
You see the big Jesus up there on the hill? Well you don't have to go right next to him, and the view is great up there!
It's just 15 minutes ish drive from the Palmira hostel or free park spot near there. 
Entrance at night is double, but city lights! Still just 50L pp at night. Parking is free but some dude may try to tell you which spot to park in and then have the audacity to ask for 30L for annoying you (didn't pay). Even before the parking theres a spot with a prime view! Walking from the parking you have other nice views, but to go closer to Jesus you have to pay more and they don't allow dogs from that point onward. So don't pay and be atheist.

name: Amerigas
description: Propane filling station in a gas station

name: Ricas Pupusas ao paso
description: Pupusas, Very delícious. See attached photograph.

name: Tacos Tatiana
description:
Cheap food and generous portions. Natural juices. 
Recommended.

Muy buena comida e econômica, los platos son grandes. Jugos naturales Recomendamos provar las Baleadas.

name: Street food by park
description:
Central Park with a few small stands (mostly meat based dishes, meat tacos, and fried cassava/platanos), tiendas  (in case you want to buy produce to cook).

We are vegetarians/vegan and found a place to eat bean pupusas (!!). Pretty affordable.

name: Small tienda
description: Small tienda with snacks cold drinks and a hammock and chair in the shade to chill. Nothing fancy

name: Hotel Don Pepe
description:
Simple hotel. Paid 500 lempiras for a big room with 3 big beds, they did not have anything smaller. We brought our bikes in and enjoyed the AC, private bathroom+shower, TV. Felt safe, good stop if you want to rest by the border. We were tempted to keep going and cross to Nicaragua but had the budget/time to stay here and go through the strict Nicaraguan border crossing with fresh energy the next morning :)

The hotel has a pool and some hammocks around. The pool was half full when we were there - did not use it but it is quite big and it seemed clean.

The hotel offers food for $80/meal. We did not take it but we had read reviews (google) about the food being really good here. 

Update the price is 700P or 30 dollars now and the food 100P.

name: Tecnicentro ABC
description:
In contrast to the other side-of-the-road mechanics in town, this one is big, tidy, well equipped and well organized. 

They offered to change our break fluid right away without any waiting time and (after negotiating the price) we were able to watch the capable mechanics doing an accurate job. They were also very helpful answering any questions we had. They checked some other bits and pieces while they were working but did nothing without consulting us first.

Surprisingly, they even had our tires in store which we had been looking for in Central America for months now.
So we had them change our two worn down rubbers as well.

All the employees were transparent, honest and friendly all the way.
In the end the owner dropped in and after a little chat with our bad Spanish he gave us two t-shirts and four chilled bottles of the purified water he produces next door.

The prices may have been slightly higher than some other mechanics but for us it was totally worth it:
Break fluid change: 1800 lempiras
Bf Goodrich All Terrain KO2: 5750 lempiras (each)

name: Mirador above Santa Rosa
description:
Small level grassy are next to a small gravel road overlooking the mountains and the town. Great views, quiet at night, no amenities at all. 
Nice cool breeze, Claro 4G reception. 

This place was recommended to us by one of the bomberos in town. It belongs to the municipal so you are not on private property. 

There is a small ruin that might have been a restroom once, a few overflowing trash bins and a fence that separates the area from the road. 
To get in you have to drive through a gate in the fence which is always open and around 3 m wide. Also there are some wires hanging over the gate so if you are much taller than 3 m you might have trouble getting through.

We arrived around 5 pm and until 9 pm there were quite some locals coming by for the view, the sunset or for walking/running.
Everyone was very welcoming and friendly and assured us it was very safe to stay here.
After 9 pm we had the place to ourselves and the little traffic on the gravel road died down almost completely. 

We were told there are several hiking trails starting here to explore the adjacent mountains but we have not checked them out jet.

name: Printing
description:
This is a little tienda that has a printer, copier and a computer. This is a place to print stuff for the border. We got there around 3pm.

If you ask nicely, they might let you connect to their WiFi - only to send whatever you need to print to their email. 

You can bring your USB drive as well.
 
Very friendly!

name: Adolfo's House
description:
Fenced property in residential area that offers a level gravel parking lot with a nice view over the neighborhood and an apartment under construction where you can use the restroom with flush toilet, sink and cold shower. 
You can also ask Adolfo to use one of his bathrooms with hot showers, his kitchen or his washing machine. No height restriction but the lot is shared with other cars so there is no room for huge rigs. 
Adolfo was born in Honduras and moved to the US as a young man where he lived and worked for almost 30 years. Now he is retired and moves back and forth between his house in the States and his home in Honduras.
He is a great guy with an inspiring life story and very interesting to talk to.
He is eager to meet overlanders and is working up the courage to maybe start overlanding himself. So encourage him, please :)

If you would like to stay at Adolfo's place, give him a call or send him a text/WhatsApp in advance to see if he is home:
[phone numbers updated 30/08/2023]
+1 918 822 3643
+504 920 820 89

name: Luna Jaguar spa
description: Beautiful setting in surroundings nature with a lot more that one would expect in the mountains. Lots of pools different temperatures, massage available too. The road is a bad track but manageable with a good vehicle. A must! We paid US$ 15 pp

name: Anibel's Restaurant at Playa Grande
description: This is a restaurant at the end of the Playa Grande strip. Prices comparable to seafood prices, a bit more than the rest of the island, but you get access to the beach, black sand, locals swimming, free showers, toilets parking, probably could camp here too, but we didn't.

name: Atlantida Cajero/ ATM
description: ATM on the island! may or may not be the only one, but hotels take card!

name: Hotel Villas Playa Negra
description: This is a hotel, rooms for 2 people they said were 1050 lempira, we didn't stay here, but they have all amenities. Looks a but older, but nice pool, access to Playa Negra, much cleaner on this side. Food to eat for a stop riding around the island as well, fair price, 200 lempira for a pork plate.

name: Hostal Islas
description: This is a beautiful little hotel and is the nicest accommodation on the island. Don't believe the locals when they say the hotels are expensive and overpriced. One tried to offer us a small room for $25 with a twin bed for my husband and I and a bucket shower and dirt floor. We walked out and checked in here, very satisfied, US standard, toilet seats, AC, Wi-Fi, in the center. We paid $32 a night here.

name: Aparthotel santa barbara parking lot
description: Perfect place to stay a night before crossing the border to Nicaragua. Parking in front of the hotel, you can take a long walk to the beautiful Rancho at the back. The place is clean, safe and quiet. Edith and José María are the owners and they are happy to help with everything you need. 200 (Now L500) Lempiras for parking and they borrow you a bathroom with a nice hot shower. We couldn’t find the other restaurant. Highly recomended.

name: puma gas station
description: on the main highway a gas station that closes at night. the guard let us stay and asked for tip. we told him we will stay until 7 and he said o.k. we gave him 50 lempiras pretty noisy.

name: Restaurante Ricardo's
description: Delicious seafood, tender angus beef and more. Tables right at the main plaza. Ricardo speaks English, recommended.

name: Parque Eco Arqueologico Las Naranjos
description: Entrance to the park. Nice 6km walk, partly on wooden walkways through wetland and jungle. 6US$/person.

name: Rawacala
description: Private natural reserve with a pristine waterfall, parking lot big enough for a big rig, toilets, showers, restaurant, hiking, tours and camping and canopy.

name: River bed
description: A place to dip into fresh river water to cool off or bathe. There is a lot of small fish to give you a thai massage. The water is crystal clear and shallow. There is a place where you can park and a small path to walk to the river. There is a little bit of thrash from the locals but nothing that stops you from enjoying the refreshing water

name: Entrance to the park Pico Bonito
description:
After paying 3$ for foreigners and 30 lempiras for locals, you can park at the entrance of this trail where you can hike to the waterfall, there are some bathrooms in the parking lot, if you don’t feel like hiking there are some spots by the river to hangout there is also a smal waterfall. Water is cool and crystal clear.

Update 2023 : entrance is $6pp

name: Maxi Dispensa
description: Tried 3 different supermarkets before, this was the biggest.

name: Lab. El Buen Samaritano
description: PCR test for crossing into Nicaragua or El Salvador (both only allow PCR at this time or a proof of vax for ES if you have it). 1.5hrs to get results. Costs $52.5 per test (today's exchange). Will accept debit card, lempiras or USD. 1250L They also provide you with 4 color copies. Open on Sundays til 4pm

name: Mountain Paradise
description: Family home, close to hot springs. Small campers and bikes welcome. Internet most of the time. Happy to help. Water, outside washing facilities. Hiking, and gardening.

name: Gasolinera Uno Copan
description:
UNO Service Station, you can spend the night in the rear parking lot for fuel consumption or for 100 lempiras / 4 USD per night, there is a convenience store until 12 pm and the bathrooms until 12 pm, they have clean water to fill tanks, sale of jug of drinking water, sale of fast food, there is a car wash in front, the center of the city is 2 blocks away, there you can find an electronic teller machine, the ruins of Copan are 5 minutes away.
---

Estación de Servicio UNO, puedes pasar la noche en el parqueo trasero por consumo de combustible o por 100 lempiras/ 4 USD la noche, hay tienda de conveniencia hasta las 12 pm y los baños hasta las 12 pm de domingo a jueves, viernes y sabado 24 horas por lo que llegar vehículos a escuchar música y consumir bebidas, tienen agua limpia para rellenar tanques, venta de garrafón de agua potable, venta de comida rápida, al frente hay car wash, el centro de la ciudad esta a 2 cuadras allí consigues cajero electrónico, las ruinas de copan están a 5 minutos. el lugar muy seguro.

name: Espresso Americano
description:
Coffee shop with coffee, pastries, and free wifi.
On-street parallel parking, no dedicated parking area.

name: Papeleria Gonzalez Mejia
description: Copy shop, nice spot to get copies made before crossing in Guasaule

name: Parking gardé
description:
Parking for 10usd the night, no border road.wc.
.....
un peu en retrait de la route ce parking e. terre battue peut convenir pour une nuit.

name: Angeli boutique hotel
description:
This place takes overlanders and has 8 rooms and cabanas , totally perfect and great service. I can’t say enough about this place. Prices start at $70 per night , good wifi, restaurant and microbrewery and swimming pool. 
Email: hotel@angeligardenshn.com

name: Picnic area
description: In front of the bar and restaurant. We were here during Christmas after 10:00 no sound . Nice area to stay one or two days .

name: Farmacias del Ahorro/ PCR Tests
description: Here you can get your PCR test and it costs 1100 lempiras. (Antigen test 500 L). First you have to fill out a form then you pay (possible with card) and finally they do the test. You'll get the result at the same day per e-mail but I've been told to come back the next morning to pick up the printed result which is just printed on a more fancy paper. That's the only difference to the e-mail. She sad that this is what they want to have at the Nicaraguan border. In fact they will take and keep the original one no copy needed.

name: BAC atm
description: ATM in the city center. The other one was closed at 5:55 pm on a Monday

name: La joya del lago
description: Very nice location by the canal. Freddy the owner of the kayak rentals (100 lempiras per person unlimited for the day) is a sunny person who really wants to exchange and share. The restaurant opposite (Ratatouille) is excellent and all the staff are lovely. The location is free if you consume (kayak or restaurant). We have access to the toilets. very beautiful spot and especially very pretty people. Only negative point: the proximity of the road

name: New Star Terminal
description: This is where the New Star freighter arrives / leaves on Roatan. Very basic, mostly carries construction materials and such but can be used as ferry from and to La Ceiba. Currently runs twice a week, Wednesday night and Sunday but better ask as this is no ferry but a freighter without fixed schedule.

name: Camp Bay Beach
description: Camp Bay is a public beach but the parking for it is on private land. Officially the parking closes at 21:00 but you may negotiate with the owner who let us stay for a small fee. Alternatively you may park in front of the gate, also private land but it seems that nobody cares. Entry to the parking is through a gate at about 3.40m height. Spot is very clean and maintained by a local living there, also providing security. Super chill and quiet place, great swimming and snorkeling and not far to the kite school at Camp Bay Lodge.

name: New Star Shipping Dock
description: Here leaves the New Star freighter for Roatan. Enter the port area (you need to show an ID and vehicle registration at the office and pay a fee) and load here to go to Roatan. New Star is a freighter and not a ferry with a set schedule so check with them beforehand to see when they sail and if they have space. Currently runs twice a week.

name: Analiza Laboratorios
description: Covid PCR test for 1300 L results sent via WhatsApp in about 5 hrs. You can stop back by to get a printed copy for travel. GPS coordinates are for side street parking. Easy to find.

name: Hotel Maria Rosa
description: Very nice hotel. Free breakfast, hot water, A/C, secure, covered parking for motorcycles and cars. Gracias (the town) is a gem, everything walking distance, including the Fort up in San Cristóbal hill. Just 4.5km from Aguas Termales hot water pools (awesome), easily accessed in paved road. Got a deal for 400L (17 US$) a day for the room, because stayed 5. Normally 500L.

name: Tire Hernandez
description: If you need a mechanic you can stop here they are very friendly as we need work done and they helped us it’s right in front of the las Flores. Very cheap and very friendly people highly recommend it

name: Casa Sur B&B (former ZZur Lodging)
description: B&B inside a gated condo, very secure place in Tegucigalpa if you need to stay overnight in the capital. Laura hosts people at her house, provides free breakfast in the 36US$ fee for a comfortable room with fan and bathroom. Closed garage for 1 car or 4 motorcycles, but you can park outside  just in front of her house, in the inner secure street.

name: Texaco
description: Large dirt/grass lot behind Texaco gas station just before the small town. Not fabulous, but access to decent restrooms and internet when sitting by the store. Some picnic tables by the store to cool off in the shade or cook by the store. There is a fast food stand that we did not try. Suitable for big rigs to vans and tents. We didn’t have an animal with us, so it’s unknown whether they can be here, but I would be surprised if it were an issue. There is a night guard for the gas station - we felt safe.

name: Tekas Lugar Familiar
description:
Informal campsite in a playground. all facilities, toilets, shower, water tap refill, 3 swimming pools. Gate closed at night and hidden from the main road, very calm. Also a restaurant opened on Saturday and Sunday but we were staying there during the week, so didnt try.
250 lampiras per night (2 adults, 2 kids of 4 and 6).
Update 02/2023: were told 10 US/250 L PER PERSON now
Better to call the owner before arriving as the gate was closed when we arrived at 5pm : +504 33 60 90 34.
Maybe one of the best places in Honduras as the ones existing in the app are mainly gas stations or non-secured parking.

name: Plaza Inn Hotel
description: Nice little Hotel restaurant with secure parking and a pool, Also a coffee shop. Good stop for the night before crossing the boarder. The owners were super friendly and spoke good English. It was 1100L for two people and included breakfast.

name: LACM laboratories de analisis clinicos Mendez
description: Open 24rh, pcr test. Results within 2 hrs. Cost 1800 Honduras dollars. 10-20us more than others

name: Hotel Valle Colonial
description: Small, pet-friendly, family owned hotel. After are car broke down on the way to Nicaragua, we had to stop here last minute. The family that owns the hotel took us in with open arms. The WiFi is perfect, there is secure parking within the gates of the hotel, breakfast is included. The family even helped us with laundry. The location can’t be beat in Comayagua, literally one block from everything. Highly Recommend!

name: laboratoire Buenos arias
description:
we make our pcr test to go to Nicaragua here. 1800 lempiras by people. did at 6:30 am. results at 2pm same day.
open saturday and sunday.

name: McDonalds
description: always free WiFi and bathroom available at mc Donald. enjoy climatization also if you need it

name: Camping at a river bank
description: Definitely a little closer to town than we would have liked but we were not able to find a spot further up stream. This was a great place and easy to get to. Solid packed pebbles and some spots with shade further at the edge. Perfect place to relax in the water and enjoy an awesome sunset.

name: Hotel casa lenca
description: Is a parking lot where the hotel let us stayed with security, bathrooms and wifi. We arrived at night and left early in the morning.

name: COVID Test for Nicaragua
description: This place does COVID tests to cross into Nicaragua. He did do an actual swap sample and we got the result within an hour. Whether it's a Rapid or the needed PCR test... I don't know. what matters is the result letter you need for the border says PCR. 1250Lemps per person.

name: Love hotel and a perfect place
description: Went to another place on iOverlander that allows camping. But I have a tent and it’s raining. This was the first motel when you enter old town. The outside wall is green and has their numver on it. I got a covered garage for motorcycle and a room with washroom. It’s very budget. Safe and secure. Huge lot for large vehicles to park and turn. I paid 220 in Honduras money. Cheaper than what people are paying to camp. I’m sure they would allow car camping. No wifi

name: Hotel utila
description:
Nice and cheapest place we find to sleep in utila. Besides captain morgan. 700 LP the night in a private room for two people with private room (other places we researched were all over 35 usd)
. Only cold water (we don't feel we neef hot water) and fan. You can get a room with a/c and hot water if you want. You have tables and seats in front of the sea. The restaurant works fron thursday to sunday. Good wifi to work and nice view.
If you dive you can find other places that give you night in shared rooms for free (fir example our last night we stayed in parrot's dive hostel in a shared room because we made the first diving experience...also was the cheapest we found as most of the first diving experiences were 120 usd pp but in parrot's diving was 90 usd).
Great staff in this hotel.

name: Street parking in front of police
description:
It's just street parking at the main plaza in front of the police. Secure and relatively quiet.
We asked the police before if it's save to park here and they confirmed.

name: Safe place to wild camp
description: Locals told us it was safe and they were right. Spend 2 nights here camping at the beach, nothing happened. Everybody was friendly. There is shade and  it was mostly quiet. Unfortunately there is trash lying around. There are sandflies. Mobile internet (claro and Tigo) reception. Some friendly stray dogs

name: Texaco las delicias
description: We stayed one night here heading to Ceiba, very quiet and safe with a security person. It has bathrooms and showers (not so clean but they work), toilets in good condition.  quiet good for overnight

name: playa la Ensenada
description:
beach ensenada, very nice and quiet place to camp on the beach or park your RV ... it's free .. very safe .. the people in the community are very friendly ... there are restaurants nearby with high prices, on Saturdays and Sundays  there are more people on the beach but during the week it is very lonely and quiet, relaxing we spend 5 days here in our kombi .. ask for joseth or Rosemary.. in front of his house is a great place to camp or park in front of a beautiful sea with waters  crystalline..

beach ensenada, lugar muy bonito y tranquilo para acampar en la playa o parquear tu RV ... es gratis.. muy seguro.. las personas de la comunidad son muy amables ...hay restaurantes cerca con precios altos , los sabados y domingo hay mas personas en la playa pero durante la semana es muy solo y silencioso, relajante pasamos 5 dias aqui en nuestra kombi.. preguntar por joseth o rosemary.. frente a su casa es un estupendo lugar para acampar o estacionarte frente a un hermoso mar con aguas cristalinas

name: Restaurant and Pools LA ROCA
description: we park our kombi in this place .. 100 meters from the central park of the town, very safe and the people very friendly .. family place .. ideal for parking and spending the night .. you can leave your vehicle and go through the very typical town and picturesque, we paid 6 $ to spend 2 nights and you can use the pools and also the bathrooms (very clean) there are also showers .. there is a restaurant with low cost and very good food .. we felt very safe staying in this place. At night the gate is closed and there is a security person.

name: Lavandería sinmacula
description:
Lavan y secan la ropa, se toman unas cuantas horas. 16 libras a 256 lempiras.

They wash and dry the clothes. It takes a couple of hours. It was 16 pounds for 256 lempiras

name: B and B of Joan
description: A great place to stay near the centre.  They let us park our motorcycles in their small court yard.  Joan and his wife were very friendly.  We paid 800 limps for a big room with two double beds including breakfast.

name: Copias
description: Copy place. Able to make copies or they have a computer and printer you can log onto and print out COVID results, hotel reservations, etc

name: Frank Coffee Roasters
description: Good coffee, big tables, good WiFi, plenty of plug sockets, AC, parking in front of the window. Great place to get some work done while keeping an eye on your vehicle.

name: Riverside
description: Next to a river. Good cellphone reception. Saw a few friendly locals who told us the area was safe and it is. Very quiet. Clean water. Small place and the road leading there isn’t very wide either so probably not suitable for big rigs. Stayed here for two nights. Only reachable with a 4x4! If there’s lots of rain this place will probably flood!  From the main road (toll) you turn into a dirt road. These are the coordinates to the entry of that road: 14.53822, -87.81705

name: Parque infantil Toronjal
description: This is a little park in La Ceiba for kids, it has slides and swings. There are no other parks like this in the whole city. I think is important for travel families with little kids. It has security all day. It has water to drink or wash your hands. Pets allowed.

name: K'awiil Coffee Shop
description: Really nice coffee shop and a great place to get some work done. WiFi, AC and plugs.

name: Hotel Sandoval
description: Nice mid range hotel. 595L for one person. AC, hot showers, secure parking garage, breakfast included.

name: Paseo los Girasoles
description: In this place they plant sunflowers, 12 minutes from the main street of Copan Ruinas, they have a restaurant.  nice place to take pictures with the sunflowers.  the entrance has a price of 40 Lempiras ($2) / person.

name: El Morito Mariscos & Lounge
description: If like us you do not have a SIM card for Honduras and are in need of wifi, especially when waiting for your covid test results to come through (farmacia del ahorra next door), then we can recommend this restaurant. Wifi was fast. They specialize in seafood but serve other food. The meals were OK. It‘s a popular place amongst locals but plenty of space both in restaurant and car park.

name: Las Tablas
description:
This is an exceptional restaurant. Trust us. If you’re meatlovers like us - you need to eat here. We ordered the tenderloin filet and it was the best we’ve eaten in all the Americas so far!!
