We usually stay clear from steakhouses as we prefer to grill ourselves, but this was sublime. This dish (Corte de Filete), served with papas and veggies cost L420 ($18) and was worth every penny. The staff were super friendly, attentive and welcoming. It was a pleasure for them to host us, they even prepared their specialty hamburger on the house for us. It was huge! 1lb of beef! La Torona de las Tablas would normally cost L285 ($12). And out of the blue, I received a free cocktail (costing L120 -$4) 
If you want to make a night of it, you’d probably be able to camp here too. We asked the manager and she said yes. The wifi btw was very fast! And lots of playground equipment for the kiddies. Definitely recommend eating here.

name: Uno gas station
description:
It’s free. It has a big parking space, very quite at night. There are 3 restaurants so there are restrooms and Wi-Fi available if you buy something to eat.

Es gratis. Es una gasolinera amplia y muy tranquila de noche. Hay 3 restaurantes a la par entonces hay wifi y servicios sanitarios disponibles si se consume algo.

name: Cabañas Agua Azul
description: Accidental and wonderful find. We met Eduardo in town, and he invited us to camp on his property. It’s a place with cabanas, a really good restaurant, and a boat launch. We camped right by the launch, but to the side so people could still pass. We were here Monday and Tuesday nights and it was so peaceful. I’m guessing it’s not as peaceful on the weekend. There is a bathroom to use closer to the restaurant, and a water spigot there (it’s hiding between the restroom and event room). No shower that we know of. At the restaurant, we recommend the pizza (after 2 pm), burger, Buffalo chicken sandwich, and poboy sandwich. Free to camp if you eat at the restaurant. Decent WiFi at restaurant. Lots of flies one of the two days we were there, but no mosquitos. Excellent place for bird watching and listening. We camped in our Jeep Gladiator.

name: Local bar and restaurant
description: We had a lovely afternoon meeting some locals. We asked if we could stay parked in front of the beach and they offered us a spot right by the restaurant. We had a great dinner of shrimp, chicken and rice and beans and a couple beers each plus a big bottle of water all for L 400. Access to bathrooms and water for washing (didn’t drink). Great spot except all the trash in the beach but very friendly people and felt very safe.

name: Hotel Casa D'Luna
description: Private parking, allows dogs, AC, small pool. Safe, secure, quiet. 900L/$45 dollars. Covid test at LACM a 5 min walk away.

name: Laguna San Julian
description: You really need to want to go here, because the road from Danli is unpaved, the whole 25km or so. But then you arrive at a nice lake. Talked to some fishermen and we all agreed it was safe. And quiet. No (Tigo) internet or perhaps "E".

name: Hotel Quinta Avenida
description: $24 a night.  Allows dogs.  High clearance vehicle secure parking.  Clean and quiet.

name: Pull out
description: Just a small opening on the side of a dirt road. Good for a night, if you don't want to spend it in town or on the main road. Space for 1 (max 2) vehicle(s), no RV. No need for 4wd. Super quite spot, only two bikes passed in the evening.

name: Garden Coffee & Cabañas
description: Beautiful spot to spend a night. José, a very friendly owner of the Garden Café told us he doesn’t mind letting people sleep in the van near his café. He left the toilets opened for us and didn’t ask us any money. Café (and the gate to enter) closes between 7PM and 9PM. No obligation to consume in the café but obviously it’s a nice thing to do. Nice cabañas available on the site (28-35USD). Very safe, clean, super friendly people.

name: Rio Jalán
description: Nice leveled spot by the river. We stopped only for lunch, but I guess it would be alright for a night. There is a farm on the road where one could ask. Road is unpaved, no need for 4wd right now, but some clearence helps. Probably hard for RVs or big vans.

name: Scenic route
description: Beautiful unpaved road that connects Campamento with Teupasenti. It goes through the mountains, through tiny small villages and lots of platano and coffee plantations. Beautiful views. 4WD high clearence ONLY! In certain sections, the road is narrow, muddy and very steep. Good GPS also recommended due to many intersections with other roads.

name: Pulperia lot
description: Opening on the side of the road which belongs to the pulperia nearby (red house). We asked for permission to camp for a night and it was no problems. They sell their own coffee (very good) and super tasty platano chips. Very friendly locals, very quite night. Possible to fill up drinkable water if you ask to the pulperia (free). There is a football field 50m further down which, i guess, you could use for camping (but kids from the school will be there early in the morning). Another football field which could be a possible camp spot was a few km north of this site. Road to get here is 4WD high clearance ONLY!

name: Fun 4WD road
description: Fun road through the mountains. 4WD high clearance ONLY! Very narrow, rocky and steep in some sections. Nice views. Not sure google maps has it, we found it on Gaia GPS.

name: River Park Hotel & Cabañas
description: Very nice Camping, with electricity, wifi, pool, restaurant, clean bathroom. Owners very nice. Charged us USD 30, but for future referenced from iOverlander will charge USD 20. No dumping, but is willing to have in the future. Next to the road, but really quiet anyways. Have outside shower at the pool, but is also willing to build them in the future if more Overlanders come visit.

name: Cafe Juan 316
description: Very very friendly people in a little Comedor (Restaurant). Allowed us to camp in their meadow/parking area. Stunning view into the valley. Wifi & toilets available.

name: Puma gas station
description: Grass flat area next to 24h gas station with security. Asked if we can stay and we were directed there. Toilets and smallshop with beer, sodas and crisps. Gas station next to new south-north highway.

name: Texaco gas station
description: Good place to stay overnight. Outside of the city and there's 24h service and a restaurant with decent food and prices. The staff is very friendly. Guard also 24/7.

name: Caribbean Hills
description: Camping in the entrance of a residential called Caribbean Hills Exclusive only for caravans Very safe place with 24 hour security, we charge $25 a night. In front of the place there is a 24-hour gas station, a power chicken restaurant, next to it there is a private hospital, six pharmacies around, the guard has instructions to attend to you If they need to use a toilet, they can use the one at the gas station. It has water to shower, garbage can. The gas station sells LPG Gas. One kilometer away is the municipal beach in case you want to walk, there are several restaurants, a mini bar in front of the beach

name: La Guarida del Pirata Bar & Rest
description: Bar & Restaurant on the beach. The nice owner allowed us to stay directly next to the building on the parking lot. No amenities, close to the street, and it is a public beach, so there is noise from traffic and people, but it is safe and the sea is clean and refreshing.

name: El Florido border camp
description:
This is an abandoned restaurant, where you could possibly pitch a tent under a shelter. It is fairly quiet, because there is very few traffic around this border. You can reach beautiful Copan within a short ride from here.
If you arrive with a vehicle it will be a bit difficult to find a parking spot. You would be better off camping near the town, either around the river or at the campsite, which is maintained by a very friendly local family.

name: Ruta Lenca Café
description: Cute and quiet cafe with a patio, great drinks, fast wifi and pet friendly. it's right on the entrance of the Museo y Jardin Botanico "Casa Galeano" (Patrimonio National de Honduras). The street in front of it is wide enough for street parking.

name: Parqueo Villanueva
description: Public parking close to the Parque Central. We negotiated 350 lemp for 24h (it was pouring rain and we needed a safe space for the night). Easy access and safe (cameras & security). They have a big dog inside but it's chained all the time.

name: Autucun Cacao
description:
Cocoa processing from the Comayagua area! Very interesting visit (free) and explanation! In addition, the chocolate they produce is delicious! Highly recommended!
.....
Proceso del cacao de la zona de Comayagua! muy interesante la visita ( gratis) y explicacion! además el chocolate que producen es deliciosos y dan más alternativas a los desperdicios de este! muy recomendado!

name: Public Parking
description: Large parking lot in front of Aroma Cafe (which seems to be the best cafe in town + has wifi). we paid 100 lempira for the day, and another 100 lem for the night. Place is secure (gate, cameras and a person staying overnight) and popular with other small truck / bus drivers. there are few dogs (friendly).

name: Puma service station
description:
Puma gas station next to main road with access to 'Stop N Go' convenience store with clean washrooms, coffee shop and good range of snacks, beer etc.
The owner was kind enough to let us stay for free under a large covered area which was very convenient as there was a torrential downpour. The place is well lit but possibly a little noisy as it's used by a lot of truckers.
If you need WiFi go to the shipping agent 'Predio MSC' next door and if you ask nicely they may give you the password.

name: coffee shop
description: Very good coffee, AC and very good coffees.

name: Pedro's family
description:
Pedro is from a Mayan community in Copan and offers excursions and guides in his village "La Pintada" are highly recommended and good people ... call him at +504 9923-9632
---
Pedro es de una comunidad Maya de Copan y ofrece excursiones y guías en su aldea "La Pintada" son muy recomendados y buenas personas... No te defraudara conocerlo...
llamarlo al +504 9923-9632

name: Rocky area overlooking ocean
description: Overlooking the ocean and next to a bay with beach access. I camped here and the view was amazing. Only at night significant winds picked up. No signs. Just saw a road leading up from the highway and found a spot suitable to put my tent.

name: Hotel D’Glorias
description: Nice economic hotel with a great secure parking courtyard. Would fit larger vans or motorcycles no problem. A basic room with AC was 600L. Wi-Fi seems decent, it’s a good option for this area for sure!

name: DHL Store - Drone Shipping
description:
We were able to send our drone from here to Costa Rica. They’re very friendly and knew that it’s a drone straight away. So it might not be the first one here.
We paid 61$ for shipping. 
Update 5/17/2 - We paid $73USD

name: Abandoned Residential Area
description: This is a build residential area, only 3 houses and lots of grasy space. You can park wherever you want. Super quiet at night. Every kind of car possible.

name: Carnes y Mariscos Jeova Jireh
description: We spent a couple of nights in this place in front of a very clean beach and a beautiful sea, the owner Roberto is very friendly and receives travelers of all kinds, he charges us $10 per night, he has a restaurant during the day with good food and good price, the place is very safe, it has clean showers and toilets, electricity and lighting at night. ... on weekends clients arrive but during the week we had the place to ourselves...The gate closes at 7 pm. You must arrive before this time.

name: Abandoned Quarry
description: Going towards Danlí right at the red and white mobile phone tower make a left into the gravel road. Lots of places to park any kind of rig. Super quiet at night. Nice surrounding.

name: La Caza del Artesano
description: Street parking  on the right side of Progresso at the intersection with #1.  Right in front of La Caza del Artisano. Lots of room but turning around will be a problem for big rigs.

name: autoservicio sierra
description:
Nice mechanic, helped us and find straight away what was wrong with our car, good prices does all sorts of cars, honest.
Also helped our friends that had an accident to change suspension and few other parts, worked very hard to find the parts for Mercedes that are rare goods here, highly suggested

name: Next to the river
description: An amazing spot by a small river. You can park on the grass field. I think it’s better not to park on the pebbles because sometimes a truck crosses de river and uses the pebbles as a road. People swim, fish and chill overhere but it felt very friendly. At night it was quiet. We stayed here on a Sunday night and Monday night.

name: Acos Tours
description:
We booked a tour to Cayo Cochinos with Ernesto, the owner of Acos Tours and he let us stay for free for 4 nights in the grassy park next to his house. The place is quiet, flat, big and near the beach. There is some trash around though. The island tour is awesome. The price for it is around 1000L each (700 + 300 park fee).
Maybe contact him before getting here. +50431570450. he only speaks Spanish.

name: Next to Hotel Victoria Inn
description: On the way to Gracias, it was getting dark so we found this place and stopped here for the night. It's a flat parking lot next to the newly Hotel Victoria Inn and a Puma gas station. The spot is basically near the main road but you won't be visible as there are trees around. The night was super quiet.

name: Taller Autmotriz Genesis Performance
description:
Very professional, friendly and fast service. Suspension on our Van broke about 3km from Las Manos border crossing into Nicaragua, we called the guys and they came on the crime scene, fixed it temporarily in order to allow us to drive into their repair shop. At their shop they did a really great wellding job in a very quick manner, they also found 2 more issues and promptly repaired it. The price is reasonable. Overall we have a good feeling about it, definitely we recommend it. Will post an update should the problem occur again. 

Contact details: +504 9976-1288 (also on WhatsApp)

name: Restaurant Tipicos El Charancaco
description:
Its a restaurant and they also have Cabanas ..

We asked if we can camp at the backyard of the restaurant and they said we dont have to pay or even eat at the restaurant.. We went for some beers though 🤙

They have a lot of chickens, birds and other animals in the garden! They run around freely and its pretty funny to watch at..

name: Street Parking quiet and free
description: Not many places around copan for free, so we decided to park here and spend a few days. It's a street parking, nothing fancy, but the road is super quiet. The place is flat and it's easy to get to. Just 5 minutes walk outside Copan.

name: Del Bosque
description: A nice spot for a fairly fresh meal. We had grilled steak and french fries when we were searching for a place to leave our trailer for the night so that we could go exploring in our car. They have a safe parking lot with the car wash and a good restaurants very nice people.

name: Mariscos Larry
description: Nice family restaurant right on the beach their yard/parking lot is filled with nice grass and you can hear the waves from here 1 minute to walk to the beach. They serve food here and have a locked gate at night.  A good spot to get off the road a bit and rest or even to stay for a few days and explore the area.

name: Puma Gas Station spicket
description: Next to diesel pump on far right of lot. Didn’t ask to fill up while camping but got 100G 375L in my tank with a 25 foot 9 meter hose.

name: Restaurant La Playa San Lorenzo
description: Safe and quiet parking in the restaurant's gated lot. No height restriction, big rigs will have to struggle a bit with the narrow entry. Free if you eat at the restaurant - very good food, not really cheap, but worth the price. Very friendly German owner, Werner, who has been living here for 50 years. Beautiful sunset scenery from the restaurant's terrace. CLOSED on Mondays.

name: Servicio tecnico Nacaome
description: Modern mechanical shop, very helpful, right outside Nacaome on the road to border Amatillo. Name: "Tecnicentro Aplicano"

name: Rural Style
description: This spot is just someone’s lot on the beach the locals in the neighborhood are friendly and have us a water connection place is free a bit of the beaten path no real services here

name: Cordillera Gas and Pizza
description: This place is close to La Ceiba and we’ll lit feels like a safe place to park for the night. We still ship our car over to Roatan in the morning and needed a place to stay for the night didn’t want to stay in the direct town. It’s pretty calm for a place right on the road

name: Flat grass with amazing views
description:
Great spot on a flat grass hill, with amazing views to all sides. It is about 50m behind typical wire fence detachable not locked gate of most likely private pasture, that seems not to see a person a while, so it is up to you. The 100m from the main road is a bit rough, but as long as it is dry, every 4x4 and good 4x2 should make it easily.

As a bonus you get LTE connection so you can share right from here how great this spot is...

name: Royal Palace Hotel
description: Nice, clean hotel a couple blocks off the pan American. Wifi, free breakfast, AC, and Pool. $30 for two people, 595L 24 dollars for one person.

name: street food shack
description: Small shack on right hand side leaving town towards Nicaragua. Fresh cooked tasty food. We had deep fried tacos. Also had fresh melon juice. Great value

name: Hotel Yuscaran
description:
Clean, welcoming, simple hotel in a pretty town mostly undiscovered by tourists. 

Hot water. Decent wifi. Safe parking for motos or small cars. Height restriction to enter the courtyard.

I paid L400 for one person. 

Try the local aguardiente, made at the distillery located in the center of town.

name: Beachfront Campground
description:
If you drive to the "wildcamping spot" which is marked, you come along a street right to the beach. On left and on right hand there are "parqueos" behind fences.

We asked the woman on the left side, if it's possible to stay overnight. Probably it's possible on both sides ;-).

She startet at 500lempiras and went down to 300 lempiras for two people and a Landcruiser with rooftoptent. Our dog was welcome.
There are clean flushed toilets and a simple shower. The people are living right behind the "parqueo" and are really friendly.
Some picknick tables and on the fenced ground absolutely clean, no garbage around! Some friendly dogs are here.
Great place to stay!

She asked if we need light - so electricity is around, but we are on solar, we didn't use it and we don't know where and how it would be possible but probably she can give you a cable ore something...

The beach is not really nice with a lot of garbage but the water is nice&clear!

name: toll road payment
description:
toll road CA13, officially, road to San Pedro Sula

Toyota Landcruiser for 6L

name: road impassable
description: The road is not continuous to CA13 like in Google maps marked. It's too small for cars and no alternative route to the CA13!

name: Zambrano trail
description: Nice place between some trees next to a soccerfield. Asked some very friendly lokals if it's ok to sleep there, he said yes and that's realy save here. Some lokals went by during the evening, all very friendly. Also some nice streetdogs sleept next to our car, where also fiendly to our dog. We ended up here because Auroa Park was closed. We felt really save and welcome, so nice place to stay for a night or two.

name: Puma Petrol Station
description:
We could not find the other iOverlander spot nearby so we stayed right at the Puma petrol station. If you stand in front of the station (looking at it from the road) the parking is on the left side, on a bit of gravel off the concrete.
When we got here we asked the staff if we could stay and when the guard arrived at 8pm he told us that we could and pointed at the spot where we can park for the night.
It felt safe, toilets are OK and most importantly coffee is great.

name: Playa dorada restaurant
description: Very calm restaurant with nice set up, not flashy and good prices. Nice staff they allowed us to park overnight on their parking lot and use their bathrooms. They don’t have showers but the restaurant next “El Delfín” has showers for 10 lempiras. The food is very good and would recommend you to try the sea food soup medium size as it is very big and filling. The best thing is that there were no sand flies and mosquitoes

name: armed robbery
description: armed robbery. 2 guys on a motorcycle with gun. shot at me, robbed my belongings. don‘t drive this mountain road!

name: Road conditions
description: Between the towns "La entrada" and "Quimistan". The road is in very bad condition! So be aware of time before drive to this part. Is doable but if you care about your rig go slow! I leave this pin just in case .... specially of you are coming from Guatemala and you think all the roads are like this part between the copan ruins and the town la entrada. In total 55km aprox of bad road, old asphalt and super destroyed. Be sure to have enough light time !

name: Trojes Border Crossing
description:
Tried to cross from Honduras to Nicaragua with a US-plated motorcycle. I talked to the border officials on the Nicaraguan side to see if they could process the vehicle and give me a TIP.
My Spanish isn't great, and they weren't entirely sure, but after some discussion and a phone call, they told me I could not enter Nicaragua here with my motorcycle.
It does appear that Nicaraguan and Honduran-plated vehicles do cross here, so it might be possible if you're from Central America. 
I don't know if it would be possible to go from Nicaragua to Honduras here with a vehicle. My guess is that it would not be possible, but I didn't ask. 
If you are on foot or bicycle, I'm nearly certain you can cross here.

name: SEPA/ MAGA
description:
Just in front of the Immigration-Aduana office. Here you can do the paperwork to go into Guatemala or Honduras. Same office for the two countries. 
If you are going into Guatemala be aware that you have to pay at the same bank that you pay for the aduana for the vehicle. (BankRural 200m into the Guatemala side) So the best is when aduana send you to pay go and pay for the dog as well. After paying you need 2 copies  of the ticket for Maga.

name: Police station parking lot
description: After some bad feelings at the „mirador wild camping spot“ (see comments there), we decided to ask the police, if we can stay at there parking lot and they said yes.

name: Posada Real de Marcala
description: It is a very basic place. The town is safe and friendly, I went for a walk at night to a nearby restaurant  called Restaurante Rony’s. I never once felt I was at risk, This town is a gem, even if this hotel is more like fools gold.

name: Hostal El Graciano
description:
Cosy hostel/hotel very well located near the main plaza and only 10 minutes walk from the Terminal de Buses Celaque (coming from Santa Rosa) and 5 minutes walk from the Terminal de Buses Esperanzanos (going to La Esperanza - but go to terminal Celaque to ensure the best seat).
We stayed one night in a self contained room for L450, with double bed, fan and cable TV. 
the place has a shared kitchen in the patio.
We booked through the chat option on Google maps.

name: Texas Hotel
description: Clean hotel with relatively large rooms. Paid 400lp for a double room with AC, TV, warm water, secure parking, fast WiFi, no height restriction. They also have drinking water to fill up your bottle. Quiet little town. Very recommendable coming from or going to El Salvador. No card payment. We didn’t have Lempira yet, so they also accepted US Dollars. Call +504 9649 8719

name: Lavanderia
description:
I added this place and the they were super friendly.
I have to add that my wife was missing a dress, I add this because there was sentimental value to this special dress.
We reached out to her hoping for mistake but we have since left town/area and not returning.
She said she would send to friend of ours as she found in dryer (why not with other stuff).
I will update again if this all works out in long run. They seemed friendly fly and great, mistakes happen and so we hope this is rectified. 
It will take a month for us to receive dress back so don’t wait for update in meantime.
We had a massive mishap with 70% of clothes missing in Guatemala and they had zero remorse, this person seems sincere and so we hope for the best.
The update will come if corrected

name: Land Rover Mechanic Garage
description:
We got in touch with Daniel on Facebook and went to his garage. The Garage is a bit off the main road but it was really worth it. Daniel will help you solve anything and find spare parts. He is the best, we stayed two days and he was super honest and flexible.

You can contact him in advance if you know you will need parts or a job done at the following contacts: Crespocruz12@gmail.com, +504 9783-0700. 


Not far from the border with El Salvador and the beautiful town of Comayagua

name: Playa Blanca
description: Sweet little village (only a few houses) including small beautiful  sandy beach, perfect for swimming, very nice locals around, had wonderful fish and Camerones directly at fishermen‘s place, you can bring your own drinks because they don’t sell any drinks, it’s not really a restaurant, more a private place, food was fantastic and cheap. Same owner allowed us to stay overnight in his parking for free. Basic clean toilet. No shower but you can use the hose of the family at fishermen’s place after swimming. All locals do so. Not much space in the parking and most not level, but on top of the parking there are two spots more or less level. Very steep to get there but perfect view from there over the village and the sea, really narrow and rough rocky entrance to the parking and you need high clearance, we are 6 m long and it was not easy but there are also a few spots available outside the parking. Many locals on the beach on Sunday, on Monday it was quiet. Last 4 km street are really rough gravel road, but locals use it with normal cars too. Light Claro signal. It was our first night after crossing the border coming from El Salvador, it‘s only one hour drive from the border and we loved that place.

name: By the River
description: Beautiful spot directly by the river (dry season), of course rocky but no problem. We used it for a very quiet night only hearing some frog croaking, on our way to Lago de Yojoa. If you come from Gracias, right after passing the bridge turn right, go down the gravel road for a few meters, turn right again, passing under the bridge and you reach the river-bank where you can choose the best spot. A few young locals around, but nobody bothered us. Felt very safe. Good Claro signal, nothing else.

name: Playa Miami
description: Beautiful lonely beach, some palapas, the Lady who owns the place prepares great fish and shrimps, we ask if we could stay overnight under the palm-trees, she said no problem and it‘s free. We stayed for 3 safety nights and of course we had some beers and food at her place which seems to be more private than a restaurant. I’m sure she offers toilets, we didn’t ask. A few locals around on Sunday, during other days we were here alone. Locals also offer boat-Trips through the lagoon. Good Claro signal. Don‘t miss to visit this place, it‘s close to Paradise!

name: Shady beach spot
description: Nice spot with big trees directly at a wonderful beach, easily reachable also with big rigs, unfortunately much trash around, but beach is clean. Very good for one or two nights and free. We found it after trying to go along the coast from Rio Coco to Santa Fe unsuccessfully (for more information see „bad road Rio Coco - Santa Fe“.  Good Claro signal, no more amenities. A few friendly locals during the day having fun here and leaving more trash but total quiet at night.

name: Bad (dangerous) Road Rio Coco - Santa Fe
description: We tried the half day going from Rio Coco to Santa Fe along the coast. Google does not find a road there but our map shows a dashed line and several locals as well as the police told us, it exists. It‘s a big adventure, very narrow, many rivers without bridges (dry season) very steep ups and downs, broken spots where we needed our winch. At least we had to turn shortly before reaching the destination because road was broken down totally and had to go back all the way long. 5 hours huge challenge, but at least unable to do it even with our Unimog. Also if you look for adventures  - Better don‘t try it!

name: Free spot at a supermarket
description: Looked for a place for the night because it was getting dark. We asked the security of this „La Colonia“ Supermarket if we could stay here for the night and they were very friendly and said no problem and it“s free. Good Claro signal, many restaurants and coffee-shops around, fore sure they have toilets and Wi-Fi, we didn’t use it. Not really quiet but easy and safe.

name: Plaza Marieta
description: Flat parking-spots, many friendly locals around allowed us to stay overnight, use the clean toilets of this place and could fill up water. All for free! Right next to the street but not much traffic at night. Good Claro Signal.  Used it for one night on our way to you he border of Nicaragua.

name: Guava Grove Resort
description: Small boutique resort with a pool and restaurant.  Beautiful grounds!

name: El Triunfo
description:
Beautiful campground with natural pools, waterfall, flush toilets and cold showers.

About 2 hours from the border.

$150 L/person for entrance and camping

name: Toll Booth
description: Large Toll, very official, we were traveling towards Tegucigalpa and it cost 22L for our two axel vehicle

name: Long Beach
description: Big parking area on a beautiful beach, restaurants on site. Area has street lights at night. Calm on weekdays, full on weekends.

name: Pupuseria El Dorado
description: Clean tienda with delicios Pupusas! They also have Veggie-Options. :-) Very friendly women working here. Also you can park your rig directly infront from the restaurant.

name: Parqueo Maxand
description: Parked here for a night after crossing the border. Huge truck stop was empty and reasonably quiet. Showers, toilets, electricity and water for 3 USD. Fast food available. Recommended.

name: Honduyate
description: We checked out some places at the lake but they where all expensive. This one is directly at the lake with a really nice view. 150 per person.

name: Texaco
description:
Shout out to Texaco and Puma  Gas Stations!
Texaco gas stations in El Salvador and Honduras are just amazing. 
Bathrooms are free, air and water is free and often they have showers too. Not sure if showers are free or not. 
So when we pull in, we can empty our cassette toilet, fill up with water, fill up on gas if we need it and check our air pressure in our tires. The staff are always very helpful and yes, sometimes we even spend the night in their lot if it’s starting  to get dark and we need to get off the highway. 
Puma gas stations are great in all the same ways. They both make it easy on Overlanders.

name: Historical Park
description:
this park all full of trees is surrounded by a small cathedral, a school, a police station, a consulate and some historical buildings
it was very quiet until 5:30 when birds started singing and the church play the bells. not many cars driving by
I parked on the west side of the park where there were a lot of open spaces 
in the morning you I saw the kids going to the school, and bunch of police standing by the police department
I felt very safe

name: Hotel Kali
description:
Nice simple hotel, comfortable rooms with AC and private bathroom, good WiFi, $20/night. Comfy mattress & pillows! Friendly owners kept us topped up with drinking water. On a busy street that felt safe. shops & restaurants a few blocks to the south.

Owners were happy for us to keep bicycles in room with us.

name: Super Baraota Omoa
description: Supermarket with food, fresh fruits, meats, bakery, and atm.

name: Hostal Casa Verde
description: Basic Gated Hostel/Hotel, with plenty of space to park. Maria, the lovely english/Spanish speaking Caretaker, was willing to let me and my dog sleep in the car and use there facility's. But there is no shade so I decide to stay in a 2 pax-dorm with my dog instead (2 nights = 589L) they also have private rooms. Unfortunately I forgot to ask the price for just parking.

name: Cruz Roja Nacaome
description:
Cyclists are welcome to stay at this friendly Red Cross centre. We were greeted outside by Alejandra who volunteers there and she invited us in right away and asked if we'd like to stay. shower, toilets, bunk beds, AC & WiFi - all a weary cyclist can dream of after a hot day in the saddle!

Jimmy (the boss) also made us feel very welcome. Great food across the square too.

name: Hotel Uala
description: Hotel with secure parking, pet friendly, good wifi, breakfast included, there was a security guard, it felt safe. Paid $1250 Lempiras for double room. It was hard to find a decent and available hotel in the area on a Saturday. Stayed in the area for one night to get our Covid tests before the Nicaragua border crossing. Would recommend for a stopover.

name: Bips fuel station
description:
We got this great tip from a local so wanted to share it with our community. Saturday is the day for Sopa Marinara( seafood soup) but they have different  specials every day of the week plus baleadas etc.  
The soup was absolutely delicious and full of shrimp, lobster and white fish. It comes with a side of white rice and 2 tortillas for 199L. ( $10 CAD). 
You can also buy a craft  beer here for 35L or spend 21-28L for the local stuff.  
The bathrooms are spotless and you can fuel up if you need it.  
A great local tip.

name: Guanaja Backpackers Hostel
description: Beautiful and remote little Hostel right next to the beach. They offer dorm beds for 15$, but also a private cabin for 25$ or a house with its own kitchen for 50$. Not much around and the next shops, etc, are in 15 min walking distance. They have plenty of animals, dogs, cats, rabbits and chickens. So if you are travelling with a dog, you are more than welcome. Plenty of activities to do. Just give Aaron the owner a call/what's app and ask for more information

name: ATM Atlantida
description: There is an ATM next to the supermarket, that didn't charge a withdrawal fee with our DKB credit card. Other banks in Honduras charge up to 7 USD.

name: Restaurante Monte Verde
description: Great food at this place. Pescados. Meals for about $230 + taxes. Shy with foreigners, but nice owners. Beautiful view of the lake. Lots of fies though.

name: Ixbalanque Spanish School
description:
A really nice Spanish school in central Copan. 1 on 1 classes with enough classrooms for bigger groups as well. They used to have exchange programs and partner universities in Switzerland, Finnland, the US and all over a few years back, but when travel warnings hit for Honduras they sadly lost that. The owners Kathy and Amadea are awesome, super friendly and chatty.

We, me and my wife, did 2 weeks here and really improved a lot. They had a lot of different learning games to break up the theory. 

They also offer homestays, which we didn't do. They also have space where we could have parked our motorbikes if we didn't already have a Hotel with parking. My teacher, Sarah, also told me that people with Vans or RVs used to stay in their rigs on the gated Parking next to the school, so worth asking for all you van people ( i attached a photo of the parking area).

Can really recommend it. Here's the phone number of Kathy in case you want to pre-arrange stuff (whatsapp too): +504 9684-6363

price was 160 USD pP regular per week, but discounts might be available.

As I said, highly recommended, great people and a nice small city to learn some spanish (and drink some good beer with a german style brewery and loads of restaurants selling Paulaner)

name: Restaurante Finca Real
description:
Stopped here for lunch after crossing the border from El Salvador.

The food is good but there is too much fried stuff and not enough veggies.

Not far off the main road, overlooking a dam. Nice place. The place looks relatively new/modern, has WiFi and takes cars payments (when the WiFi works). 

Overall clean and we'll maintained.

name: Varietal Coffee Roasters
description:
Best specialty coffee shop we have tried in our 11 months of travel from the United States to here. I used to work as a specialty coffee roaster in Brazil and am constantly looking for quality beans to try in every country we pass through.

They use 87.5+ coffee beans sourced from 13 farmers. If you value specialty coffee and don’t mind paying the extra premium for it, this place is amazing. David and the baristas know what they are doing. Best coffee we’ve had in a long time. Plus, the place is cute, awesome seating outside, and pet friendly.

name: Donde Samir
description: Fruit and veggie stand with lots of fresh fruit and veggies. Good prices.

name: Cajero / ATM
description:
Right near the park in a small hut. Did not charge a withdrawal fee on my card. 

Had to enter the card multiple times and it wouldn't read it.

name: DHL - Drone Shipping
description:
Huge DHL building, hard to miss. Locked gate with security.

They accept drones, no need to hide this. They also need to check the contents anyway. 

You can ship your drone to Costa Rica, Panama, or anywhere else in the world :)

You need a passport, delivery address, phone number for the person receiving it, your phone number, and email.

You can pay all the fees by card.

name: Water at Uno
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description does not state that water is potable. Use caution.

Water tap near each gas pump where you can connect your own hose. Most connectors are damaged. We found a working one at the pump closest to the price pylon.

We had issues getting water at other gas stations as the connector is different.

Staff very friendly and helpful.

name: La Casona Del Valle
description:
La Casona Del Valle is a popular restaurant with parking in the back.

If you eat at the restaurant, you can spend the night for free. They accept cards in case you are running low on cash.

Pleasant temperatures.

Toilets only.

name: CasaVerde Ojojona
description:
Backyard offers the perfect spot for you to pitch your tent and immerse yourself in the great outdoors... Ojojona is at an altitude of 1350 meters above sea level, very pleasant climate.

Please send a message before arriving +504 8755-3383

name: La Moskitia Ecoaventura
description:
They have 3 big tents with each 2 beds inside for 8$ pP. Nice jungle setting, could park the motorbikes behind the gate and also did a rafting trip here for 35$pP. All rafting tours, even the other companies, start from right here. There's a common area with tables, showers and wifi. Good value for a nice spot on the river.

also a good homepage: https://lamoskitia.hn

should contact them first via whatsapp. we just showed up unannounced so took them a bit of time and scrambling to get a tent ready, which was cool for us, but better to contact them first.

name: Clinica Veterinaria Centaurus
description: We had our dog spayed here. Very good service and we heard from many people and the shelter in Utila that Dr. Calderon is the best in La Ceiba.

name: IHTT Regional del Litoral Atlántico
description:
The parking lot at the ferry was far too expensive, so we asked the company IHTT Regional del Litoral Atlántico if we could park our van here for a while because our plan was to go to Utila.
Marco Contreras, the head of the company, speaks some English. We paid 50 Lempiras a day and stayed on Utila for even 5 weeks. He's not there every day, but you can reach him here: +504-9476-6375

Update 20.01.2024: 150 Lempiras a day

Safe travels :)

name: Jardin Deleden
description: The car mechanic where I was getting the car repaired advised me that I should come here. A beautiful cypress garden largest in central america. It was too late in the evening, so they were closed and they did not allow camping. Starting in october they will allow camping

name: Agua Termales turn off main rd
description: This is the spot were you make left turn to Agua Termales. Google Map takes you straight. During rain may need AWD as few spots has steep grades

name: terrapez restaurant
description: Great restaurant for lunch or dinner. Right next to Jardin de eledin. Fresh caught  fish fried and served. great good and views. Main dish $8-10/entre.

name: Sophia Ranch
description: Beautiful place to campout for the night and enjoy the beauty of the place. They have a coffee shop and restaurant. I asked for overlanding camping and was told they charge $30 for the night. little stiff price but worth it.

name: villa san Antonio centro
description: Beautiful town center that you must see it's beauty. only got to know it when my local amigo brought me here

name: Park water faucet
description: public water faucet that has water available after 4:00 pm. Lot of the locals were filling their water containers

name: Flores park
description: You can stay here for overnigbbbvbvht. iI stayed here. My friend Carlos lives right across the street. His phone number is ..... He does not speak English but is a great resource to help out. His house is 2 storey next to the water tap. I have a photo. photo. He took me all around  sightseeing.b. bvx

name: Baleadas
description: Here you will find a small, cheap restaurant with delicious Baleadas. Hanita's welcome is incredible, she is an adorable woman. The passion fruit juice is excellent. I highly recommend.

name: Las Grutas
description: Historical church on the hill. Great views of the city if you can get to the top

name: water tap in historic square
description: Clean water tsp is available  for washing and drinking. It's  pretty tranquil here. You could boondock  here too.

name: Island springs
description: Agua purificada where you can bought a refill of your garafon for 30L.

name: Rock Harbor Canal
description: If you come to the island with your kayak, or if you rent one, the trip to the Rock Harbor Canal is truly wonderful. It is a channel in the middle of the mangrove that allows you to cross the island and reach Rock Harbor. It measures about 2.5km, in places it is really not wide at just 1.5m and 50cm deep. Don't forget your mosquito repellent if you want to survive! At Rock Harbor it is possible to snorkel along the coral reef.

name: Escuela Ojojona
description:
We spent 2 nights here at the school gate, very quiet and the people were very friendly. during the day school hours noisy but afterwards very quiet
Pasamos 2 noches acá en la puerta de la escuela, muy tranquilo y la gente muy amistosa. en el día horario de escuela ruidoso pero después muy tranquilo

name: Black Coral Wall Dive Site
description: We came here by kayak to snorkel.  The seabed is really beautiful!  There are lots of corals and fish.  The depth goes from 5m to about twenty meters, the visibility is excellent.

name: Celaque  National Park Ticket office
description: Here you pay the ticket for the entrance. cost is 120L. Do not forget to take the map.

name: Moon Hole Dive Buoy
description: Around this place the seabed is wonderful! There is a drop-off that coral has colonized. Thousands of fish of all colors have made it their habitat. We came here with a kayak before jumping into the water.  If you're lucky you might see eagle rays and maybe sharks. To find your way around, nothing could be simpler, as soon as you see a white dot, it is a mooring anchor for divers' boats, here is the drop-off.

name: Mirador - BICI Canopy
description: This is the parking area for the locals to see the Mirador. In the evening, lots of young people on weekends stop over to chill out. it can get loud on weekends. It is perfectly safe. The police do rounds every couple of hours. They stopped and said HI to me. No problems staying here. Jorge is the Adventure park attendant and Lois is the night guard attendant. They can keep an eye out for you too.

name: Plaza Libertad Historic centro
description: Main square of the town. Gazebo  in center has a tourist  office that can provide you a map. Cathedral is next door too.

name: El Cafe de la Velas
description: If you are coffee lover this is the place for you. it's  considered  to be best coffee in the town. on Sunday it was closed

name: Taller Guerra
description:
Great auto mechanic. I met him by chance at the Mirador while he was visiting with his family. He was very interested in my car build-up. I asked him what he did, and he told me he had a car repair shop. I told him I needed the differential  and transfer case oil changed. He told me to come over on Monday. I went there and he immediately took care of my needs. Really did a great job. On a 4runner, front and back differential  and transfer case oil change cost me 2100L. 
great shop, can take care if your repair needs.

name: Hacienda Montecristo
description: Beautiful  Hacienda where you can do lot of activities and also campout at night. Car or RV camping is 200L per night. They have zipline, coffee tours, farm and horse riding. it's  a very popular  place with the locals. I am surprised it was not posted on IOverlander. Restaurant  has great food too. Great coffee. They grow their own coffee

name: Hacienda Montecristo Mirador camping
description: Hacienda allows camping for the overlanders. You can camp at the Mirador. There may not be parking more than 2 cars but on the way up there are turnouts where you .ay be able to park and campout. The views are gorgeous. Car/Van camping 200L/night.

name: Gas Station  El Paso
description: The gas station is about twenty minutes from jaguar resort. The resort did not let me stay overnight. They do not allow overnight stays anymore. It was getting late on the way back, so I decided to pull in here. Really nice and tranquil night not much traffic. They were really nice about staying overnight. No charge at all. In the morning I did not leave until twelve. Great place to stay

name: Agua Paradise
description: Agua Purificada in the courtyard of a building, garafon costs 25L.

name: Street Parking Pulperia Ebenezer
description:
Parked by the street for a couple of nights. I asked couple of folks and pulperia lady, and they indicated it was all safe, no problems at all. Also, around the corner, there's a spot identified on ioverlander also had positive comments.
Tomorrow, I will park at that spot since it is not on Main Street and it is very quiet there. Here, it was a little bit traffic noise and also in adjacent house there was a dog barking quite a bit. 
The road is flat that is a plus too.

name: Cruz Roja Hondureña
description: Red Cross, they let us camp after the security guard call the president. Toilet, wifi and safe place wifi guard 24h. Water available not sure if it's potable.

name: Mayan Hill Resort and Mariposa farm
description: Nice hotel and restaurant where you can either stay overnight or make a day visit. You can spend a day and use pool for 300L. If you only want to see Mariposa farm, it's 100L. Nice place to spend the day. In the price a lunch and drink is included.

name: Veleros Restaurant
description: Great restaurants where my host that I met at Amgelis garden brought me. Great food. prices are 250-400L range

name: El Merendon La Coca Cola
description: This is the Mirador  where there are few tienda to chill out and have cold drinks after about 2.5 km road hike. You can only walk here. You park tge car by entrance. I am adding that to ioverlander  too

name: Sendero Merendon
description: This is the entrance to the trail. There is a guard at tge gate who only always locals who live in the neighborhood to pass. You must park on the street and walk to the top. Hike is mostly on road that has been closed to traffic.

name: Hondurena club Arabe
description:
Only members are allowed to use the facilities. There are swimming pool,Tennis courts, restaurant and a social club. A really top-notch facility. 
As a tourist, you are allowed to use the facility. If you have a valid Honduras visa. They do check the passport make sure you take the passport with you.

name: Angeli's Garden duchess for overlanders
description: Here is the location where the bathroom are if you are camping at this place. I have taken photos in sequence that will guide you where to walk. It’s  behind the Jungla bar. You need to go around to the back. if you arr facing thebar sign outside, look to your right for the handicap sign.

name: Angeli's Garden water fountains
description: If you're camping out at this beautiful place, this is the location where the water fountain is. I understand this water is Portable. use your judgement.

name: Corrupt Police
description: They tried to tell us we crossed a straight line to pass somebody (there were orange cones ON the straight line so impossible to pass anybody). We didn’t have a copy of our licence so we had to give the real one. He also told us that our drivers licence was not legal here. He told us the fine was 100USD

name: Rawacala Cascada
description: This is the Cascada that you hike upto from the Ticket booth. It's  about 10 min.hike. There is a good restaurant that you can eat and chill

name: Rawlaca parking lot camping
description: You can go to the waterfall and stay overnight in the parking lot. I did not stay but they allow it. Just keep in mind the gate to the lit. loses at 6 pm.

name: San Fernando Fort
description: Beautiful fort. The fee for tourists is 250L.  Locals 60L.

name: By Tiki Bar
description: Great place to campout for the night. Nice and secure. On the weekend it may get busy.  Mosquitos at night can be an issue

name: End of street beach access
description: Parked here for the night. Great depot.  Beach access. Nice and quiet  at night.

name: Posto de Saúde
description: i needed a doctor and everybody here were very nice. Natalia Rodas and the Dr Samuel Garcia were kind and very helpfull. they said that the comunid is very happy to see people the all world. In front of the escuela.

name: Boats tours Punta Sal
description:
This is the place where you need to be between 7-8 am on the morning to catch a boat tour to Punta Sal National Park. Generally, a private or group tour is leaving. They may be able to tag you. For me the cost was 700L. You must take drinks with you as the beer is really expensive (90L) Lunch can cost you 300-450L 
The local tour operators: Garifuna Tours, Eco di Mare Tours and Tela Dive Center. (Only Garifuna Tours responded to my request but no luck with tour schedule) I went to Sherwood hotel at 7 am.  I was able to hook up with Jesua with Arrecifes tours (whatsapp +504 9213 5411. Every morning a couple of boats leave. Another person's name is Brian. Hit him up +50497878947. 
There is also Kiosk at Ensenada Beach Resort where you can make a reservation.
If you park in hotel secure parking lot, it’s 150L for the day. Across tge hotel gated lot only charges 100L

name: Parking lot
description: You can leave yiur car for day here while you go to Punta Sal NP on a boat tour. The cost was 100L.

name: Marco" property
description:
Marcos is a great guy where you can park your car in his house or adjacent lot. He charges 100L or what you are capable  of paying. 
Really knows a lot about town. He can also give you a town tour and what to see.  
He speaks good English and stays between Tela and Charlotte, NC.
Right now, the adjacent lot is not mowed but he mows it for the guests. 
A really gem of a person

name: Electronica La Universal
description: This is Best Buy of Tela. All electronic goods you can buy here. I had an issue with my fan. Bought a repl. one here. They take credit cards too

name: laundry Sun
description: Great place to get the same day laundry done.

name: Nayely Copias (copy shop)
description: Nice print shop. You can email your documents, and they can print for you. You can also, WhatsApp the document  to +504 9363-8915. Theie email address is Fotcopiasnayely38@gmail.com. Please send them thre message in Spanish.

name: Street Parking
description: Wide dead-end street where you can wild camp in Tela. It's a hike from Tela but a great place to stay overnight. Stayed here 3 nights. You can swim in the ocean while also keeping an eye on the car. At the end of the street with Calle 9, there are security cameras mounted. Asked a couple of locals. It's all good to stay. Local kids may show up to park their bikes for soccer play on the beach.

name: Maxi Despensa
description: Grocery store with wide selection of goods

name: Uno gas station
description: Tap water available to cennect your hose to fill the tank. Not sure if its is Potable.

name: Antonio bidy shop
description:
If your car needs body work this is the shop you need to bring your car here. please talk to Antonio. Julio, or Virgilio. Vee speaks good english
 They did an outstanding job on my car rust repair

name: Cotan
description:
Best seafood soup in the world.  Chef Trejo is very competent and dedicated.  If you are lucky enough to meet the owners Marcos and Claudia then you will be in heaven.  The environment is super pleasant and beautiful.

La mejor sopa de mariscos del mundo.  Chef Trejo es muy competente y dedicado.  Si tienes la suerte de conocer a los propietarios Marcos y Claudia, estarás en el cielo.  El ambiente es súper agradable y hermoso.

name: Cotan
description:
Chalets of all sizes in the middle of the forest... everything is very well maintained, clean and has several sanderos and a beautiful garden.

Chalets de todos los tamaños en medio del bosque... todo está muy bien cuidado, limpio y tiene varios sanderos y un precioso jardín.

name: Cocalito Beach
description: This is the beach where all the boat stop for food and snorkeling at Punta Sal NP. After first driving by and outting irder for food at the restaurant for lunch they will stop at the hiking trailhead. After the hiking they will stip here for 2-3 hours so you can eat lunch, swim and snorkel. When I was there, not many fish we saw during snorkeling. Food was good.

name: Iglesia em Yamaranguila e Dilce
description: Small and beautifull place. I ate at Dilce restaurante.

name: Mirador Cascada Santa Lucia
description: Trail dificult medio. The altitude increasis almost a lot so is a little hard to get there. Beautiful

name: Coconut puff shop
description: Famous Honduras coconut bread you can buy at this shop. Lucy speaks great English. Each pastry cost 12L.

name: Glenda's paradise thermal baths
description: These are decent thermal bath to spend an afternoon. They open at 8am and close at 5 pm. Tgey do not allow overnight stay. It costs 100L per person/day. They were cleaning when I got there. I left.

name: playa Capiro
description: If you have a 4x4 you can spend the day and camp here. Beautiful dead end provides street access to the ocean. RV and big rig will not be able to turn around. Only RTT and vans. If

name: Playa Trujillo
description:
Came here for lunch and ended up staying here. Its  a public beach and s restaurant close by. On weekends they may have the music too loud. until late. It was quiet on the week days. 
If the music is loud you can take the dirt drive far away and park on playa.

name: Guaymoreto mongrove tours
description:
This is the place where you can rent a kayak or go solo or with a group in a power boat to see mongrove.
You need to get hold of Carlos. The solo power boat he quoted me the price of 1500L. If you need the Kayak, you can rent for 250-300L(at least that is what he quoted me). The boat trip can take up to an hour. 
Carlos phone number is whatsapp +50499505182. You can safely park your car here too

name: Near Hidden Beach
description: Stayed all day here and enjoyed the views. Nice and Tranquil. It's  pretty safe. Local showed in evening and had music on. on the weekend  it may get littke loud. not sure. Great views though

name: La Sirena
description: Beautiful river near the principal street you pay just $1.42  per person and you can access the place. Not for a low cars but you can walk just a few meters to access.

name: La Hamaca Hostel
description: A good and cheap hostel to stay in Utila. It is just 5 min. walk from the Dream Ferry boat dock. Air condition dorm rooms are $23 plus tax. In October  it really is unbearable hot in non-airconditon rooms. No kitchen but adjacent restaurant Pink Flamingo has great food.

name: Banco Atlántida ATM
description: Banco Atlántida charges you 1usd (24lemp)per withdrawal fee with your US Checking account.

name: Mall biggest mall in town
description: Biggest mall in town if you need to find anything this is the place we need it a charger we found it in RadioShack.

name: Estación 0703
description: Very good, nice and calm place with garden full of greenery, no noise from the street. Good prices, very friendly people working there, we asked for rice and beans with salad even though they didn't have it in the menu they were happy to make us happy! ))

name: Puma
description:
Great place to spend the night in Talanga. Very clean, many shops, large parking area behind where you can park for free!
24 hr security guards on site! Very friendly and safe

name: Paid Parking Central park
description: Ypu can park here to go and see central park. Attendant is always here

name: Monumento La Paz
description: La Paz monument overlooking the city. Great views. 30L entrance fee at the gate.

name: Hotel Fernando’s
description: Budget hotel with moto/car parking, fast wifi, and friendly proprietors. Warm shower, fan (no a/c in my room), and food available. Paid 500L for one.

name: La Ceiba
description: Free parking by the water. Great to spend the night, safe, friendly police

name: PROGAS
description: here we were able to fill our gas bottle.  easy to park in front, we waited 10 minutes. perfect. 20LBS / 200 Lempira

name: El Gauchito Grill
description:
Argentinian/Honduran restaurant, great food and prices!
Huge breakfast baleadas for 2 bucks. We had milanesas that we’re very yummy!

name: Parque Central de Siguatepeque
description: Great place! We spent two nights here on the street  next to the main park, very friendly people, very safe!

name: Samona's Kitchen
description: Excellent local place with cheap prices for the island. two meals for 240L

name: hotel aurora
description: single rooms for 300lempiras. not bad option for raining days

name: free camping
description: free camping site in front of Marino restaurant, they have a guard in the night and made it safe for camping. if you order something in the restaurant they let you get a shower and use de toilette, so nice and cheap option

name: Gps problem and dangerous road
description:
This is the correct road to arrive to Santa Rosa, Google Maps say other road but is closed (by a fence). 

Also here were murder a military police, so is full of police, dense controls and not really good atmosphere....

name: Hostal las Marías, keep away
description:
the worst hostel I've ever been, keep away from here for you health. Poop  in the toilet, blood in the sheets, cockroaches Eveywhere, smeel to humit.

also 400lempiras for this f*** sh**

name: free and safe
Lavanderia Colon
description: Friendly lavanderia; had my stuff ready in 3 hours; 300 lempiras for two bin bags worth. All good!

name: La Colada
description: auto-washing place. little 140HNL. Big 160HNL. Drier 80HNL. WiFi.

name: La Lomita
description: Nothing to shout about, but a quiet street next to a little hill park with a nice view, flat-ish spot under an overhanging tree. Cafe staff recommended I come here and said it was guarded, but I don't think that's the case; the park is closed and locked at night and I didn't see anyone. I spent a couple of peaceful nights though, while trying to get to the bottom of the 'lluvia de peces' the town is known for. Wish I could come back in May/June to try and see it for myself!

name: piscinas Rancho los carretos
description: Very nice place to swim, with restaurant . We sleep here for free. very secure

name: Taller Dimas
description:
Awesome mechanic! Super nice guy! Resolved my problem in half an hour after another mechanic told me the engine was messed up!
He will come where you are! I was stranded on the side of the road!
His name is Rigo, WhatsApp:
+504 3179 3984

name: La Cabaña de Mamá Nico
description:
EN - Cozy, quiet and friendly campsite. My cousin and I went by motorcycle and enjoyed a wonderful time at this location. We paid 300 Lps (12 USD) for a two-person tent next to a bonfire. Food at the restaurant was hand-made, delicious and cheap. There's a swimming pool and it's next to two beautiful waterfalls. The two families that run the camp are incredibly nice and detail-oriented. Their kids are super funny and talkative. Definitely a highlight of our journey.
----------------------------------
ES - Camping acogedor, tranquilo y agradable. Mi primo y yo fuimos en moto y la pasamos de maravilla. Pagamos 300 Lps (12 USD) por una tienda para dos personas al lado de una hoguera. La comida en el restaurante era casera, deliciosa y barata. Hay una piscina y está al lado de dos preciosas cascadas. Las dos familias que llevan el campamento son increíblemente agradables y detallistas. Sus hijos son muy divertidos y simpáticos. Sin duda fue de los lugares favoritos durante nuestro viaje.

name: old and "abandoned" Bosques de Zambrano
description: old country club that isn't in use anymore since the pandamic. Leonardo the nightguard called his boss and we were allowed to stay overnight. they have pools, soccer and basketball fields, tennis courts, palapas with fireplaces and wood, restaurant, a little train and even a replica of Copan but ALL is abandoned now and nature is taking over again. toilets are available but without water and a bit dirty since nobody use or cleans them. we could easily walk around and explore everything, nobody bothered us. wild horses running free and from our campspot we had an incredible view over the valley. electricity only available at the entrance with the guards. Claro works fine they didn't ask for but we gave them 200 L. You can also park in front of the gates, as nobody use them anymore. it's really quite. Such an amazing stay!

name: RN39 - Nicely Paved
description:
The RN39 running for almost 200km between Telica in the South and Corocito in the North close to Trujillo, is paved all the way and in a very good condition. Only some potholes as usual!
Most recent maps are indicating this south-north connection to Trujillo as an unpaved dirt road, but it is now one of the best roads in Honduras, also the scenery through the mountains and small villages is beautiful.
Enjoy the trip!

name: Clinica Veterinaria Maskotas
description:
Veterinario Ramón Eduardo Osorio. 
We came here for the papers for our dog to cross into Nicaragua (350l).
This seems to be a good vet, many people waiting with their pets.
If you need a FAVN to travel to the US or Europe, he will give you a contact in Tegucigalpa.

name: Rony Auto electric
description:
Rony is the best electrician in Honduras, with a large and orderly electrical workshop, he fixed the 12v refrigerator installation for us and helped us solve other electrical problems, very detailed and delicate in his work

Rony es el mejor electrico de honduras, con un amplio y ordenado taller electrico, nos arreglo la instalacion de 12v del refrigerador y nos ayudo a resolver otros problemas electricos, muy detallista y delicado en su trabajo

name: Houseboat & RV park
description:
RV park & Houseboat.
It's a place with good friends, good vibes, secure no restrictions for the large of your motor home 
Also, we have tours for the Bay of San Lorenzo, fireplace,  fishing nights in the Houseboat

name: El Chircal archaeological site
description: Tiny little site, free entry, nobody there - just one small pyramid as far as I could see, plus a possible sacrificial stone. I wouldn't go out of your way to get here but it's worth a short detour if passing. Keep your eyes to the ground and you'll find a tonne of ceramic fragments all over!

name: Al Sazón de Vanessa
description:
it was one of the first places that allowed credit card payment without a 15% surcharge. which war important for me who didn't exchange money.

I did like the pollo asado, and the price is very reasonable. there is no beer here

name: Gruta el Gigante
description:
This is the furthest point you can drive to to get to Gruta el Gigante, a small cave about 10 minutes' walk from here through the pines, which has some ancient handprints painted or etched in. You're not allowed to enter the cave but they've built a viewing platform to see from. On the drive in you pass Cascada La Estanzuela, not super dramatic but it's pretty. The river is bathable and the whole area pretty, makes a nice detour. Access road of a few kms from the highway is a little rough in places but not a big deal - keep an eye out for signposts from the highway. 30 lempiras entrance fee, open 8am till 6ish pm
 I asked on the way out - no problem to camp (tents or vehicles) overnight, at no extra cost. Wish I'd known the previous day and stayed there instead of street camping in Marcala - looks to be a super peaceful place to stay, and I bet the stars are amazing on a clear night!

name: Hacienda San Lucas
description:
Hacienda with a nice garden, bar and restaurant overlooking the valley. They also have a trail through the forest that takes you to 'los Sapos'; a handful of rocks, a couple of which are carved into toads and other fertility symbols. The path the leads onto a small, very rural feeling village called La Pintada, which specialises in handmade dolls of corn husks - you can take horseback rides, there's apparently a waterfall to visit and a stelle up on top of the hill. Just walking to the village and back via the carvings takes around 45 minutes (there's also an option to take a tuk tuk back if you wish). 

150 lempiras for adults and kids of 11 and up, 50l for kids of 5-10.

name: El Lugar de Té & Chocolate
description:
Speciality tea and chocolate place with a very nice ambiance. Lots of delicious goodies for sale, including preserves and salsas, soaps and lotions, as well as desserts, teas and hot and cold chocolate. Fairly pricey for some things, very for others (eg from 70 lempiras for hot chocolate, 85 for a brownie with ice cream, 210 for a 120g bar of chocolate) but all delicious. Tasters available! 

Open only between 2pm and 6pm.

name: Inversiones Sabino’s
description: I can only recommend this car repair shop.  Sabino and his team are trying very hard to get the repair done as quickly as possible.  Communication in English is also no problem.  I was here to have a new control unit installed.  I had already gotten the replacement part.  I was there with my T6 Transporter 4Motion.

name: Aramecina (center in front of the park)
description: I decided to park here after driving many hours. I parked right in front of the city centre under a light and felt quite safe. People are quite nice and friendly. a bit noisy with the music playing as there is a Feria this week but it was OK

name: Propane fill up near waterfalls
description:
Was looking for the propane next to the comedor and some locals pointed me this way. 
Was able to fill up my 30lbs us tank with no problem. 
360 lempiras

name: pan artesanal
description: great small bakery with different sour dow breads (pan de masa madre) baguette and pastery

name: Hotel Villa Concha Mar
description: Hotel with 35 rooms and secure parking for cars and motos, behind a big gate. A double room with private bathroom and AC cost 1,000 (around $40) though he asked initially for 1,200. Has a pool but it is filthy. Not the cleanest or nicest rooms, but fine for a night between borders.

name: Naval Base
description: Now the only working ATM on the island is in a Honduran Naval Base. Drive to the entrance and ask permission and they should let you in! A funny experience but necessary for cash!

name: Urbanización sin construir
description:
place near Catacama, with easy access to the road and without complications. They can go to the back to be more isolated and avoid the noise of the cars
---
lugar cerca a Catacama, con acceso fácil a la carretera y sin complicaciones. pueden irse hasta el fondo para quedar más aislado y evitar el ruido de los carros

name: el boqueron
description: gas station for a night. stayed on a grassy flat parking, so maybe also possible for tents. nothing special but close to the entrance to the Monumento Natural el boqueron. we left the car next day here while we visited the park. need to ask for WiFi password in the shop.

name: Cascada La Estanzuela
description:
The perfect spot for Overlanders, next to this beautiful waterfall. Lots of place for any vehicle to camp or to pitch your tent.
There are several camping fields along the river .
The dirt road to the payment point is only somewhat rough at the beginning but further on in descent shape.
Pay 100 L at the tienda (14.21455 -88.05665) and get the key for the gate to enter the road that brings you to the Cascada and Caves.
The 100 L also includes price for camping.
There are limited amenities at the camp spot, outside the weekend you’re probably alone for camping and swimming. Very quiet and cools down at night to 14C.
Easy walk to the Caves from the camp / parking place.
There are simple toilets with “bucket flush”, cold showers and waste bins. Also some covered picnic places.
Recommended

name: Villa Finca Santa Martha
description:
It is a Finca de Cacao. They offer cacao tours on their property that end with the taste of a cup of chocolate. It is 100% natural as all of their products are, which are highly recommended. It is very close to the canal( 1 min walk) that leads into the lago. The finca rents also kayaks. Los Naranjos is also in walking distance. 
They rent cabanas as well as spaces for tent campers on the grass. RVs and big rigs can park outside the property just at the entrance. The whole place is safe! The access road is good, even for city cars. Wifi is available, but not at the remote areas. Electricity is available everywhere. They have a restaurant, which offers a small variety of local food. 
For tent campers the price is 100 lempiras/night and per person.

name: Parque Nacional Capiro y Calentura
description:
Detachment Ministry Special Forces Parque Nacional  de trujillo Colon passing by the Hotel Viejo Billa Brinqui

 Destamento Ministerio Fuerzas Especiales Parque Nacional  de trujillo Colon derecho pasando por el Hotel Viejo Billa Brinqui

name: Loma Vista
description:
basic and cheap accomodation with private rooms and shared bathrooms and a small kitchen. the owner speaks English, is very friendly, native and accommodating. we (2p) paid 300L/night for a private room with ventilator. nothing fancy but we enjoyed our stay and can recommend it. you support a local family not like in all these dive shops at the coast with incognito owners.
you can contact Maradell by WhatsApp +504 3217-5776

name: Tamarindo hostel
description: Has parking for motorcycles inside locked gate and space outside to park. Paid 1000L for 2 of us in a private room which had a double and a set of bunks. They also have dorms

name: autogas con adaptador
description:
autogas with tank adapter cash only
 
autogas con adaptador para tanque, solo efectivo, no tiene tienen gas

name: Taller de Mecánica Jersson
description:
Jersson Is an excellent mechanic. He replaced my Nox sensors and regenerated the system on my Silverado diesel in no time.
  
No bs, very professional and good prices

name: Motos only
description: There is a big flat enough space to pitch tents close to the road but you have to get around a burm. Easy on a motorcycle but no chance with a vehicle. Hidden enough from traffic going by and none going by at night anyway. Can catch a good sunrise too

name: Parqueo
description: Not a lot of options in the city but stumbled on this unmarked parqueo.  Open 24/7.  Happy for me to sleep in the vehicle.  Not entirely flat but fine for me.  Short walk to Parque Central.   20L per hour so not cheap but less than a hotel, especially one with secure parking.  No height limit but watch your route here - Google Maps sent me up one short but very steep road and narrow streets of the old town.  Surprisingly quiet for a city centre location.

name: Break in
description:
parked here for 1h30 and came back to our vehicle and the door lock was drilled.

be careful when leaving your vehicle alone in this city

name: Fuel Gas Station
description: New gas station "UNO".. very kindly personal.. now in construction (80%) but funcionaly.. baths and shower

name: Balneario Vista Real
description:
Family friendly swimming pool complex , restaurant and hotel. Kindly let me camp out back after accepting my offer of 200lempira. 

i ate excellent fish, cooled off in the river and felt well looked after and safe.

name: Sea Watch Restaurant & Bar
description: Kindly allowed me to camp after I said I’d eat. Beautiful spot by the sea. Quiet night when I was here (Thursday) but they do have live music at weekends which could be louder. Still recommend the spot though. Not bad food too!

name: Centro Turistico El Manantial
description: Christian kindly let me camp overnight at his family-run swimming pool & gardens. Beautiful spot and super friendly people!

name: Parquet Municipal Guasaule
description:
They put my straight back from the office by the machines. $5 USD (solo female traveler) 
24/7 security, 2-3 armed at all times. Actually, there was a man at my truck all night. 
Sleep just isn’t going to be great. Trucks in and out all night, but it’s best to get up early and head to the border. 
There is one restaurant and one bar on site, which is nice.

name: Nacimiento Pulhapanzak
description:
Awesome water spring, blue and clear water coming up from a big and deep hole. Perfect spot for swimming and dive. Moreover, you can sleep here for "free" in hammock or tent.

To arrive you need to go to Balneario Pozo Azul and pay 60L, from there you need to walk 20min to arrive, be careful there are 2 path and in the longest you have to pay 30L in the short no. Once in the place I man ask for 30L for cleaning the spot. A local told me that there is a path that you can use that is free, I didn't find it.

I spent 2 nights here, in the weekend, not to much people, only a few coming and leaving fast. nights are completely relaxing.

name: Canal los Naranjos
description: In all the area of the Canal is possible to sleep, is a public place, but if you feel safer, you can pay to any kayak spot 100L for kayak and area to sleep near by the night guard

name: Pulhapanzak spring - trailhead
description:
here start the trail to the spring, you don't need to pay in balneario pozo azul. just follow these trail, you'll have to across the river, but is not deep and there are wire to help. These trail is more beautiful than the other.
Check the photos if you have doubts.
I added it also in Google maps.

name: Kike automotriz
description: Excellent mechanical workshop. All kinds of vehicles.

name: Casa de Joel
description:
A boy named Joel welcomed us here, it is a small piece of land in front of his house in a residential area, very safe, and Joel is a very friendly boy who likes to help travelers with whatever they need, It is necessary to notify him by phone since he works and so he can receive you at his home tel: +50432680833

aqui nos recibio un chico llamado Joel, es un pequeño terreno frente a su casa en un coto residencial, muy seguro, y Joel es un chico muy amable que le gusta y ayudar viajeros en lo que necesites, 
es necesario avisarle por telefono ya que trabaja y para que pueda recibirte en su casa tel: +50432680833

name: ATM international
description: Can get money with international card. MC and Visa. Easy and safe place

name: Hotel Patuca (economico)
description:
Very basic place, motel style. If you want something kick and cheap to pass the night, it’s good. Shared shower and bathroom.
Don’t expect any comfort but for 200L, it’s good :)

name: D‘La Paz
description:
it’s a mirador with pretty nice view of the city 
They have water and toilet- nothing fancy 
Calm vibes & nice breeze 
Def has a 4x4 filter. Low gear was a big help. In Rainy season will easy be a 3
You in the Chevy van: You can do it ofc 😅
* it is a private ground but the Don made it for the public so it is okey to cross the gate  just tell The caretaker, he lives right side of the road

name: 4x4 scenic ride
description: amazing experience through the whole way - small villages, nice people and the finca el Roberto has a beautiful cascada with pools the cool down (30L)

name: the cliff
description:
crazy ride -only 4x4- but the end is on the Cliff for amazing sunset!
first gate is for the animals 
second gate is for registration to cross the windturbines
third gate (on the left after 100ish m) is for the animals too
… and after that you can camp and climb OR you drive up to the cliff (serious tilt and diff loc) but totally doable! Have fun!
(The road is from Sabana Larga and not from the gas station >> no maps shows the way until the top but the path is there- used from locals as well or ask us on IG for help)

name: abandoned cross
description: we were looking for a decent place and found this valley looking abandoned ruins with a cross on the path- nothing fancy but good spot for a small camp

name: Rio Frio
description: Small flat areas next to the river- both sides are good for camping. Road is 4x4, water is chill, locals are nice, total sunny and good view of north sky.

name: The „best camp“ ever
description: we found the view from the photo „el chorrera“ best camp ever- idk why is the entry on the gated other side but this one here is nice, available and calm- without any kind of adventure except you come from the cascada (Rio Frio) side… than it is carnage

name: Pico Bonito - Desvio a Rio Zacate
description:
Take this exit from CA13, named "Desvio a Rio Zacate", in Google Maps, in order to reach the Pico Bonito entrance.
Follow the gravel road until reaching a few houses and a gate. Local persons will collect entry to the park.

name: Pico Bonito Parking
description:
It is the parking of this Pico Bonito park entrance. Relatively large field, some grass, surrounded by trees.
Weak mobile phone signal. Starlink just okay, with interruptions every few minutes. 
We were allowed to stay with our campervan over night, included in the entrance fee of 300L per person.

name: C.H.F.M.
description:
Military cp with gate on the road direction to the dam El Cajon 
They are controlling the high & capability of the rig idk why pretty easy road
There is a ticket office for extrajeros 80L pp or different types of packages for the day

name: El Cajon Dam
description:
huge hydroelectric power dam
You can walk around- no fear of high pls
The basic ticket includes the thermal pools on the button to chill and the mirador bridge 
(there are different types of entry tickets- choose your favorite)
