name: Dam(n) spot on the river
description:
Before the parqueo from the thermals turn left to the closed gate and honk> you can drive to many spots to camp- we went to the riverside - next to the huge ceiba & stairs 
In the ancient times there were an official campground - if you just explain that you would camp for one night they’ll be fine

name: Crater Babilon
description: Decent spot for all kind of vehicles - lil bit humpy dumpy dirt road from the main highway but chill and quiet grassy field

name: Hacienda El Consuelo
description: Old coffee farm from 1950s located down the guanacaure reserve, surrounded with nature, water creeks, old coffee equipment and drying patio takes you back to that era, have a coffee in the morning produced in the farm. Water available, no phone signal(starlink works), bathrooms see more at the Instagram page @haciendaelconsuelohn Reach out with Joel +504 32680833 to have recomendations before, depending on the season trails may get some offroad fun!

name: Puma gas station / Gasstation info Honduras
description:
When driving from El Salvador to Honduras you’ll encounter many well priced and modern gas stations. . However the last decent gasstation is in Choluteca. 

I thought I would save some money by fueling up further east in Honduras instead of in Nicaragua. However the last 2 gasstations on maps.me before Honduras / Nicaragua border are very old, so there’s big chance they have dirty fuel tanks. 

So fill up between El Salvador and Choluteca!

El Salvador Diesel +- €0,9L 
Honduras Diesel +-€0,92L
Nicaragua Diesel +-€1,12L

name: Cusuco NP
description:
after you left the gate to pay 10$pp (including camp for a couple of days) and the obligatory military checkpoint you gonna find yourself on a very well established & maintained campground of the Panacu with several trails to hike, birds to watch and river to chill (Quetzals are around here but they have pumas, jaguars and lots of other wildlife too)
The road to the NP from SPS is easy 4x4 but check wikiloc if you are unsure 
update: they told us that sometimes they are open only from Friday to Sunday but sometimes it is normal. Various how they work in the forest > it is a active biological park with experts and scientists on 24k hectares

name: Hospedaje San Antonio
description:
Really affordable place, with big secured parking area. It's a bit rundown but prices are low.
the cheapest room with shared bathroom costs only 200l. A regular room with hot water and a/c is 400L. one of the staff is really friendly and wifi is good.

the biggest annoyance is that the door closes at 10pm. And check out is 9 AM. still find place for a night.

name: Cantarranas main square.
description: We spent a night here after crossing the border. It is a small and very quiet town. It parks in the main square, we feel very safe. The square has electricity, drinking water, bathrooms in the mayor's office and there is the police station. The town is very nice, it has many typical graffiti from Honduras!

name: Uno Celaque Gas Station
description: We spent a quite night here after asking the administrator. Initially wanted 100L but managed to spend the night for free on the small parking lot behind the station. Security camera and armed guard present all night from around 8pm.

name: Luna del Puente
description:
Luna del Puente is a private nature reserve with eco-tourist services. There are showers and toilets, restaurant and WiFi. They have different areas for parking your car or the possibility of camping in your own or rented tents. They offer the service with tent and mattresses included. The natural reserve has 3 trails in the forest, 1 viewpoint and a bird watching tower. There is also the possibility of renting rooms.
---
Luna del Puente es una reserva natural privada con servicios eco turísticos. Hay duchas y Sanitarios, restaurante y WiFi. Cuentan con diferentes áreas para el estacionamiento del auto de viaje o la posibilidad de acampar en tienda de campaña propia o alquilada. Ofrecen el servicio con tienda de campaña y colchonetas incluidas. La reserva natural tiene 3 senderos en el bosque, 1 mirador y Torre de Observación de Aves. También la posibilidad de rentar habitaciones.

name: Turicentro Terramar
description: we had an amazing lunch here, try the shrimp quesadilla and the red snap (pargo) so fresh!! and they have the best view with a swimming pool which you can use, what a find! Jorge the owner use to backpack a lot so he got some amazing stories and loves travelers!

name: Turicentro Terramar
description:
We went to Playa Blanca but there is no space to park properly there so we decided to try this restaurant,  and what a find!!!
We slept here one night, we asked to use the parking lot and we consumed some delicious shrimp quesadilla at the restaurant,  we could sleep here for free and use the swimming pool with the nicest view !

it is possible to rent a room here with AC also.

 Jorge, the owner, is the best, he use to backpack all over the world and loves travelers. 

Please let him know that Carol and Thiago from Brazil really enjoyed our time together

name: Isla El Tigre
description:
A small not very touristic island, if you want an horuras experience without going far we recommend this. If you are looking for nice beaches, this is not the place, it's a place where you can see locals, see a bit of history.

We parked the car for 80L for the day and took the boat from Coyolito, the boat costs 15L each way pp, quite cheap, than arriving in the island we took a moto taxi (tuktuk) to go around it, there are many moto taxis available all the time, so we took one to go from El Burro to Amapala, Amapala is the center you can find food, a nice malecon, pier, museum, than we got a moto taxi to Playa grande, Playa prieta, El Zapote (we negociate with them so the value varies from 15L to 25L pp each leg), as I said not pretty beaches, but the vibe there is very nice, we felt like we had an experience there, very very nice locals. We didn't sleep here, went to Terra-Mar restaurant to park and sleep there and enjoy a swimming pool afterwards.

name: Photocopies
description: If you're shipping your drone, this copy shop is right around the corner. I just got, like 12 pages of copies of most of what I might need for the Nicaragua border crossing and it cost me 14 lempira. That's like 50 cents US.

name: Hotel Baruch
description:
Safe and clean hotel for which we paid 900L for a room for 2 people. Room is basic but clean, had AC and fan, and also a small kitchen (microwave, mini fridge, sink), so ideal for people that want to store and prepare food. 

There is ample secure parking. There is a huge gate that is shut at night and lots of security cameras around surveilled by reception. 

Also there is a pool which looks well maintained but we didn’t swim in it.

Edit: We stayed here again on our way back up north. Paid 800L for a room without a small kitchen and still equally as safe and clean. Shower was the best one I’ve had in months - consistently hot with good pressure.

name: Unpaved road
description: A big part of the road is unpaved, I think it‘s better to take the CA13 from La Ceiba -> Trujillo

name: Casa Vieja Hotel y Restaurante
description:
Nice little hotel between the two borders. About 50usd for a private with bathroom, breakfast, and ac included. Gated parking, at least for cars and motorcycles. Solid restaurant on site as well and nice people. 

Not much going on in town, but you can walk ten minutes from the hotel to the shore. Good stopover.

name: Hotel y Restaurante Turicentro La Colina
description:
An excellent place to eat and spend the night. The night with breakfast included 1,000 lempiras. It has a pool and the air-conditioned rooms. It is worth visiting, it has a unique view of the lake

-----

Un excelente lugar para comer y pasar la noche. la noche con desayuno incluido 1,000 lempiras.  tiene picina y las habitaciones con aire acondicionado. Vale la pena visitarlo, tiene una vista única del lago

name: Museo de Antropologia e Historia
description: Great museum in the center of San Pedro Sula. Well curated with information about Honduras and local history. Translations into several languages for most artifacts or topics. Nice and friendly staff.

name: Gas bottles, tanks & cars
description: They filled up my European 12kg bottle for 450L. Quick cash on the spot, no waiting. They also fill other kind of tanks.

name: PUMA GAS (Bambu)
description:
Puma Gas station open from 5:00am to 10:00pm. We asked if we could stay for the night after 2 overpriced parking spot on iOverlander and they said yes with a smile. You have to go to a parking spot where this GPS location is. 

Clean (very clean) cold shower and toilet near the camp spot. 

Also, inside the Bambu store there is a nice little coffee with latte, cappuchino, etc… Bakery and croissant also 😋

FREE CAMP SPOT

name: Sunset Hut Hostel/Overlander Camping
description:
Amazing place to stay. The name has Hostel in it, but don't let that fool you, it has a huge cut lawn area for tents and another huge lawn area just for large land rigs. This place truly has it all.

Restaurant and bar onsite.

Pool and showers.

Right on beach with lots of benches, swings, chairs, etc.

It is newly built and they did everything right. The manager is a great guy named Brian and, like a true Irishman, is a gentleman and a great host.

I only planned one night here but spent three as it was so nice and relaxing.

Just 30 minutes from the GT border.

name: Hotel & Restaurante M &H
description:
Great little hotel near the Honduras/Guatemala border. Room is clean and has AC. Paid 750L for a room for 2 people (which is a lot cheaper than the accomodations we were looking at in Omoa). Secure parking. Restaurant on site opened until 5:00pm. Pool that is well maintained. Cash only. It is on the main road so there is some noise but nothing that will disturb your sleep.

There is a restaurant to the left we went for dinner which was cheap and delicious.

name: Taller de Frenos
description: Taller de Frenos Occifrenos. Buena gente, recomendable, me solucionaron el tema de las pastillas de freno y reacodicionamiento del caliper de freno por 1400 lempiras de mi motorhome MB180 del año 1995. Precio Justo y Razonable.

name: Cafetano Coffee Roasters
description: We needed a place for work and find this nice coffee shop with great coffee, perfect for work and air conditioning 😂. Really recommend if you are a nomad and need internet + good place for work.

name: Uno Gas Station
description: Posto de gasolina Uno com estacionamento para caminhões e segurança 24 horas. Falamos com o segurança, que nos permitiu passar a noite e abriu o banheiro pra gente poder usar. Não cobrou nada e não queria aceitar dinheiro, mas demos um dólar de agradecimento mesmo assim.

name: Hotel posada arcilaca
description: Hotel posada Arcilaca. We ask if we can stay for the night in the parking lot and with a smile they say yes. Very friendly let us use the toilet. Aguas termales (hot spring) within walking distance. Very close to the hotel parking lot. Recommended. You can stay more than one night. No problem. Toilet at the hotel. Shower and toilets at the hot spring.
